verses.part1: BLESSED is the man that hath not walked in the counsel of the ungodly, nor stood in the way of sinners
verses.part2: and hath not sat in the seat of the scornful.

verses.part1: But his delight is in the law of the Lord
verses.part2: and in his law will he exercise himself day and night.

verses.part1: And he shall be like a tree planted by the water-side
verses.part2: that will bring forth his fruit in due season.

verses.part1: His leaf also shall not wither
verses.part2: and look, whatsoever he doeth, it shall prosper.

verses.part1: As for the ungodly, it is not so with them
verses.part2: but they are like the chaff, which the wind scattereth away from the face of the earth.

verses.part1: Therefore the ungodly shall not be able to stand in the judgement
verses.part2: neither the sinners in the congregation of the righteous.

verses.part1: But the Lord knoweth the way of the righteous
verses.part2: and the way of the ungodly shall perish.

verses.part1: WHY do the heathen so furiously rage together
verses.part2: and why do the people imagine a vain thing?

verses.part1: The kings of the earth stand up, and the rulers take counsel together
verses.part2: against the Lord, and against his Anointed :

verses.part1: Let us break their bonds asunder
verses.part2: and cast away their cords from us.

verses.part1: He that dwelleth in heaven shall laugh them to scorn
verses.part2: the Lord shall have them in derision.

verses.part1: Then shall he speak unto them in his wrath
verses.part2: and vex them in his sore displeasure :

verses.part1: Yet have I set my King
verses.part2: upon my holy hill of Sion.

verses.part1: I will preach the law
verses.part2: whereof the Lord hath said unto me, Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee.

verses.part1: Desire of me, and I shall give thee the nations for thine inheritance,
verses.part2: and the utmost parts of the earth for thy possession.

verses.part1: Thou shalt bruise them with a rod of iron
verses.part2: and break them in pieces like a potter's vessel.

verses.part1: Be wise now therefore, O ye kings
verses.part2: be learned, ye that are judges of the earth.

verses.part1: Serve the Lord in fear
verses.part2: and rejoice unto him with reverence.

verses.part1: Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and so ye perish from the right way
verses.part2: if his wrath be kindled, (yea but a little) blessed are all they that put their trust in him.

verses.part1: LORD, how are they increased that trouble me!
verses.part2: many are they that rise against me.

verses.part1: Many one there be that say of my soul
verses.part2: There is no help for him in his God.

verses.part1: But thou, O Lord, art my defender
verses.part2: thou art my worship, and the lifter up of my head.

verses.part1: I did call upon the Lord with my voice
verses.part2: and he heard me out of his holy hill.

verses.part1: I laid me down and slept, and rose up again
verses.part2: for the Lord sustained me.

verses.part1: I will not be afraid for ten thousands of the people
verses.part2: that have set themselves against me round about.

verses.part1: Up, Lord, and help me, O my God
verses.part2: for thou smitest all mine enemies upon the cheek-bone; thou hast broken the teeth of the ungodly.

verses.part1: Salvation belongeth unto the Lord
verses.part2: and thy blessing is upon thy people.

verses.part1: HEAR me when I call, O God of my righteousness
verses.part2: thou hast set me at liberty when I was in trouble; have mercy upon me, and hearken unto my prayer.

verses.part1: O ye sons of men, how long will ye blaspheme mine honour
verses.part2: and have such pleasure in vanity, and seek after leasing?

verses.part1: Know this also, that the Lord hath chosen to himself the man that is godly
verses.part2: when I call upon the Lord he will hear me.

verses.part1: Stand in awe, and sin not
verses.part2: commune with your own heart, and in your chamber, and be still.

verses.part1: Offer the sacrifice of righteousness
verses.part2: and put your trust in the Lord.

verses.part1: There be many that say
verses.part2: Who will show us any good?

verses.part1: Lord, lift thou up
verses.part2: the light of thy countenance upon us.

verses.part1: Thou hast put gladness in my heart
verses.part2: since the time that their corn and wine and oil increased.

verses.part1: I will lay me down in peace, and take my rest
verses.part2: for it is thou, Lord, only, that makest me dwell in safety.

verses.part1: PONDER my words, O Lord
verses.part2: consider my meditation.

verses.part1: O hearken thou unto the voice of my calling, my King and my God
verses.part2: for unto thee will I make my prayer.

verses.part1: My voice shalt thou hear betimes, O Lord
verses.part2: early in the morning will I direct my prayer unto thee, and will look up.

verses.part1: For thou art the God that hast no pleasure in wickedness
verses.part2: neither shall any evil dwell with thee.

verses.part1: Such as be foolish shall not stand in thy sight
verses.part2: for thou hatest all them that work vanity.

verses.part1: Thou shalt destroy them that speak leasing
verses.part2: the Lord will abhor both the blood-thirsty and deceitful man.

verses.part1: But as for me, I will come into thine house, even upon the multitude of thy mercy
verses.part2: and in thy fear will I worship toward thy holy temple.

verses.part1: Lead me, O Lord, in thy righteousness, because of mine enemies
verses.part2: make thy way plain before my face.

verses.part1: For there is no faithfulness in his mouth
verses.part2: their inward parts are very wickedness.

verses.part1: Their throat is an open sepulchre
verses.part2: they flatter with their tongue.

verses.part1: Destroy thou them, O God; let them perish through their own imaginations
verses.part2: cast them out in the multitude of their ungodliness; for they have rebelled against thee.

verses.part1: And let all them that put their trust in thee rejoice
verses.part2: they shall ever be giving of thanks, because thou defendest them; they that love thy Name shall be joyful in thee;

verses.part1: For thou, Lord, wilt give thy blessing unto the righteous
verses.part2: and with thy favourable kindness wilt thou defend him as with a shield.

verses.part1: O LORD, rebuke me not in thine indignation
verses.part2: neither chasten me in thy displeasure.

verses.part1: Have mercy upon me, O Lord, for I am weak
verses.part2: O Lord, heal me, for my bones are vexed.

verses.part1: My soul also is sore troubled
verses.part2: but, Lord, how long wilt thou punish me?

verses.part1: Turn thee, O Lord, and deliver my soul
verses.part2: O save me for thy mercy's sake.

verses.part1: For in death no man remembereth thee
verses.part2: and who will give thee thanks in the pit?

verses.part1: I am weary of my groaning; every night wash I my bed
verses.part2: and water my couch with my tears.

verses.part1: My beauty is gone for very trouble
verses.part2: and worn away because of all mine enemies.

verses.part1: Away from me, all ye that work vanity
verses.part2: for the Lord hath heard the voice of my weeping.

verses.part1: The Lord hath heard my petition
verses.part2: the Lord will receive my prayer.

verses.part1: All mine enemies shall be confounded, and sore vexed
verses.part2: they shall be turned back, and put to shame suddenly.

verses.part1: O LORD my God, in thee have I put my trust
verses.part2: save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me;

verses.part1: Lest he devour my soul, like a lion, and tear it in pieces
verses.part2: while there is none to help.

verses.part1: O Lord my God, if I have done any such thing
verses.part2: or if there be any wickedness in my hands;

verses.part1: If I have rewarded evil unto him that dealt friendly with me
verses.part2: yea, I have delivered him that without any cause is mine enemy;

verses.part1: Then let mine enemy persecute my soul, and take me
verses.part2: yea, let him tread my life down upon the earth, and lay mine honour in the dust.

verses.part1: Stand up, O Lord, in thy wrath, and lift up thyself, because of the indignation of mine enemies
verses.part2: arise up for me in the judgement that thou hast commanded.

verses.part1: And so shall the congregation of the people come about thee
verses.part2: for their sakes therefore lift up thyself again.

verses.part1: The Lord shall judge the people; give sentence with me, O Lord
verses.part2: according to my righteousness, and according to the innocency that is in me.

verses.part1: O let the wickedness of the ungodly come to an end
verses.part2: but guide thou the just.

verses.part1: For the righteous God
verses.part2: trieth the very hearts and reins.

verses.part1: My help cometh of God
verses.part2: who preserveth them that are true of heart.

verses.part1: God is a righteous Judge, strong and patient
verses.part2: and God is provoked every day.

verses.part1: If a man will not turn, he will whet his sword
verses.part2: he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.

verses.part1: He hath prepared for him the instruments of death
verses.part2: he ordaineth his arrows against the persecutors.

verses.part1: Behold, he travaileth with mischief
verses.part2: he hath conceived sorrow, and brought forth ungodliness.

verses.part1: He hath graven and digged up a pit
verses.part2: and is fallen himself into the destruction that he made for other.

verses.part1: For his travail shall come upon his own head
verses.part2: and his wickedness shall fall on his own pate.

verses.part1: I will give thanks unto the Lord, according to his righteousness
verses.part2: and I will praise the Name of the Lord most High.

verses.part1: O LORD our Governor, how excellent is thy Name in all the world
verses.part2: thou that hast set thy glory above the heavens!

verses.part1: Out of the mouth of very babes and sucklings hast thou ordained strength, because of thine enemies
verses.part2: that thou mightest still the enemy and the avenger.

verses.part1: For I will consider thy heavens, even the works of thy fingers
verses.part2: the moon and the stars, which thou hast ordained.

verses.part1: What is man, that thou art mindful of him
verses.part2: and the son of man, that thou visitest him?

verses.part1: Thou madest him lower than the angels
verses.part2: to crown him with glory and worship.

verses.part1: Thou makest him to have dominion of the works of thy hands
verses.part2: and thou hast put all things in subjection under his feet;

verses.part1: All sheep and oxen
verses.part2: yea, and the beasts of the field;

verses.part1: The fowls of the air, and the fishes of the sea
verses.part2: and whatsoever walketh through the paths of the seas.

verses.part1: O Lord our Governor
verses.part2: how excellent is thy Name in all the world!

verses.part1: I WILL give thanks unto thee, O Lord, with my whole heart
verses.part2: I will speak of all thy marvellous works.

verses.part1: I will be glad and rejoice in thee
verses.part2: yea, my songs will I make of thy Name, O thou most Highest.

verses.part1: While mine enemies are driven back
verses.part2: they shall fall and perish at thy presence.

verses.part1: For thou hast maintained my right and my cause
verses.part2: thou art set in the throne that judgest right.

verses.part1: Thou hast rebuked the heathen, and destroyed the ungodly
verses.part2: thou hast put out their name for ever and ever.

verses.part1: O thou enemy, destructions are come to a perpetual end
verses.part2: even as the cities which thou hast destroyed, their memorial is perished with them.

verses.part1: But the Lord shall endure for ever
verses.part2: he hath also prepared his seat for judgement.

verses.part1: For he shall judge the world in righteousness
verses.part2: and minister true judgement unto the people.

verses.part1: The Lord also will be a defence for the oppressed
verses.part2: even a refuge in due time of trouble.

verses.part1: And they that know thy Name will put their trust in thee
verses.part2: for thou, Lord, hast never failed them that seek thee.

verses.part1: O praise the Lord which dwelleth in Sion
verses.part2: shew the people of his doings.

verses.part1: For when he maketh inquisition for blood, he remembereth them
verses.part2: and forgetteth not the complaint of the poor.

verses.part1: Have mercy upon me, O Lord; consider the trouble which I suffer of them that hate me
verses.part2: thou that liftest me up from the gates of death.

verses.part1: That I may shew all thy praises within the ports of the daughter of Sion
verses.part2: I will rejoice in thy salvation.

verses.part1: The heathen are sunk down in the pit that they made
verses.part2: in the same net which they hid privily, is their foot taken.

verses.part1: The Lord is known to execute judgement
verses.part2: the ungodly is trapped in the work of his own hands.

verses.part1: The wicked shall be turned into hell
verses.part2: and all the people that forget God.

verses.part1: For the poor shall not alway be forgotten
verses.part2: the patient abiding of the meek shall not perish for ever.

verses.part1: Up, Lord, and let not man have the upper hand
verses.part2: let the heathen be judged in thy sight.

verses.part1: Put them in fear, O Lord
verses.part2: that the heathen may know themselves to be but men.

verses.part1: WHY standest thou so far off, O Lord
verses.part2: and hidest thy face in the needful time of trouble?

verses.part1: The ungodly for his own lust doth persecute the poor
verses.part2: let them be taken in the crafty wiliness that they have imagined.

verses.part1: For the ungodly hath made boast of his own heart's desire
verses.part2: and speaketh good of the covetous, whom God abhorreth.

verses.part1: The ungodly is so proud, that he careth not for God
verses.part2: neither is God in all his thoughts.

verses.part1: His ways are alway grievous
verses.part2: thy judgements

verses.part1: For he hath said in his heart, Tush, I shall never be cast down
verses.part2: there shall no harm happen unto me.

verses.part1: His mouth is full of cursing, deceit, and fraud
verses.part2: under his tongue is ungodliness and vanity.

verses.part1: He sitteth lurking in the thievish corners of the streets
verses.part2: and privily in his lurking dens doth he murder the innocent; his eyes are set against the poor.

verses.part1: For he lieth waiting secretly, even as a lion lurketh he in his den
verses.part2: that he may ravish the poor.

verses.part1: He doth ravish the poor
verses.part2: when he getteth him into his net.

verses.part1: He falleth down, and humbleth himself
verses.part2: that the congregation of the poor may fall into the hands of his captains.

verses.part1: He hath said in his heart, Tush, God hath forgotten
verses.part2: he hideth away his face, and he will never see it.

verses.part1: Arise, O Lord God, and lift up thine hand
verses.part2: forget not the poor.

verses.part1: Wherefore should the wicked blaspheme God
verses.part2: while he doth say in his heart, Tush, thou God carest not for it.

verses.part1: Surely thou hast seen it
verses.part2: for thou beholdest ungodliness and wrong.

verses.part1: That thou mayest take the matter into thy hand
verses.part2: the poor committeth himself unto thee; for thou art the helper of the friendless.

verses.part1: Break thou the power of the ungodly and malicious
verses.part2: take away his ungodliness, and thou shalt find none.

verses.part1: The Lord is King for ever and ever
verses.part2: and the heathen are perished out of the land.

verses.part1: Lord, thou hast heard the desire of the poor
verses.part2: thou preparest their heart, and thine ear hearkeneth thereto;

verses.part1: To help the fatherless and poor unto their right
verses.part2: that the man of the earth be no more exalted against them.

sections.title: are far above out of his sight, and therefore defieth he all his enemies.

verses.part1: IN the Lord put I my trust
verses.part2: how say ye then to my soul, that she should flee as a bird unto the hill?

verses.part1: For lo, the ungodly bend their bow, and make ready their arrows within the quiver
verses.part2: that they may privily shoot at them which are true of heart.

verses.part1: For the foundations will be cast down
verses.part2: and what hath the righteous done?

verses.part1: The Lord is in his holy temple
verses.part2: the Lord's seat is in heaven.

verses.part1: His eyes consider the poor
verses.part2: and his eye-lids try the children of men.

verses.part1: The Lord alloweth the righteous
verses.part2: but the ungodly, and him that delighteth in wickedness, doth his soul abhor.

verses.part1: Upon the ungodly he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, storm and tempest
verses.part2: this shall be their portion to drink.

verses.part1: For the righteous Lord loveth righteousness
verses.part2: his countenance will behold the thing that is just.

verses.part1: HELP me, Lord, for there is not one godly man left
verses.part2: for the faithful are minished from among the children of men.

verses.part1: They talk of vanity every one with his neighbour
verses.part2: they do but flatter with their lips, and dissemble in their double heart.

verses.part1: The Lord shall root out all deceitful lips
verses.part2: and the tongue that speaketh proud things;

verses.part1: Which have said, With our tongue will we prevail
verses.part2: we are they that ought to speak, who is lord over us?

verses.part1: Now for the comfortless trouble's sake of the needy
verses.part2: and because of the deep sighing of the poor,

verses.part1: I will up, saith the Lord
verses.part2: and will help every one from him that swelleth against him, and will set him at rest.

verses.part1: The words of the Lord are pure words
verses.part2: even as the silver, which from the earth is tried, and purified seven times in the fire.

verses.part1: Thou shalt keep them, O Lord
verses.part2: thou shalt preserve him from this generation for ever.

verses.part1: The ungodly walk on every side
verses.part2: when they are exalted, the children of men are put to rebuke.

verses.part1: HOW long wilt thou forget me, O Lord, for ever
verses.part2: how long wilt thou hide thy face from me?

verses.part1: How long shall I seek counsel in my soul, and be so vexed in my heart
verses.part2: how long shall mine enemies triumph over me?

verses.part1: Consider, and hear me, O Lord my God
verses.part2: lighten mine eyes, that I sleep not in death.

verses.part1: Lest mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him
verses.part2: for if I be cast down, they that trouble me will rejoice at it.

verses.part1: But my trust is in thy mercy
verses.part2: and my heart is joyful in thy salvation.

verses.part1: I will sing of the Lord, because he hath dealt so lovingly with me
verses.part2: yea, I will praise the Name of the Lord most Highest.

verses.part1: THE fool hath said in his heart
verses.part2: There is no God.

verses.part1: They are corrupt, and become abominable in their doings
verses.part2: there is none that doeth good, no not one.

verses.part1: The Lord looked down from heaven upon the children of men
verses.part2: to see if there were any that would understand, and seek after God.

verses.part1: But they are all gone out of the way, they are altogether become abominable
verses.part2: there is none that doeth good, no not one.

verses.part1: Their throat is an open sepulchre, with their tongues have they deceived
verses.part2: the poison of asps is under their lips.

verses.part1: Their mouth is full of cursing and bitterness
verses.part2: their feet are swift to shed blood.

verses.part1: Destruction and unhappiness is in their ways, and the way of peace have they not known
verses.part2: there is no fear of God before their eyes.

verses.part1: Have they no knowledge, that they are all such workers of mischief
verses.part2: eating up my people as it were bread, and call not upon the Lord?

verses.part1: There were they brought in great fear, even where no fear was
verses.part2: for God is in the generation of the righteous.

verses.part1: As for you, ye have made a mock at the counsel of the poor
verses.part2: because he putteth his trust in the Lord.

verses.part1: Who shall give salvation unto Israel out of Sion? When the Lord turneth the captivity of his people
verses.part2: then shall Jacob rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.

verses.part1: LORD, who shall dwell in thy tabernacle
verses.part2: or who shall rest upon thy holy hill?

verses.part1: Even he that leadeth an uncorrupt life
verses.part2: and doeth the thing which is right, and speaketh the truth from his heart.

verses.part1: He that hath used no deceit in his tongue, nor done evil to his neighbour
verses.part2: and hath not slandered his neighbour.

verses.part1: He that setteth not by himself, but is lowly in his own eyes
verses.part2: and maketh much of them that fear the Lord.

verses.part1: He that sweareth unto his neighbour, and disappointeth him not
verses.part2: though it were to his own hindrance.

verses.part1: He that hath not given his money upon usury
verses.part2: nor taken reward against the innocent.

verses.part1: Whoso doeth these things
verses.part2: shall never fall.

verses.part1: PRESERVE me, O God
verses.part2: for in thee have I put my trust.

verses.part1: O my soul, thou hast said unto the Lord
verses.part2: Thou art my God, my goods are nothing unto thee.

verses.part1: All my delight is upon the saints, that are in the earth
verses.part2: and upon such as excel in virtue.

verses.part1: But they that run after another god
verses.part2: shall have great trouble.

verses.part1: Their drink-offerings of blood will I not offer
verses.part2: neither make mention of their names within my lips.

verses.part1: The Lord himself is the portion of mine inheritance, and of my cup
verses.part2: thou shalt maintain my lot.

verses.part1: The lot is fallen unto me in a fair ground
verses.part2: yea, I have a goodly heritage.

verses.part1: I will thank the Lord for giving me warning
verses.part2: my reins also chasten me in the night-season.

verses.part1: I have set God always before me
verses.part2: for he is on my right hand, therefore I shall not fall.

verses.part1: Wherefore my heart was glad, and my glory rejoiced
verses.part2: my flesh also shall rest in hope.

verses.part1: For why? thou shalt not leave my soul in hell
verses.part2: neither shalt thou suffer thy Holy One to see corruption.

verses.part1: Thou shalt shew me the path of life; in thy presence is the fulness of joy
verses.part2: and at thy right hand there is pleasure for evermore.

verses.part1: HEAR the right, O Lord, consider my complaint
verses.part2: and hearken unto my prayer, that goeth not out of feigned lips.

verses.part1: Let my sentence come forth from thy presence
verses.part2: and let thine eyes look upon the thing that is equal.

verses.part1: Thou hast proved and visited mine heart in the night-season; thou hast tried me, and shalt find no wickedness in me
verses.part2: for I am utterly purposed that my mouth shall not offend.

verses.part1: Because of men's works, that are done against the words of thy lips
verses.part2: I have kept me from the ways of the destroyer.

verses.part1: O hold thou up my goings in thy paths
verses.part2: that my footsteps slip not.

verses.part1: I have called upon thee, O God, for thou shalt hear me
verses.part2: incline thine ear to me, and hearken unto my words.

verses.part1: Shew thy marvellous loving-kindness, thou that art the Saviour of them which put their trust in thee
verses.part2: from such as resist thy right hand.

verses.part1: Keep me as the apple of an eye
verses.part2: hide me under the shadow of thy wings,

verses.part1: From the ungodly that trouble me
verses.part2: mine enemies compass me round about to take away my soul.

verses.part1: They are inclosed in their own fat
verses.part2: and their mouth speaketh proud things.

verses.part1: They lie waiting in our way on every side
verses.part2: turning their eyes down to the ground;

verses.part1: Like as a lion that is greedy of his prey
verses.part2: and as it were a lion's whelp, lurking in secret places.

verses.part1: Up, Lord, disappoint him, and cast him down
verses.part2: deliver my soul from the ungodly, which is a sword of thine;

verses.part1: From the men of thy hand, O Lord, from the men, I say, and from the evil world
verses.part2: which have their portion in this life, whose bellies thou fillest with thy hid treasure.

verses.part1: They have children at their desire
verses.part2: and leave the rest of their substance for their babes.

verses.part1: But as for me, I will behold thy presence in righteousness
verses.part2: and when I awake up after thy likeness, I shall be satisfied with it.

verses.part1: I WILL love thee, O Lord, my strength; the Lord is my stony rock, and my defence
verses.part2: my Saviour, my God, and my might, in whom I will trust, my buckler, the horn also of my salvation, and my refuge.

verses.part1: I will call upon the Lord, which is worthy to be praised
verses.part2: so shall I be safe from mine enemies.

verses.part1: The sorrows of death compassed me
verses.part2: and the overflowings of ungodliness made me afraid.

verses.part1: The pains of hell came about me
verses.part2: the snares of death overtook me.

verses.part1: In my trouble I will call upon the Lord
verses.part2: and complain unto my God.

verses.part1: So shall he hear my voice out of his holy temple
verses.part2: and my complaint shall come before him, it shall enter even into his ears.

verses.part1: The earth trembled and quaked
verses.part2: the very foundations also of the hills shook, and were removed, because he was wroth.

verses.part1: There went a smoke out in his presence
verses.part2: and a consuming fire out of his mouth, so that coals were kindled at it.

verses.part1: He bowed the heavens also, and came down
verses.part2: and it was dark under his feet.

verses.part1: He rode upon the cherubins, and did fly
verses.part2: he came flying upon the wings of the wind.

verses.part1: He made darkness his secret place
verses.part2: his pavilion round about him, with dark water and thick clouds to cover him.

verses.part1: At the brightness of his presence his clouds removed
verses.part2: hail-stones, and coals of fire.

verses.part1: The Lord also thundered out of heaven, and the Highest gave his thunder
verses.part2: hail-stones, and coals of fire.

verses.part1: He sent out his arrows, and scattered them
verses.part2: he cast forth lightnings, and destroyed them.

verses.part1: The springs of waters were seen, and the foundations of the round world were discovered, at thy chiding, O Lord
verses.part2: at the blasting of the breath of thy displeasure.

verses.part1: He shall send down from on high to fetch me
verses.part2: and shall take me out of many waters.

verses.part1: He shall deliver me from my strongest enemy, and from them which hate me
verses.part2: for they are too mighty for me.

verses.part1: They prevented me in the day of my trouble
verses.part2: but the Lord was my upholder.

verses.part1: He brought me forth also into a place of liberty
verses.part2: he brought me forth, even because he had a favour unto me.

verses.part1: The Lord shall reward me after my righteous dealing
verses.part2: according to the cleanness of my hands shall he recompense me.

verses.part1: Because I have kept the ways of the Lord
verses.part2: and have not forsaken my God, as the wicked doth.

verses.part1: For I have an eye unto all his laws
verses.part2: and will not cast out his commandments from me.

verses.part1: I was also uncorrupt before him
verses.part2: and eschewed mine own wickedness.

verses.part1: Therefore shall the Lord reward me after my righteous dealing
verses.part2: and according unto the cleanness of my hands in his eye-sight.

verses.part1: With the holy thou shalt be holy
verses.part2: and with a perfect man thou shalt be perfect.

verses.part1: With the clean thou shalt be clean
verses.part2: and with the froward thou shalt learn frowardness.

verses.part1: For thou shalt save the people that are in adversity
verses.part2: and shalt bring down the high looks of the proud.

verses.part1: Thou also shalt light my candle
verses.part2: the Lord my God shall make my darkness to be light.

verses.part1: For in thee I shall discomfit an host of men
verses.part2: and with the help of my God I shall leap over the wall.

verses.part1: The way of God is an undefiled way
verses.part2: the word of the Lord also is tried in the fire; he is the defender of all them that put their trust in him.

verses.part1: For who is God, but the Lord
verses.part2: or who hath any strength, except our God?

verses.part1: It is God, that girdeth me with strength of war
verses.part2: and maketh my way perfect.

verses.part1: He maketh my feet like harts' feet
verses.part2: and setteth me up on high.

verses.part1: He teacheth mine hands to fight
verses.part2: and mine arms shall break even a bow of steel.

verses.part1: Thou hast given me the defence of thy salvation
verses.part2: thy right hand also shall hold me up, and thy loving correction shall make me great.

verses.part1: Thou shalt make room enough under me for to go
verses.part2: that my footsteps shall not slide.

verses.part1: I will follow upon mine enemies, and overtake them
verses.part2: neither will I turn again till I have destroyed them.

verses.part1: I will smite them, that they shall not be able to stand
verses.part2: but fall under my feet.

verses.part1: Thou hast girded me with strength unto the battle
verses.part2: thou shalt throw down mine enemies under me.

verses.part1: Thou hast made mine enemies also to turn their backs upon me
verses.part2: and I shall destroy them that hate me.

verses.part1: They shall cry, but there shall be none to help them
verses.part2: yea, even unto the Lord shall they cry, but he shall not hear them.

verses.part1: I will beat them as small as the dust before the wind
verses.part2: I will cast them out as the clay in the streets.

verses.part1: Thou shalt deliver me from the strivings of the people
verses.part2: and thou shalt make me the head of the heathen.

verses.part1: A people whom I have not known
verses.part2: shall serve me.

verses.part1: As soon as they hear of me, they shall obey me
verses.part2: but the strange children shall dissemble with me.

verses.part1: The strange children shall fail
verses.part2: and be afraid out of their prisons.

verses.part1: The Lord liveth, and blessed be my strong helper
verses.part2: and praised be the God of my salvation;

verses.part1: Even the God that seeth that I be avenged
verses.part2: and subdueth the people unto me.

verses.part1: It is he that delivereth me from my cruel enemies, and setteth me up above mine adversaries
verses.part2: thou shalt rid me from the wicked man.

verses.part1: For this cause will I give thanks unto thee, O Lord, among the Gentiles
verses.part2: and sing praises unto thy Name.

verses.part1: Great prosperity giveth he unto his King
verses.part2: and sheweth loving-kindness unto David his Anointed, and unto his seed for evermore.

verses.part1: THE heavens declare the glory of God
verses.part2: and the firmament sheweth his handywork.

verses.part1: One day telleth another
verses.part2: and one night certifieth another.

verses.part1: There is neither speech nor language
verses.part2: but their voices are heard among them.

verses.part1: Their sound is gone out into all lands
verses.part2: and their words into the ends of the world.

verses.part1: In them hath he set a tabernacle for the sun
verses.part2: which cometh forth as a bridegroom out of his chamber, and rejoiceth as a giant to run his course.

verses.part1: It goeth forth from the uttermost part of the heaven, and runneth about unto the end of it again
verses.part2: and there is nothing hid from the heat thereof.

verses.part1: The law of the Lord is an undefiled law, converting the soul
verses.part2: the testimony of the Lord is sure, and giveth wisdom unto the simple.

verses.part1: The statutes of the Lord are right, and rejoice the heart
verses.part2: the commandment of the Lord is pure, and giveth light unto the eyes.

verses.part1: The fear of the Lord is clean, and endureth for ever
verses.part2: the judgements of the Lord are true, and righteous altogether.

verses.part1: More to be desired are they than gold, yea, than much fine gold
verses.part2: sweeter also than honey, and the honey-comb.

verses.part1: Moreover, by them is thy servant taught
verses.part2: and in keeping of them there is great reward.

verses.part1: Who can tell how oft he offendeth
verses.part2: O cleanse thou me from my secret faults.

verses.part1: Keep thy servant also from presumptuous sins, lest they get the dominion over me
verses.part2: so shall I be undefiled, and innocent from the great offence.

verses.part1: Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart
verses.part2: be alway acceptable in thy sight,

verses.part1: O Lord
verses.part2: my strength, and my redeemer.

verses.part1: THE Lord hear thee in the day of trouble
verses.part2: the Name of the God of Jacob defend thee;

verses.part1: Send thee help from the sanctuary
verses.part2: and strengthen thee out of Sion;

verses.part1: Remember all thy offerings
verses.part2: and accept thy burnt-sacrifice;

verses.part1: Grant thee thy heart's desire
verses.part2: and fulfil all thy mind.

verses.part1: We will rejoice in thy salvation, and triumph in the Name of the Lord our God
verses.part2: the Lord perform all thy petitions.

verses.part1: Now know I that the Lord helpeth his Anointed, and will hear him from his holy heaven
verses.part2: even with the wholesome strength of his right hand.

verses.part1: Some put their trust in chariots, and some in horses
verses.part2: but we will remember the Name of the Lord our God.

verses.part1: They are brought down, and fallen
verses.part2: but we are risen, and stand upright.

verses.part1: Save, Lord, and hear us, O King of heaven
verses.part2: when we call upon thee.

verses.part1: THE King shall rejoice in thy strength, O Lord
verses.part2: exceeding glad shall he be of thy salvation.

verses.part1: Thou hast given him his heart's desire
verses.part2: and hast not denied him the request of his lips.

verses.part1: For thou shalt prevent him with the blessings of goodness
verses.part2: and shalt set a crown of pure gold upon his head.

verses.part1: He asked life of thee, and thou gavest him a long life
verses.part2: even for ever and ever.

verses.part1: His honour is great in thy salvation
verses.part2: glory and great worship shalt thou lay upon him.

verses.part1: For thou shalt give him everlasting felicity
verses.part2: and make him glad with the joy of thy countenance.

verses.part1: And why? because the King putteth his trust in the Lord
verses.part2: and in the mercy of the most Highest he shall not miscarry.

verses.part1: All thine enemies shall feel thine hand
verses.part2: thy right hand shall find out them that hate thee.

verses.part1: Thou shalt make them like a fiery oven in time of thy wrath
verses.part2: the Lord shall destroy them in his displeasure, and the fire shall consume them.

verses.part1: Their fruit shalt thou root out of the earth
verses.part2: and their seed from among the children of men.

verses.part1: For they intended mischief against thee
verses.part2: and imagined such a device as they are not able to perform.

verses.part1: Therefore shalt thou put them to flight
verses.part2: and the strings of thy bow shalt thou make ready against the face of them.

verses.part1: Be thou exalted, Lord, in thine own strength
verses.part2: so will we sing, and praise thy power.

verses.part1: MY God, my God, look upon me; why hast thou forsaken me
verses.part2: and art so far from my health, and from the words of my complaint?

verses.part1: O my God, I cry in the day-time, but thou hearest not
verses.part2: and in the night-season also I take no rest.

verses.part1: And thou continuest holy
verses.part2: O thou worship of Israel.

verses.part1: Our fathers hoped in thee
verses.part2: they trusted in thee, and thou didst deliver them.

verses.part1: They called upon thee, and were holpen
verses.part2: they put their trust in thee, and were not confounded.

verses.part1: But as for me, I am a worm, and no man
verses.part2: a very scorn of men, and the outcast of the people.

verses.part1: All they that see me laugh me to scorn
verses.part2: they shoot out their lips, and shake their heads, saying,

verses.part1: He trusted in God, that he would deliver him
verses.part2: let him deliver him, if he will have him.

verses.part1: But thou art he that took me out of my mother's womb
verses.part2: thou wast my hope, when I hanged yet upon my mother's breasts.

verses.part1: I have been left unto thee ever since I was born
verses.part2: thou art my God, even from my mother's womb.

verses.part1: O go not from me, for trouble is hard at hand
verses.part2: and there is none to help me.

verses.part1: Many oxen are come about me
verses.part2: fat bulls of Basan close me in on every side.

verses.part1: They gape upon me with their mouths
verses.part2: as it were a ramping and a roaring lion.

verses.part1: I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint
verses.part2: my heart also in the midst of my body is even like melting wax.

verses.part1: My strength is dried up like a potsherd, and my tongue cleaveth to my gums
verses.part2: and thou shalt bring me into the dust of death.

verses.part1: For many dogs are come about me
verses.part2: and the council of the wicked layeth siege against me.

verses.part1: They pierced my hands and my feet; I may tell all my bones
verses.part2: they stand staring and looking upon me.

verses.part1: They part my garments among them
verses.part2: and cast lots upon my vesture.

verses.part1: But be not thou far from me, O Lord
verses.part2: thou art my succour, haste thee to help me.

verses.part1: Deliver my soul from the sword
verses.part2: my darling from the power of the dog.

verses.part1: Save me from the lion's mouth
verses.part2: thou hast heard me also from among the horns of the unicorns.

verses.part1: I will declare thy Name unto my brethren
verses.part2: in the midst of the congregation will I praise thee.

verses.part1: O praise the Lord, ye that fear him
verses.part2: magnify him, all ye of the seed of Jacob, and fear him, all ye seed of Israel;

verses.part1: For he hath not despised, nor abhorred, the low estate of the poor
verses.part2: he hath not hid his face from him, but when he called unto him he heard him.

verses.part1: My praise is of thee in the great congregation
verses.part2: my vows will I perform in the sight of them that fear him.

verses.part1: The poor shall eat and be satisfied
verses.part2: they that seek after the Lord shall praise him; your heart shall live for ever.

verses.part1: All the ends of the world shall remember themselves, and be turned unto the Lord
verses.part2: and all the kindreds of the nations shall worship before him.

verses.part1: For the kingdom is the Lord's
verses.part2: and he is the Governor among the people.

verses.part1: All such as be fat upon earth
verses.part2: have eaten and worshipped.

verses.part1: All they that go down into the dust shall kneel before him
verses.part2: and no man hath quickened his own soul.

verses.part1: My seed shall serve him
verses.part2: they shall be counted unto the Lord for a generation.

verses.part1: They shall come, and the heavens shall declare his righteousness
verses.part2: unto a people that shall be born, whom the Lord hath made.

verses.part1: THE Lord is my shepherd
verses.part2: therefore can I lack nothing.

verses.part1: He shall feed me in a green pasture
verses.part2: and lead me forth beside the waters of comfort.

verses.part1: He shall convert my soul
verses.part2: and bring me forth in the paths of righteousness, for his Name's sake.

verses.part1: Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil
verses.part2: for thou art with me; thy rod and thy staff comfort me.

verses.part1: Thou shalt prepare a table before me against them that trouble me
verses.part2: thou hast anointed my head with oil, and my cup shall be full.

verses.part1: Surely thy loving-kindness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life
verses.part2: and I will dwell in the house of the Lord for ever.

verses.part1: THE earth is the Lord's, and all that therein is
verses.part2: the compass of the world, and they that dwell therein.

verses.part1: For he hath founded it upon the seas
verses.part2: and prepared it upon the floods.

verses.part1: Who shall ascend into the hill of the Lord
verses.part2: or who shall rise up in his holy place?

verses.part1: Even he that hath clean hands, and a pure heart
verses.part2: and that hath not lift up his mind unto vanity, nor sworn to deceive his neighbour.

verses.part1: He shall receive the blessing from the Lord
verses.part2: and righteousness from the God of his salvation.

verses.part1: This is the generation of them that seek him
verses.part2: even of them that seek thy face, O Jacob.

verses.part1: Lift up your heads, O ye gates, and be ye lift up, ye everlasting doors
verses.part2: and the King of glory shall come in.

verses.part1: Who is the King of glory
verses.part2: it is the Lord strong and mighty, even the Lord mighty in battle.

verses.part1: Lift up your heads, O ye gates, and be ye lift up, ye everlasting doors
verses.part2: and the King of glory shall come in.

verses.part1: Who is the King of glory
verses.part2: even the Lord of hosts, he is the King of glory.

verses.part1: UNTO thee, O Lord, will I lift up my soul; my God, I have put my trust in thee
verses.part2: O let me not be confounded, neither let mine enemies triumph over me.

verses.part1: For all they that hope in thee shall not be ashamed
verses.part2: but such as transgress without a cause shall be put to confusion.

verses.part1: Shew me thy ways, O Lord
verses.part2: and teach me thy paths.

verses.part1: Lead me forth in thy truth, and learn me
verses.part2: for thou art the God of my salvation; in thee hath been my hope all the day long.

verses.part1: Call to remembrance, O Lord, thy tender mercies
verses.part2: and thy loving-kindnesses, which have been ever of old.

verses.part1: O remember not the sins and offences of my youth
verses.part2: but according to thy mercy think thou upon me, O Lord, for thy goodness.

verses.part1: Gracious and righteous is the Lord
verses.part2: therefore will he teach sinners in the way.

verses.part1: Them that are meek shall he guide in judgement
verses.part2: and such as are gentle, them shall he learn his way.

verses.part1: All the paths of the Lord are mercy and truth
verses.part2: unto such as keep his covenant and his testimonies.

verses.part1: For thy Name's sake, O Lord
verses.part2: be merciful unto my sin, for it is great.

verses.part1: What man is he that feareth the Lord
verses.part2: him shall he teach in the way that he shall choose.

verses.part1: His soul shall dwell at ease
verses.part2: and his seed shall inherit the land.

verses.part1: The secret of the Lord is among them that fear him
verses.part2: and he will shew them his covenant.

verses.part1: Mine eyes are ever looking unto the Lord
verses.part2: for he shall pluck my feet out of the net.

verses.part1: Turn thee unto me, and have mercy upon me
verses.part2: for I am desolate and in misery.

verses.part1: The sorrows of my heart are enlarged
verses.part2: O bring thou me out of my troubles.

verses.part1: Look upon my adversity and misery
verses.part2: and forgive me all my sin.

verses.part1: Consider mine enemies, how many they are
verses.part2: and they bear a tyrannous hate against me.

verses.part1: O keep my soul, and deliver me
verses.part2: let me not be confounded, for I have put my trust in thee.

verses.part1: Let perfectness and righteous dealing wait upon me
verses.part2: for my hope hath been in thee.

verses.part1: Deliver Israel, O God
verses.part2: out of all his troubles.

verses.part1: BE thou my Judge, O Lord, for I have walked innocently
verses.part2: my trust hath been also in the Lord, therefore shall I not fall.

verses.part1: Examine me, O Lord, and prove me
verses.part2: try out my reins and my heart.

verses.part1: For thy loving-kindness is ever before mine eyes
verses.part2: and I will walk in thy truth.

verses.part1: I have not dwelt with vain persons
verses.part2: neither will I have fellowship with the deceitful.

verses.part1: I have hated the congregation of the wicked
verses.part2: and will not sit among the ungodly.

verses.part1: I will wash my hands in innocency, O Lord
verses.part2: and so will I go to thine altar;

verses.part1: That I may shew the voice of thanksgiving
verses.part2: and tell of all thy wondrous works.

verses.part1: Lord, I have loved the habitation of thy house
verses.part2: and the place where thine honour dwelleth.

verses.part1: O shut not up my soul with the sinners
verses.part2: nor my life with the blood-thirsty;

verses.part1: In whose hands is wickedness
verses.part2: and their right hand is full of gifts.

verses.part1: But as for me, I will walk innocently
verses.part2: O deliver me, and be merciful unto me.

verses.part1: My foot standeth right
verses.part2: I will praise the Lord in the congregations.

verses.part1: THE Lord is my light and my salvation; whom then shall I fear
verses.part2: the Lord is the strength of my life; of whom then shall I be afraid?

verses.part1: When the wicked, even mine enemies and my foes, came upon me to eat up my flesh
verses.part2: they stumbled and fell.

verses.part1: Though an host of men were laid against me, yet shall not my heart be afraid
verses.part2: and though there rose up war against me, yet will I put my trust in him.

verses.part1: One thing have I desired of the Lord, which I will require
verses.part2: even that I may dwell in the house of the Lord all the days of my life, to behold the fair beauty of the Lord, and to visit his temple.

verses.part1: For in the time of trouble he shall hide me in his tabernacle
verses.part2: yea, in the secret place of his dwelling shall he hide me, and set me up upon a rock of stone.

verses.part1: And now shall he lift up mine head
verses.part2: above mine enemies round about me.

verses.part1: Therefore will I offer in his dwelling an oblation with great gladness
verses.part2: I will sing, and speak praises unto the Lord.

verses.part1: Hearken unto my voice, O Lord, when I cry unto thee
verses.part2: have mercy upon me, and hear me.

verses.part1: My heart hath talked of thee, Seek ye my face
verses.part2: Thy face, Lord, will I seek.

verses.part1: O hide not thou thy face from me
verses.part2: nor cast thy servant away in displeasure.

verses.part1: Thou hast been my succour
verses.part2: leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.

verses.part1: When my father and my mother forsake me
verses.part2: the Lord taketh me up.

verses.part1: Teach me thy way, O Lord
verses.part2: and lead me in the right way, because of mine enemies.

verses.part1: Deliver me not over into the will of mine adversaries
verses.part2: for there are false witnesses risen up against me, and such as speak wrong.

verses.part1: I should utterly have fainted
verses.part2: but that I believe verily to see the goodness of the Lord in the land of the living.

verses.part1: O tarry thou the Lord's leisure
verses.part2: be strong, and he shall comfort thine heart; and put thou thy trust in the Lord.

verses.part1: UNTO thee will I cry, O Lord my strength
verses.part2: think no scorn of me; lest, if thou make as though thou hearest not, I become like them that go down into the pit.

verses.part1: Hear the voice of my humble petitions, when I cry unto thee
verses.part2: when I hold up my hands towards the mercy-seat of thy holy temple.

verses.part1: O pluck me not away, neither destroy me, with the ungodly and wicked doers
verses.part2: which speak friendly to their neighbours, but imagine mischief in their hearts.

verses.part1: Reward them according to their deeds
verses.part2: and according to the wickedness of their own inventions.

verses.part1: Recompense them after the work of their hands
verses.part2: pay them that they have deserved.

verses.part1: For they regard not in their mind the works of the Lord, nor the operation of his hands
verses.part2: therefore shall he break them down, and not build them up.

verses.part1: Praised be the Lord
verses.part2: for he hath heard the voice of my humble petitions.

verses.part1: The Lord is my strength and my shield; my heart hath trusted in him, and I am helped
verses.part2: therefore my heart danceth for joy, and in my song will I praise him.

verses.part1: The Lord is my strength
verses.part2: and he is the wholesome defence of his Anointed.

verses.part1: O save thy people, and give thy blessing unto thine inheritance
verses.part2: feed them, and set them up for ever.

verses.part1: BRING unto the Lord, O ye mighty, bring young rams unto the Lord
verses.part2: ascribe unto the Lord worship and strength.

verses.part1: Give the Lord the honour due unto his Name
verses.part2: worship the Lord with holy worship.

verses.part1: It is the Lord that commandeth the waters
verses.part2: it is the glorious God that maketh the thunder.

verses.part1: It is the Lord that ruleth the sea; the voice of the Lord is mighty in operation
verses.part2: the voice of the Lord is a glorious voice.

verses.part1: The voice of the Lord breaketh the cedar-trees
verses.part2: yea, the Lord breaketh the cedars of Libanus.

verses.part1: He maketh them also to skip like a calf
verses.part2: Libanus also, and Sirion, like a young unicorn.

verses.part1: The voice of the Lord divideth the flames of fire; the voice of the Lord shaketh the wilderness
verses.part2: yea, the Lord shaketh the wilderness of Cades.

verses.part1: The voice of the Lord maketh the hinds to bring forth young, and discovereth the thick bushes
verses.part2: in his temple doth every man speak of his honour.

verses.part1: The Lord sitteth above the water-flood
verses.part2: and the Lord remaineth a King for ever.

verses.part1: The Lord shall give strength unto his people
verses.part2: the Lord shall give his people the blessing of peace.

verses.part1: I WILL magnify thee, O Lord, for thou hast set me up
verses.part2: and not made my foes to triumph over me.

verses.part1: O Lord my God, I cried unto thee
verses.part2: and thou hast healed me.

verses.part1: Thou, Lord, hast brought my soul out of hell
verses.part2: thou hast kept my life from them that go down to the pit.

verses.part1: Sing praises unto the Lord, O ye saints of his
verses.part2: and give thanks unto him for a remembrance of his holiness.

verses.part1: For his wrath endureth but the twinkling of an eye, and in his pleasure is life
verses.part2: heaviness may endure for a night, but joy cometh in the morning.

verses.part1: And in my prosperity I said, I shall never be removed
verses.part2: thou, Lord, of thy goodness hast made my hill so strong.

verses.part1: Thou didst turn thy face from me
verses.part2: and I was troubled.

verses.part1: Then cried I unto thee, O Lord
verses.part2: and gat me to my Lord right humbly.

verses.part1: What profit is there in my blood
verses.part2: when I go down to the pit?

verses.part1: Shall the dust give thanks unto thee
verses.part2: or shall it declare thy truth?

verses.part1: Hear, O Lord, and have mercy upon me
verses.part2: Lord, be thou my helper.

verses.part1: Thou hast turned my heaviness into joy
verses.part2: thou hast put off my sackcloth, and girded me with gladness.

verses.part1: Therefore shall every good man sing of thy praise without ceasing
verses.part2: O my God, I will give thanks unto thee for ever.

verses.part1: IN thee, O Lord, have I put my trust
verses.part2: let me never be put to confusion, deliver me in thy righteousness.

verses.part1: Bow down thine ear to me
verses.part2: make haste to deliver me.

verses.part1: And be thou my strong rock, and house of defence
verses.part2: that thou mayest save me.

verses.part1: For thou art my strong rock, and my castle
verses.part2: be thou also my guide, and lead me for thy Name's sake.

verses.part1: Draw me out of the net that they have laid privily for me
verses.part2: for thou art my strength.

verses.part1: Into thy hands I commend my spirit
verses.part2: for thou hast redeemed me, O Lord, thou God of truth.

verses.part1: I have hated them that hold of superstitious vanities
verses.part2: and my trust hath been in the Lord.

verses.part1: I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy
verses.part2: for thou hast considered my trouble, and hast known my soul in adversities.

verses.part1: Thou hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy
verses.part2: but hast set my feet in a large room.

verses.part1: Have mercy upon me, O Lord, for I am in trouble
verses.part2: and mine eye is consumed for very heaviness; yea, my soul and my body.

verses.part1: For my life is waxen old with heaviness
verses.part2: and my years with mourning.

verses.part1: My strength faileth me, because of mine iniquity
verses.part2: and my bones are consumed.

verses.part1: I became a reproof among all mine enemies, but especially among my neighbours
verses.part2: and they of mine acquaintance were afraid of me; and they that did see me without conveyed themselves from me.

verses.part1: I am clean forgotten, as a dead man out of mind
verses.part2: I am become like a broken vessel.

verses.part1: For I have heard the blasphemy of the multitude
verses.part2: and fear is on every side, while they conspire together against me, and take their counsel to take away my life.

verses.part1: But my hope hath been in thee, O Lord
verses.part2: I have said, Thou art my God.

verses.part1: My time is in thy hand; deliver me from the hand of mine enemies
verses.part2: and from them that persecute me.

verses.part1: Shew thy servant the light of thy countenance
verses.part2: and save me for thy mercy's sake.

verses.part1: Let me not be confounded, O Lord, for I have called upon thee
verses.part2: let the ungodly be put to confusion, and be put to silence in the grave.

verses.part1: Let the lying lips be put to silence
verses.part2: which cruelly, disdainfully, and despitefully, speak against the righteous.

verses.part1: O how plentiful is thy goodness, which thou hast laid up for them that fear thee
verses.part2: and that thou hast prepared for them that put their trust in thee, even before the sons of men!

verses.part1: Thou shalt hide them privily by thine own presence from the provoking of all men
verses.part2: thou shalt keep them secretly in thy tabernacle from the strife of tongues.

verses.part1: Thanks be to the Lord
verses.part2: for he hath shewed me marvellous great kindness in a strong city.

verses.part1: And when I made haste, I said
verses.part2: I am cast out of the sight of thine eyes.

verses.part1: Nevertheless, thou heardest the voice of my prayer
verses.part2: when I cried unto thee.

verses.part1: O love the Lord, all ye his saints
verses.part2: for the Lord preserveth them that are faithful, and plenteously rewardeth the proud doer.

verses.part1: Be strong, and he shall establish your heart
verses.part2: all ye that put your trust in the Lord.

verses.part1: BLESSED is he whose unrighteousness is forgiven
verses.part2: and whose sin is covered.

verses.part1: Blessed is the man unto whom the Lord imputeth no sin
verses.part2: and in whose spirit there is no guile.

verses.part1: For while I held my tongue
verses.part2: my bones consumed away through my daily complaining.

verses.part1: For thy hand is heavy upon me day and night
verses.part2: and my moisture is like the drought in summer.

verses.part1: I will acknowledge my sin unto thee
verses.part2: and mine unrighteousness have I not hid.

verses.part1: I said, I will confess my sins unto the Lord
verses.part2: and so thou forgavest the wickedness of my sin.

verses.part1: For this shall every one that is godly make his prayer unto thee, in a time when thou mayest be found
verses.part2: but in the great water-floods they shall not come nigh him.

verses.part1: Thou art a place to hide me in, thou shalt preserve me from trouble
verses.part2: thou shalt compass me about with songs of deliverance.

verses.part1: I will inform thee, and teach thee in the way wherein thou shalt go
verses.part2: and I will guide thee with mine eye.

verses.part1: Be ye not like to horse and mule, which have no understanding
verses.part2: whose mouths must be held with bit and bridle, lest they fall upon thee.

verses.part1: Great plagues remain for the ungodly
verses.part2: but whoso putteth his trust in the Lord, mercy embraceth him on every side.

verses.part1: Be glad, O ye righteous, and rejoice in the Lord
verses.part2: and be joyful, all ye that are true of heart.

verses.part1: REJOICE in the Lord, O ye righteous
verses.part2: for it  becometh well the just to be thankful.

verses.part1: Praise the Lord with harp
verses.part2: sing praises unto him with the lute, and instrument of ten strings.

verses.part1: Sing unto the Lord a new song
verses.part2: sing praises lustily unto him with a good courage.

verses.part1: For the word of the Lord is true
verses.part2: and all his works are faithful.

verses.part1: He loveth righteousness and judgement
verses.part2: the earth is full of the goodness of the Lord.

verses.part1: By the word of the Lord were the heavens made
verses.part2: and all the hosts of them by the breath of his mouth.

verses.part1: He gathereth the waters of the sea together, as it were upon an heap
verses.part2: and layeth up the deep, as in a treasure-house.

verses.part1: Let all the earth fear the Lord
verses.part2: stand in awe of him, all ye that dwell in the world.

verses.part1: For he spake, and it was done
verses.part2: he commanded, and it stood fast.

verses.part1: The Lord bringeth the counsel of the heathen to nought
verses.part2: and maketh the devices of the people to be of none effect, and casteth out the counsels of princes.

verses.part1: The counsel of the Lord shall endure for ever
verses.part2: and the thoughts of his heart from generation to generation.

verses.part1: Blessed are the people, whose God is the Lord Jehovah
verses.part2: and blessed are the folk, that he hath chosen to him to be his inheritance.

verses.part1: The Lord looked down from heaven, and beheld all the children of men
verses.part2: from the habitation of his dwelling he considereth all them that dwell on the earth.

verses.part1: He fashioneth all the hearts of them
verses.part2: and understandeth all their works.

verses.part1: There is no king that can be saved by the multitude of an host
verses.part2: neither is any mighty man delivered by much strength.

verses.part1: A horse is counted but a vain thing to save a man
verses.part2: neither shall he deliver any man by his great strength.

verses.part1: Behold, the eye of the Lord is upon them that fear him
verses.part2: and upon them that put their trust in his mercy;

verses.part1: To deliver their soul from death
verses.part2: and to feed them in the time of dearth.

verses.part1: Our soul hath patiently tarried for the Lord
verses.part2: for he is our help and our shield.

verses.part1: For our heart shall rejoice in him
verses.part2: because we have hoped in his holy Name.

verses.part1: Let thy merciful kindness, O Lord, be upon us
verses.part2: like as we do put our trust in thee.

verses.part1: I WILL alway give thanks unto the Lord
verses.part2: his praise shall ever be in my mouth.

verses.part1: My soul shall make her boast in the Lord
verses.part2: the humble shall hear thereof, and be glad.

verses.part1: O praise the Lord with me
verses.part2: and let us magnify his Name together.

verses.part1: I sought the Lord, and he heard me
verses.part2: yea, he delivered me out of all my fear.

verses.part1: They had an eye unto him, and were lightened
verses.part2: and their faces were not ashamed.

verses.part1: Lo, the poor crieth, and the Lord heareth him
verses.part2: yea, and saveth him out of all his troubles.

verses.part1: The angel of the Lord tarrieth round about them that fear him
verses.part2: and delivereth them.

verses.part1: O taste, and see, how gracious the Lord is
verses.part2: blessed is the man that trusteth in him.

verses.part1: O fear the Lord, ye that are his saints
verses.part2: for they that fear him lack nothing.

verses.part1: The lions do lack, and suffer hunger
verses.part2: but they who seek the Lord shall want no manner of thing that is good.

verses.part1: Come, ye children, and hearken unto me
verses.part2: I will teach you the fear of the Lord.

verses.part1: What man is he that lusteth to live
verses.part2: and would fain see good days?

verses.part1: Keep thy tongue from evil
verses.part2: and thy lips, that they speak no guile.

verses.part1: Eschew evil, and do good
verses.part2: seek peace, and ensue it.

verses.part1: The eyes of the Lord are over the righteous
verses.part2: and his ears are open unto their prayers.

verses.part1: The countenance of the Lord is against them that do evil
verses.part2: to root out the remembrance of them from the earth.

verses.part1: The righteous cry, and the Lord heareth them
verses.part2: and delivereth them out of all their troubles.

verses.part1: The Lord is nigh unto them that are of a contrite heart
verses.part2: and will save such as be of an humble spirit.

verses.part1: Great are the troubles of the righteous
verses.part2: but the Lord delivereth him out of all.

verses.part1: He keepeth all his bones
verses.part2: so that not one of them is broken.

verses.part1: But misfortune shall slay the ungodly
verses.part2: and they that hate the righteous shall be desolate.

verses.part1: The Lord delivereth the souls of his servants
verses.part2: and all they that put their trust in him shall not be destitute.

verses.part1: PLEAD thou my cause, O Lord, with them that strive with me
verses.part2: and fight thou against them that fight against me.

verses.part1: Lay hand upon the shield and buckler
verses.part2: and stand up to help me.

verses.part1: Bring forth the spear, and stop the way against them that persecute me
verses.part2: say unto my soul, I am thy salvation.

verses.part1: Let them be confounded and put to shame, that seek after my soul
verses.part2: let them be turned back and brought to confusion, that imagine mischief for me.

verses.part1: Let them be as the dust before the wind
verses.part2: and the angel of the Lord scattering them.

verses.part1: Let their way be dark and slippery
verses.part2: and let the angel of the Lord persecute them.

verses.part1: For they have privily laid their net to destroy me without a cause
verses.part2: yea, even without a cause have they made a pit for my soul.

verses.part1: Let a sudden destruction come upon him un-awares, and his net, that he hath laid privily, catch himself
verses.part2: that he may fall into his own mischief.

verses.part1: And, my soul, be joyful in the Lord
verses.part2: it shall rejoice in his salvation.

verses.part1: All my bones shall say, Lord, who is like unto thee, who deliverest the poor from him that is too strong for him
verses.part2: yea, the poor, and him that is in misery, from him that spoileth him?

verses.part1: False witnesses did rise up
verses.part2: they laid to my charge things that I knew not.

verses.part1: They rewarded me evil for good
verses.part2: to the great discomfort of my soul.

verses.part1: Nevertheless, when they were sick, I put on sackcloth, and humbled my soul with fasting
verses.part2: and my prayer shall turn into mine own bosom.

verses.part1: I behaved myself as though it had been my friend or my brother
verses.part2: I went heavily, as one that mourneth for his mother.

verses.part1: But in mine adversity they rejoiced, and gathered themselves together
verses.part2: yea, the very abjects came together against me unawares, making mouths at me, and ceased not.

verses.part1: With the flatterers were busy mockers
verses.part2: who gnashed upon me with their teeth.

verses.part1: Lord, how long wilt thou look upon this
verses.part2: O deliver my soul from the calamities which they bring on me, and my darling from the lions.

verses.part1: So will I give thee thanks in the great congregation
verses.part2: I will praise thee among much people.

verses.part1: O let not them that are mine enemies triumph over me ungodly
verses.part2: neither let them wink with their eyes that hate me without a cause.

verses.part1: And why? their communing is not for peace
verses.part2: but they imagine deceitful words against them that are quiet in the land.

verses.part1: They gaped upon me with their mouths, and said
verses.part2: Fie on thee, fie on thee, we saw it with our eyes.

verses.part1: This thou hast seen, O Lord
verses.part2: hold not thy tongue then, go not far from me, O Lord.

verses.part1: Awake, and stand up to judge my quarrel
verses.part2: avenge thou my cause, my God, and my Lord.

verses.part1: Judge me, O Lord my God, according to thy righteousness
verses.part2: and let them not triumph over me.

verses.part1: Let them not say in their hearts, There, there, so would we have it
verses.part2: neither let them say, We have devoured him.

verses.part1: Let them be put to confusion and shame together, that rejoice at my trouble
verses.part2: let them be clothed with rebuke and dishonour, that boast themselves against me.

verses.part1: Let them be glad and rejoice, that favour my righteous dealing
verses.part2: yea, let them say alway, Blessed be the Lord, who hath pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.

verses.part1: And as for my tongue, it shall be talking of thy righteousness
verses.part2: and of thy praise all the day long.

verses.part1: MY heart sheweth me the wickedness of the ungodly
verses.part2: that there is no fear of God before his eyes.

verses.part1: For he flattereth himself in his own sight
verses.part2: until his abominable sin be found out.

verses.part1: The words of his mouth are unrighteous, and full of deceit
verses.part2: he hath left off to behave himself wisely, and to do good.

verses.part1: He imagineth mischief upon his bed, and hath set himself in no good way
verses.part2: neither doth he abhor any thing that is evil.

verses.part1: Thy mercy, O Lord, reacheth unto the heavens
verses.part2: and thy faithfulness unto the clouds.

verses.part1: Thy righteousness standeth like the strong mountains
verses.part2: thy judgements are like the great deep.

verses.part1: Thou, Lord, shalt save both man and beast; How excellent is thy mercy, O God
verses.part2: and the children of men shall put their trust under the shadow of thy wings.

verses.part1: They shall be satisfied with the plenteousness of thy house
verses.part2: and thou shalt give them drink of thy pleasures, as out of the river.

verses.part1: For with thee is the well of life
verses.part2: and in thy light shall we see light.

verses.part1: O continue forth thy loving-kindness unto them that know thee
verses.part2: and thy righteousness unto them that are true of heart.

verses.part1: O let not the foot of pride come against me
verses.part2: and let not the hand of the ungodly cast me down.

verses.part1: There are they fallen, all that work wickedness
verses.part2: they are cast down, and shall not be able to stand.

verses.part1: FRET not thyself because of the ungodly
verses.part2: neither be thou envious against the evil-doers.

verses.part1: For they shall soon be cut down like the grass
verses.part2: and be withered even as the green herb.

verses.part1: Put thou thy trust in the Lord, and be doing good
verses.part2: dwell in the land, and verily thou shalt be fed.

verses.part1: Delight thou in the Lord
verses.part2: and he shall give thee thy heart's desire.

verses.part1: Commit thy way unto the Lord, and put thy trust in him
verses.part2: and he shall bring it to pass.

verses.part1: He shall make thy righteousness as clear as the light
verses.part2: and thy just dealing as the noon-day.

verses.part1: Hold thee still in the Lord, and abide patiently upon him
verses.part2: but grieve not thyself at him whose way doth prosper, against the man that doeth after evil counsels.

verses.part1: Leave off from wrath, and let go displeasure
verses.part2: fret not thyself, else shalt thou be moved to do evil.

verses.part1: Wicked doers shall be rooted out
verses.part2: and they that patiently abide the Lord, those shall inherit the land.

verses.part1: Yet a little while, and the ungodly shall be clean gone
verses.part2: thou shalt look after his place, and he shall be away.

verses.part1: But the meek-spirited shall possess the earth
verses.part2: and shall be refreshed in the multitude of peace.

verses.part1: The ungodly seeketh counsel against the just
verses.part2: and gnasheth upon him with his teeth.

verses.part1: The Lord shall laugh him to scorn
verses.part2: for he hath seen that his day is coming.

verses.part1: The ungodly have drawn out the sword, and have bent their bow
verses.part2: to cast down the poor and needy, and to slay such as are of a right conversation.

verses.part1: Their sword shall go through their own heart
verses.part2: and their bow shall be broken.

verses.part1: A small thing that the righteous hath
verses.part2: is better than great riches of the ungodly.

verses.part1: For the arms of the ungodly shall be broken
verses.part2: and the Lord upholdeth the righteous.

verses.part1: The Lord knoweth the days of the godly
verses.part2: and their inheritance shall endure for ever.

verses.part1: They shall not be confounded in the perilous time
verses.part2: and in the days of dearth they shall have enough.

verses.part1: As for the ungodly, they shall perish; and the enemies of the Lord shall consume as the fat of lambs
verses.part2: yea, even as the smoke shall they consume away.

verses.part1: The ungodly borroweth, and payeth not again
verses.part2: but the righteous is merciful and liberal.

verses.part1: Such as are blessed of God shall possess the land
verses.part2: and they that are cursed of him shall be rooted out.

verses.part1: The Lord ordereth a good man's going
verses.part2: and maketh his way acceptable to himself.

verses.part1: Though he fall, he shall not be cast away
verses.part2: for the Lord upholdeth him with his hand.

verses.part1: I have been young, and now am old
verses.part2: and yet saw I never the righteous forsaken, nor his seed begging their bread.

verses.part1: The righteous is ever merciful, and lendeth
verses.part2: and his seed is blessed.

verses.part1: Flee from evil, and do the thing that is good
verses.part2: and dwell for evermore.

verses.part1: For the Lord loveth the thing that is right
verses.part2: he forsaketh not his that be godly, but they are preserved for ever.

verses.part1: The unrighteous shall be punished
verses.part2: as for the seed of the ungodly, it shall be rooted out.

verses.part1: The righteous shall inherit the land
verses.part2: and dwell therein for ever.

verses.part1: The mouth of the righteous is exercised in wisdom
verses.part2: and his tongue will be talking of judgement.

verses.part1: The law of his God is in his heart
verses.part2: and his goings shall not slide.

verses.part1: The ungodly seeth the righteous
verses.part2: and seeketh occasion to slay him.

verses.part1: The Lord will not leave him in his hand
verses.part2: nor condemn him when he is judged.

verses.part1: Hope thou in the Lord, and keep his way, and he shall promote thee, that thou shalt possess the land
verses.part2: when the ungodly shall perish, thou shalt see it.

verses.part1: I myself have seen the ungodly in great power
verses.part2: and flourishing like a green bay-tree.

verses.part1: I went by, and lo, he was gone
verses.part2: I sought him, but his place could no where be found.

verses.part1: Keep innocency, and take heed unto the thing that is right
verses.part2: for that shall bring a man peace at the last.

verses.part1: As for the transgressors, they shall perish together
verses.part2: and the end of the ungodly is, they shall be rooted out at the last.

verses.part1: But the salvation of the righteous cometh of the Lord
verses.part2: who is also their strength in the time of trouble.

verses.part1: And the Lord shall stand by them, and save them
verses.part2: he shall deliver them from the ungodly, and shall save them, because they put their trust in him.

verses.part1: PUT me not to rebuke, O Lord, in thine anger
verses.part2: neither chasten me in thy heavy displeasure.

verses.part1: For thine arrows stick fast in me
verses.part2: and thy hand presseth me sore.

verses.part1: There is no health in my flesh, because of thy displeasure
verses.part2: neither is there any rest in my bones, by reason of my sin.

verses.part1: For my wickednesses are gone over my head
verses.part2: and are like a sore burden, too heavy for me to bear.

verses.part1: My wounds stink, and are corrupt
verses.part2: through my foolishness.

verses.part1: I am brought into so great trouble and misery
verses.part2: that I go mourning all the day long.

verses.part1: For my loins are filled with a sore disease
verses.part2: and there is no whole part in my body.

verses.part1: I am feeble, and sore smitten
verses.part2: I have roared for the very disquietness of my heart.

verses.part1: Lord, thou knowest all my desire
verses.part2: and my groaning is not hid from thee.

verses.part1: My heart panteth, my strength hath failed me
verses.part2: and the sight of mine eyes is gone from me.

verses.part1: My lovers and my neighbours did stand looking upon my trouble
verses.part2: and my kinsmen stood afar off.

verses.part1: They also that sought after my life laid snares for me
verses.part2: and they that went about to do me evil talked of wickedness, and imagined deceit all the day long.

verses.part1: As for me, I was like a deaf man, and heard not
verses.part2: and as one that is dumb, who doth not open his mouth.

verses.part1: I became even as a man that heareth not
verses.part2: and in whose mouth are no reproofs.

verses.part1: For in thee, O Lord, have I put my trust
verses.part2: thou shalt answer for me, O Lord my God.

verses.part1: I have required that they, even mine enemies, should not triumph over me
verses.part2: for when my foot slipped, they rejoiced greatly against me.

verses.part1: And I, truly, am set in the plague
verses.part2: and my heaviness is ever in my sight.

verses.part1: For I will confess my wickedness
verses.part2: and be sorry for my sin.

verses.part1: But mine enemies live, and are mighty
verses.part2: and they that hate me wrongfully are many in number.

verses.part1: They also that reward evil for good are against me
verses.part2: because I follow the thing that good is.

verses.part1: Forsake me not, O Lord my God
verses.part2: be not thou far from me.

verses.part1: Haste thee to help me
verses.part2: O Lord God of my salvation.

verses.part1: I SAID, I will take heed to my ways
verses.part2: that I offend not in my tongue.

verses.part1: I will keep my mouth as it were with a bridle
verses.part2: while the ungodly is in my sight.

verses.part1: I held my tongue, and spake nothing
verses.part2: I kept silence, yea, even from good words; but it was pain and grief to me.

verses.part1: My heart was hot within me, and while I was thus musing the fire kindled
verses.part2: and at the last I spake with my tongue;

verses.part1: Lord, let me know mine end, and the number of my days
verses.part2: that I may be certified how long I have to live.

verses.part1: Behold, thou hast made my days as it were a span long
verses.part2: and mine age is even as nothing in respect of thee; and verily every man living is altogether vanity.

verses.part1: For man walketh in a vain shadow, and disquieteth himself in vain
verses.part2: he heapeth up riches, and cannot tell who shall gather them.

verses.part1: And now, Lord, what is my hope
verses.part2: truly my hope is even in thee.

verses.part1: Deliver me from all mine offences
verses.part2: and make me not a rebuke unto the foolish.

verses.part1: I became dumb, and opened not my mouth
verses.part2: for it was thy doing.

verses.part1: Take thy plague away from me
verses.part2: I am even consumed by the means of thy heavy hand.

verses.part1: When thou with rebukes dost chasten man for sin, thou makest his beauty to consume away, like as it were a moth fretting a garment
verses.part2: every man therefore is but vanity.

verses.part1: Hear my prayer, O Lord, and with thine ears consider my calling
verses.part2: hold not thy peace at my tears.

verses.part1: For I am a stranger with thee
verses.part2: and a sojourner, as all my fathers were.

verses.part1: O spare me a little, that I may recover my strength
verses.part2: before I go hence, and be no more seen.

verses.part1: I WAITED patiently for the Lord
verses.part2: and he inclined unto me, and heard my calling.

verses.part1: He brought me also out of the horrible pit, out of the mire and clay
verses.part2: and set my feet upon the rock, and ordered my goings.

verses.part1: And he hath put a new song in my mouth
verses.part2: even a thanksgiving unto our God.

verses.part1: Many shall see it, and fear
verses.part2: and shall put their trust in the Lord.

verses.part1: Blessed is the man that hath set his hope in the Lord
verses.part2: and turned not unto the proud, and to such as go about with lies.

verses.part1: O Lord my God, great are the wondrous works which thou hast done, like as be also thy thoughts which are to us-ward
verses.part2: and yet there is no man that ordereth them unto thee.

verses.part1: If I should declare them, and speak of them
verses.part2: they should be more than I am able to express.

verses.part1: Sacrifice and meat-offering thou wouldest not
verses.part2: but mine ears hast thou opened.

verses.part1: Burnt-offerings, and sacrifice for sin, hast thou not required
verses.part2: then said I, Lo, I come,

verses.part1: In the volume of the book it is written of me, that I should fulfil thy will, O my God
verses.part2: I am content to do it; yea, thy law is within my heart.

verses.part1: I have declared thy righteousness in the great congregation
verses.part2: lo, I will not refrain my lips, O Lord, and that thou knowest.

verses.part1: I have not hid thy righteousness within my heart
verses.part2: my talk hath been of thy truth and of thy salvation.

verses.part1: I have not kept back thy loving mercy and truth
verses.part2: from the great congregation.

verses.part1: Withdraw not thou thy mercy from me, O Lord
verses.part2: let thy loving-kindness and thy truth alway preserve me.

verses.part1: For innumerable troubles are come about me; my sins have taken such hold upon me that I am not able to look up
verses.part2: yea, they are more in number than the hairs of my head, and my heart hath failed me.

verses.part1: O Lord, let it be thy pleasure to deliver me
verses.part2: make haste, O Lord, to help me.

verses.part1: Let them be ashamed and confounded together, that seek after my soul to destroy it
verses.part2: let them be driven backward and put to rebuke, that wish me evil.

verses.part1: Let them be desolate, and rewarded with shame
verses.part2: that say unto me, Fie upon thee, fie upon thee.
