verses.part1: Let all those that seek thee be joyful and glad in thee
verses.part2: and let such as love thy salvation say alway, The Lord be praised.

verses.part1: As for me, I am poor and needy
verses.part2: but the Lord careth for me.

verses.part1: Thou art my helper and redeemer
verses.part2: make no long tarrying, O my God.

verses.part1: BLESSED is he that considereth the poor and needy
verses.part2: the Lord shall deliver him in the time of trouble.

verses.part1: The Lord preserve him, and keep him alive, that he may be blessed upon earth
verses.part2: and deliver not thou him into the will of his enemies.

verses.part1: The Lord comfort him, when he lieth sick upon his bed
verses.part2: make thou all his bed in his sickness.

verses.part1: I said, Lord, be merciful unto me
verses.part2: heal my soul, for I have sinned against thee.

verses.part1: Mine enemies speak evil of me
verses.part2: When shall he die, and his name perish?

verses.part1: And if he come to see me, he speaketh vanity
verses.part2: and his heart conceiveth falsehood within himself, and when he cometh forth he telleth it.

verses.part1: All mine enemies whisper together against me
verses.part2: even against me do they imagine this evil.

verses.part1: Let the sentence of guiltiness proceed against him
verses.part2: and now that he lieth, let him rise up no more.

verses.part1: Yea, even mine own familiar friend, whom I trusted
verses.part2: who did also eat of my bread, hath laid great wait for me.

verses.part1: But be thou merciful unto me, O Lord
verses.part2: raise thou me up again, and I shall reward them.

verses.part1: By this I know thou favourest me
verses.part2: that mine enemy doth not triumph against me.

verses.part1: And when I am in my health, thou upholdest me
verses.part2: and shalt set me before thy face for ever.

verses.part1: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel
verses.part2: world without end. Amen.

verses.part1: LIKE as the hart desireth the water-brooks
verses.part2: so  longeth my soul after thee, O God.

verses.part1: My soul is athirst for God, yea, even for the living God
verses.part2: when shall I come to appear before the presence of God?

verses.part1: My tears have been my meat day and night
verses.part2: while they daily say unto me, Where is now thy God?

verses.part1: Now when I think thereupon, I pour out my heart by myself
verses.part2: for I went with the multitude, and brought them forth into the house of God;

verses.part1: In the voice of praise and thanksgiving
verses.part2: among such as keep holy-day.

verses.part1: Why art thou so full of heaviness, O my soul
verses.part2: and why art thou so disquieted within me?

verses.part1: Put thy trust in God
verses.part2: for I will yet give him thanks for the help of his countenance.

verses.part1: My God, my soul is vexed within me
verses.part2: therefore will I remember thee concerning the land of Jordan, and the little hill of Hermon.

verses.part1: One deep calleth another, because of the noise of the water-pipes
verses.part2: all thy waves and storms are gone over me.

verses.part1: The Lord hath granted his loving-kindness in the day-time
verses.part2: and in the night-season did I sing of him, and made my prayer unto the God of my life.

verses.part1: I will say unto the God of my strength, Why hast thou forgotten me
verses.part2: why go I thus heavily, while the enemy oppresseth me?

verses.part1: My bones are smitten asunder as with a sword
verses.part2: while mine enemies that trouble me cast me in the teeth;

verses.part1: Namely, while they say daily unto me
verses.part2: Where is now thy God?

verses.part1: Why art thou so vexed, O my soul
verses.part2: and why art thou so disquieted within me?

verses.part1: O put thy trust in God
verses.part2: for I will yet thank him, which is the help of my countenance, and my God.

verses.part1: GIVE sentence with me, O God, and defend my cause against the ungodly people
verses.part2: O deliver me from the deceitful and wicked man.

verses.part1: For thou art the God of my strength, why hast thou put me from thee
verses.part2: and why go I so heavily, while the enemy oppresseth me?

verses.part1: O send out thy light and thy truth, that they may lead me
verses.part2: and bring me unto thy holy hill, and to thy dwelling.

verses.part1: And that I may go unto the altar of God, even unto the God of my joy and gladness
verses.part2: and upon the harp will I give thanks unto thee, O God, my God.

verses.part1: Why art thou so heavy, O my soul
verses.part2: and why art thou so disquieted within me?

verses.part1: O put thy trust in God
verses.part2: for I will yet give him thanks, which is the help of my countenance, and my God.

verses.part1: WE have heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us
verses.part2: what thou hast done in their time of old;

verses.part1: How thou hast driven out the heathen with thy hand, and planted them in
verses.part2: how thou hast destroyed the nations and cast them out.

verses.part1: For they gat not the land in possession through their own sword
verses.part2: neither was it their own arm that helped them;

verses.part1: But thy right hand, and thine arm, and the light of thy countenance
verses.part2: because thou hadst a favour unto them.

verses.part1: Thou art my King, O God
verses.part2: send help unto Jacob.

verses.part1: Through thee will we overthrow our enemies
verses.part2: and in thy Name will we tread them under, that rise up against us.

verses.part1: For I will not trust in my bow
verses.part2: it is not my sword that shall help me;

verses.part1: But it is thou that savest us from our enemies
verses.part2: and puttest them to confusion that hate us.

verses.part1: We make our boast of God all day long
verses.part2: and will praise thy Name for ever.

verses.part1: But now thou art far off, and puttest us to confusion
verses.part2: and goest not forth with our armies.

verses.part1: Thou makest us to turn our backs upon our enemies
verses.part2: so that they which hate us spoil our goods.

verses.part1: Thou lettest us be eaten up like sheep
verses.part2: and hast scattered us among the heathen.

verses.part1: Thou sellest thy people for nought
verses.part2: and takest no money for them.

verses.part1: Thou makest us to be rebuked of our neighbours
verses.part2: to be laughed to scorn, and had in derision of them that are round about us.

verses.part1: Thou makest us to be a by-word among the heathen
verses.part2: and that the people shake their heads at us.

verses.part1: My confusion is daily before me
verses.part2: and the shame of my face hath covered me;

verses.part1: For the voice of the slanderer and blasphemer
verses.part2: for the enemy and avenger.

verses.part1: And though all this be come upon us, yet do we not forget thee
verses.part2: nor behave ourselves frowardly in thy covenant.

verses.part1: Our heart is not turned back
verses.part2: neither our steps gone out of thy way;

verses.part1: No, not when thou hast smitten us into the place of dragons
verses.part2: and covered us with the shadow of death.

verses.part1: If we have forgotten the Name of our God, and holden up our hands to any strange god
verses.part2: shall not God search it out? for he knoweth the very secrets of the heart.

verses.part1: For thy sake also are we killed all the day long
verses.part2: and are counted as sheep appointed to be slain.

verses.part1: Up, Lord, why sleepest thou
verses.part2: awake, and be not absent from us for ever.

verses.part1: Wherefore hidest thou thy face
verses.part2: and forgettest our misery and trouble?

verses.part1: For our soul is brought low, even unto the dust
verses.part2: our belly cleaveth unto the ground.

verses.part1: Arise, and help us
verses.part2: and deliver us for thy mercy's sake.

verses.part1: MY heart is inditing of a good matter
verses.part2: I speak of the things which I have made unto the King.

verses.part1: My tongue is the pen
verses.part2: of a ready writer.

verses.part1: Thou art fairer than the children of men
verses.part2: full of grace are thy lips, because God hath blessed thee for ever.

verses.part1: Gird thee with thy sword upon thy thigh, O thou most Mighty
verses.part2: according to thy worship and renown.

verses.part1: Good luck have thou with thine honour
verses.part2: ride on, because of the word of truth, of meekness, and righteousness; and thy right hand shall teach thee terrible things.

verses.part1: Thy arrows are very sharp, and the people shall be subdued unto thee
verses.part2: even in the midst among the King's enemies.

verses.part1: Thy seat, O God, endureth for ever
verses.part2: the sceptre of thy kingdom is a right sceptre.

verses.part1: Thou hast loved righteousness, and hated iniquity
verses.part2: wherefore God, even thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.

verses.part1: All thy garments smell of myrrh, aloes, and cassia
verses.part2: out of the ivory palaces, whereby they have made thee glad.

verses.part1: Kings' daughters were among thy honourable women
verses.part2: upon thy right hand did stand the queen in a vesture of gold, wrought about with divers colours.

verses.part1: Hearken, O daughter, and consider, incline thine ear
verses.part2: forget also thine own people, and thy father's house.

verses.part1: So shall the King have pleasure in thy beauty
verses.part2: for he is thy Lord God, and worship thou him.

verses.part1: And the daughter of Tyre shall be there with a gift
verses.part2: like as the rich also among the people shall make their supplication before thee.

verses.part1: The King's daughter is all glorious within
verses.part2: her clothing is of wrought gold.

verses.part1: She shall be brought unto the King in raiment of needle-work
verses.part2: the virgins that be her fellows shall bear her company, and shall be brought unto thee.

verses.part1: With joy and gladness shall they be brought
verses.part2: and shall enter into the King's palace.

verses.part1: Instead of thy fathers thou shalt have children
verses.part2: whom thou mayest make princes in all lands.

verses.part1: I will remember thy Name from one generation to another
verses.part2: therefore shall the people give thanks unto thee, world without end.

verses.part1: GOD is our hope and strength
verses.part2: a very present  help in trouble.

verses.part1: Therefore will we not fear, though the earth be moved
verses.part2: and though the hills be carried into the midst of the sea;

verses.part1: Though the waters thereof rage and swell
verses.part2: and though the mountains shake at the tempest of the same.

verses.part1: The rivers of the flood thereof shall make glad the city of God
verses.part2: the holy place of the tabernacle of the most Highest.

verses.part1: God is in the midst of her, therefore shall she not be removed
verses.part2: God shall help her, and that right early.

verses.part1: The heathen make much ado, and the kingdoms are moved
verses.part2: but God hath shewed his voice, and the earth shall melt away.

verses.part1: The Lord of hosts is with us
verses.part2: the God of Jacob is our refuge.

verses.part1: O come hither, and behold the works of the Lord
verses.part2: what destruction he hath brought upon the earth.

verses.part1: He maketh wars to cease in all the world
verses.part2: he breaketh the bow, and knappeth the spear in sunder, and burneth the chariots in the fire.

verses.part1: Be still then, and know that I am God
verses.part2: I will be exalted among the heathen, and I will be exalted in the earth.

verses.part1: The Lord of hosts is with us
verses.part2: the God of Jacob is our refuge.

verses.part1: O CLAP your hands together, all ye people
verses.part2: O Sing unto God with the voice of melody.

verses.part1: For the Lord is high, and to be feared
verses.part2: he is the great King upon all the earth.

verses.part1: He shall subdue the people under us
verses.part2: and the nations under our feet.

verses.part1: He shall choose out an heritage for us
verses.part2: even the worship of Jacob, whom he loved.

verses.part1: God is gone up with a merry noise
verses.part2: and the Lord with the sound of the trump.

verses.part1: O sing praises, sing praises unto our God
verses.part2: O sing praises, sing praises unto our King.

verses.part1: For God is the King of all the earth
verses.part2: sing ye praises with understanding.

verses.part1: God reigneth over the heathen
verses.part2: God sitteth upon his holy seat.

verses.part1: The princes of the people are joined unto the people of the God of Abraham
verses.part2: for God, which is very high exalted, doth defend the earth, as it were with a shield.

verses.part1: GREAT is the Lord, and highly to be praised
verses.part2: in the city of our God, even upon his holy hill.

verses.part1: The hill of Sion is a fair place, and the joy of the whole earth
verses.part2: upon the north-side lieth the city of the great King; God is well known in her palaces as a sure refuge.

verses.part1: For lo, the kings of the earth
verses.part2: are gathered, and gone by together.

verses.part1: They marvelled to see such things
verses.part2: they were astonished, and suddenly cast down.

verses.part1: Fear came there upon them, and sorrow
verses.part2: as upon a woman in her travail.

verses.part1: Thou shalt break the ships of the sea
verses.part2: through the east-wind.

verses.part1: Like as we have heard, so have we seen in the city of the Lord of hosts, in the city of our God
verses.part2: God upholdeth the same for ever.

verses.part1: We wait for thy loving-kindness, O God
verses.part2: in the midst of thy temple.

verses.part1: O God, according to thy Name, so is thy praise unto the world's end
verses.part2: thy right hand is full of righteousness.

verses.part1: Let the mount Sion rejoice, and the daughters of Judah be glad
verses.part2: because of thy judgements.

verses.part1: Walk about Sion, and go round about her
verses.part2: and tell the towers thereof.

verses.part1: Mark well her bulwarks, set up her houses
verses.part2: that ye may tell them that come after.

verses.part1: For this God is our God for ever and ever
verses.part2: he shall be our guide unto death.

verses.part1: O HEAR ye this, all ye people
verses.part2: ponder it with your ears, all ye that dwell in the world;

verses.part1: High and low, rich and poor
verses.part2: one with another.

verses.part1: My mouth shall speak of wisdom
verses.part2: and my heart shall muse of understanding.

verses.part1: I will incline mine ear to the parable
verses.part2: and shew my dark speech upon the harp.

verses.part1: Wherefore should I fear in the days of wickedness
verses.part2: and when the wickedness of my heels compasseth me round about?

verses.part1: There be some that put their trust in their goods
verses.part2: and boast themselves in the multitude of their riches.

verses.part1: But no man may deliver his brother
verses.part2: nor make agreement unto God for him;

verses.part1: For it cost more to redeem their souls
verses.part2: so that he must let that alone for ever;

verses.part1: Yea, though he live long
verses.part2: and see not the grave.

verses.part1: For he seeth that wise men also die, and perish together
verses.part2: as well as the ignorant and foolish, and leave their riches for other.

verses.part1: And yet they think that their houses shall continue for ever
verses.part2: and that their dwelling-places shall endure from one generation to another; and call the lands after their own names.

verses.part1: Nevertheless, man will not abide in honour
verses.part2: seeing he may be compared unto the beasts that perish; this is the way of them.

verses.part1: This is their foolishness
verses.part2: and their posterity praise their saying.

verses.part1: They lie in the hell like sheep, death gnaweth upon them, and the righteous shall have domination over them in the morning
verses.part2: their beauty shall consume in the sepulchre out of their dwelling.

verses.part1: But God hath delivered my soul from the place of hell
verses.part2: for he shall receive me.

verses.part1: Be not thou afraid, though one be made rich
verses.part2: or if the glory of his house be increased;

verses.part1: For he shall carry nothing away with him when he dieth
verses.part2: neither shall his pomp follow him.

verses.part1: For while he lived, he counted himself an happy man
verses.part2: and so long as thou doest well unto thyself, men will speak good of thee.

verses.part1: He shall follow the generation of his fathers
verses.part2: and shall never see light.

verses.part1: Man being in honour hath no understanding
verses.part2: but is compared unto the beasts that perish.

verses.part1: THE Lord, even the most mighty God, hath spoken
verses.part2: and called the world, from the rising up of the sun unto the going down thereof.

verses.part1: Out of Sion hath God appeared
verses.part2: in perfect beauty.

verses.part1: Our God shall come, and shall not keep silence
verses.part2: there shall go before him a consuming fire, and a mighty tempest shall be stirred up round about him.

verses.part1: He shall call the heaven from above
verses.part2: and the earth, that he may judge his people.

verses.part1: Gather my saints together unto me
verses.part2: those that have made a covenant with me with sacrifice.

verses.part1: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness
verses.part2: for God is Judge himself.

verses.part1: Hear, O my people, and I will speak
verses.part2: I myself will testify against thee, O Israel; for I am God, even thy God.

verses.part1: I will not reprove thee because of thy sacrifices, or for thy burnt-offerings
verses.part2: because they were not alway before me.

verses.part1: I will take no bullock out of thine house
verses.part2: nor he-goat out of thy folds.

verses.part1: For all the beasts of the forest are mine
verses.part2: and so are the cattle upon a thousand hills.

verses.part1: I know all the fowls upon the mountains
verses.part2: and the wild beasts of the field are in my sight.

verses.part1: If I be hungry, I will not tell thee
verses.part2: for the whole world is mine, and all that is therein.

verses.part1: Thinkest thou that I will eat bulls' flesh
verses.part2: and drink the blood of goats?

verses.part1: Offer unto God thanksgiving
verses.part2: and pay thy vows unto the most Highest.

verses.part1: And call upon me in the time of trouble
verses.part2: so will I hear thee, and thou shalt praise me.

verses.part1: But unto the ungodly said God
verses.part2: Why dost thou preach my laws, and takest my covenant in thy mouth;

verses.part1: Whereas thou hatest to be reformed
verses.part2: and hast cast my words behind thee?

verses.part1: When thou sawest a thief, thou consentedst unto him
verses.part2: and hast been partaker with the adulterers.

verses.part1: Thou hast let thy mouth speak wickedness
verses.part2: and with thy tongue thou hast set forth deceit.

verses.part1: Thou satest, and spakest against thy brother
verses.part2: yea, and hast slandered thine own mother's son.

verses.part1: These things hast thou done, and I held my tongue, and thou thoughtest wickedly, that I am even such a one as thyself
verses.part2: but I will reprove thee, and set before thee the things that thou hast done.

verses.part1: O consider this, ye that forget God
verses.part2: lest I pluck you away, and there be none to deliver you.

verses.part1: Whoso offereth me thanks and praise, he honoureth me
verses.part2: and to him that ordereth his conversation right will I shew the salvation of God.

verses.part1: HAVE mercy upon me, O God, after thy great goodness
verses.part2: according to the multitude of thy mercies do away mine offences.

verses.part1: Wash me throughly from my wickedness
verses.part2: and cleanse me from my sin.

verses.part1: For I acknowledge my faults
verses.part2: and my sin is ever before me.

verses.part1: Against thee only have I sinned, and done this evil in thy sight
verses.part2: that thou mightest be justified in thy saying, and clear when thou art judged.

verses.part1: Behold, I was shapen in wickedness
verses.part2: and in sin hath my mother conceived me.

verses.part1: But lo, thou requirest truth in the inward parts
verses.part2: and shalt make me to understand wisdom secretly.

verses.part1: Thou shalt purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean
verses.part2: thou shalt wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.

verses.part1: Thou shalt make me hear of joy and gladness
verses.part2: that the bones which thou hast broken may rejoice.

verses.part1: Turn thy face from my sins
verses.part2: and put out all my misdeeds.

verses.part1: Make me a clean heart, O God
verses.part2: and renew a right spirit within me.

verses.part1: Cast me not away from thy presence
verses.part2: and take not thy holy Spirit from me.

verses.part1: O give me the comfort of thy help again
verses.part2: and stablish me with thy free Spirit.

verses.part1: Then shall I teach thy ways unto the wicked
verses.part2: and sinners shall be converted unto thee.

verses.part1: Deliver me from blood-guiltiness, O God, thou that art the God of my health
verses.part2: and my tongue shall sing of thy righteousness.

verses.part1: Thou shalt open my lips, O Lord
verses.part2: and my mouth shall shew thy praise.

verses.part1: For thou desirest no sacrifice, else would I give it thee
verses.part2: but thou delightest not in burnt-offerings.

verses.part1: The sacrifice of God is a troubled spirit
verses.part2: a broken and contrite heart, O God, shalt thou not despise.

verses.part1: O be favourable and gracious unto Sion
verses.part2: build thou the walls of Jerusalem.

verses.part1: Then shalt thou be pleased with the sacrifice of righteousness, with the burnt-offerings and oblations
verses.part2: then shall they offer young bullocks upon thine altar.

verses.part1: WHY boastest thou thyself, thou tyrant
verses.part2: that thou canst do mischief;

verses.part1: Whereas the goodness of God
verses.part2: endureth yet daily?

verses.part1: Thy tongue imagineth wickedness
verses.part2: and with lies thou cuttest like a sharp rasor.

verses.part1: Thou hast loved unrighteousness more than goodness
verses.part2: and to talk of lies more than righteousness.

verses.part1: Thou hast loved to speak all words that may do hurt
verses.part2: O thou false tongue.

verses.part1: Therefore shall God destroy thee for ever
verses.part2: he shall take thee, and pluck thee out of thy dwelling, and root thee out of the land of the living.

verses.part1: The righteous also shall see this, and fear
verses.part2: and shall laugh him to scorn;

verses.part1: Lo, this is the man that took not God for his strength
verses.part2: but trusted unto the multitude of his riches, and strengthened himself in his wickedness.

verses.part1: As for me, I am like a green olive-tree in the house of God
verses.part2: my trust is in the tender mercy of God for ever and ever.

verses.part1: I will always give thanks unto thee for that thou hast done
verses.part2: and I will hope in thy Name, for thy saints like it well.

verses.part1: THE foolish body hath said in his heart
verses.part2: There is no God.

verses.part1: Corrupt are they, and become abominable in their wickedness
verses.part2: there is none that doeth good.

verses.part1: God looked down from heaven upon the children of men
verses.part2: to see if there were any that would understand, and seek after God.

verses.part1: But they are all gone out of the way, they are altogether become abominable
verses.part2: there is also none that doeth good, no not one.

verses.part1: Are not they without understanding, that work wickedness
verses.part2: eating up my people as if they would eat bread? they have not called upon God.

verses.part1: They were afraid where no fear was
verses.part2: for God hath broken the bones of him that besieged thee; thou hast put them to confusion, because God hath despised them.

verses.part1: O that the salvation were given unto Israel out of Sion
verses.part2: O that the Lord would deliver his people out of captivity!

verses.part1: Then should Jacob rejoice
verses.part2: and Israel should be right glad.

verses.part1: SAVE me, O God, for thy Name's sake
verses.part2: and avenge me in thy strength.

verses.part1: Hear my prayer, O God
verses.part2: and hearken unto the words of my mouth.

verses.part1: For strangers are risen up against me
verses.part2: and tyrants, which have not God before their eyes, seek after my soul.

verses.part1: Behold, God is my helper
verses.part2: the Lord is with them that uphold my soul.

verses.part1: He shall reward evil unto mine enemies
verses.part2: destroy thou them in thy truth.

verses.part1: An offering of a free heart will I give thee, and praise thy Name, O Lord
verses.part2: because it is so comfortable.

verses.part1: For he hath delivered me out of all my trouble
verses.part2: and mine eye hath seen his desire upon mine enemies.

verses.part1: HEAR my prayer, O God
verses.part2: and hide not thyself from my petition.

verses.part1: Take heed unto me, and hear me
verses.part2: how I mourn in my prayer, and am vexed.

verses.part1: The enemy crieth so, and the ungodly cometh on so fast
verses.part2: for they are minded to do me some mischief; so maliciously are they set against me.

verses.part1: My heart is disquieted within me
verses.part2: and the fear of death is fallen upon me.

verses.part1: Fearfulness and trembling are come upon me
verses.part2: and an horrible dread hath overwhelmed me.

verses.part1: And I said, O that I had wings like a dove
verses.part2: for then would I flee away, and be at rest.

verses.part1: Lo, then would I get me away far off
verses.part2: and remain in the wilderness.

verses.part1: I would make haste to escape
verses.part2: because of the stormy wind and tempest.

verses.part1: Destroy their tongues, O Lord, and divide them
verses.part2: for I have spied unrighteousness and strife in the city.

verses.part1: Day and night they go about within the walls thereof
verses.part2: mischief also and sorrow are in the midst of it.

verses.part1: Wickedness is therein
verses.part2: deceit and guile go not out of their streets.

verses.part1: For it is not an open enemy, that hath done me this dishonour
verses.part2: for then I could have borne it.

verses.part1: Neither was it mine adversary, that did magnify himself against me
verses.part2: for then peradventure I would have hid myself from him.

verses.part1: But it was even thou, my companion
verses.part2: my guide, and mine own familiar friend.

verses.part1: We took sweet counsel together
verses.part2: and walked in the house of God as friends.

verses.part1: Let death come hastily upon them, and let them go down quick into hell
verses.part2: for wickedness is in their dwellings, and among them.

verses.part1: As for me, I will call upon God
verses.part2: and the Lord shall save me.

verses.part1: In the evening, and morning, and at noon-day will I pray, and that instantly
verses.part2: and he shall hear my voice.

verses.part1: It is he that hath delivered my soul in peace from the battle that was against me
verses.part2: for there were many with me.

verses.part1: Yea, even God, that endureth for ever, shall hear me, and bring them down
verses.part2: for they will not turn, nor fear God.

verses.part1: He laid his hands upon such as be at peace with him
verses.part2: and he brake his covenant.

verses.part1: The words of his mouth were softer than butter, having war in his heart
verses.part2: his words were smoother than oil, and yet be they very swords.

verses.part1: O cast thy burden upon the Lord, and he shall nourish thee
verses.part2: and shall not suffer the righteous to fall for ever.

verses.part1: And as for them
verses.part2: thou, O God, shalt bring them into the pit of destruction.

verses.part1: The blood-thirsty and deceitful men shall not live out half their days
verses.part2: nevertheless, my trust shall be in thee, O Lord.

verses.part1: BE merciful unto me, O God, for man goeth about to devour me
verses.part2: he is daily fighting, and troubling me.

verses.part1: Mine enemies are daily in hand to swallow me up
verses.part2: for they be many that fight against me, O thou most Highest.

verses.part1: Nevertheless, though I am sometime afraid
verses.part2: yet put I my trust in thee.

verses.part1: I will praise God, because of his word
verses.part2: I have put my trust in God, and will not fear what flesh can do unto me.

verses.part1: They daily mistake my words
verses.part2: all that they imagine is to do me evil.

verses.part1: They hold all together, and keep themselves close
verses.part2: and mark my steps, when they lay wait for my soul.

verses.part1: Shall they escape for their wickedness
verses.part2: thou, O God, in thy displeasure shalt cast them down.

verses.part1: Thou tellest my flittings; put my tears into thy bottle
verses.part2: are not these things noted in thy book?

verses.part1: Whensoever I call upon thee, then shall mine enemies be put to flight
verses.part2: this I know; for God is on my side.

verses.part1: In God's word will I rejoice
verses.part2: in the Lord's word will I comfort me.

verses.part1: Yea, in God have I put my trust
verses.part2: I will not be afraid what man can do unto me.

verses.part1: Unto thee, O God, will I pay my vows
verses.part2: unto thee will I give thanks.

verses.part1: For thou hast delivered my soul from death, and my feet from falling
verses.part2: that I may walk before God in the light of the living.

verses.part1: BE merciful unto me, O God, be merciful unto me, for my soul trusteth in thee
verses.part2: and under the shadow of thy wings shall be my refuge, until this tyranny be over-past.

verses.part1: I will call unto the most high God
verses.part2: even unto the God that shall perform the cause which I have in hand.

verses.part1: He shall send from heaven
verses.part2: and save me from the reproof of him that would eat me up.

verses.part1: God shall send forth his mercy and truth
verses.part2: my soul is among lions.

verses.part1: And I lie even among the children of men, that are set on fire
verses.part2: whose teeth are spears and arrows, and their tongue a sharp sword.

verses.part1: Set up thyself, O God, above the heavens
verses.part2: and thy glory above all the earth.

verses.part1: They have laid a net for my feet, and pressed down my soul
verses.part2: they have digged a pit before me, and are fallen into the midst of it themselves.

verses.part1: My heart is fixed, O God, my heart is fixed
verses.part2: I will sing, and give praise.

verses.part1: Awake up, my glory; awake, lute and harp
verses.part2: I myself will awake right early.

verses.part1: I will give thanks unto thee, O Lord, among the people
verses.part2: and I will sing unto thee among the nations.

verses.part1: For the greatness of thy mercy reacheth unto the heavens
verses.part2: and thy truth unto the clouds.

verses.part1: Set up thyself, O God, above the heavens
verses.part2: and thy glory above all the earth.

verses.part1: ARE your minds set upon righteousness, O ye congregation
verses.part2: and do ye judge the thing that is right, O ye sons of men?

verses.part1: Yea, ye imagine mischief in your heart upon the earth
verses.part2: and your hands deal with wickedness.

verses.part1: The ungodly are froward, even from their mother's womb
verses.part2: as soon as they are born, they go astray, and speak lies.

verses.part1: They are as venomous as the poison of a serpent
verses.part2: even like the deaf adder that stoppeth her ears;

verses.part1: Which refuseth to hear the voice of the charmer
verses.part2: charm he never so wisely.

verses.part1: Break their teeth, O God, in their mouths; smite the jaw-bones of the lions, O Lord
verses.part2: let them fall away like water that runneth apace; and when they shoot their arrows let them be rooted out.

verses.part1: Let them consume away like a snail, and be like the untimely fruit of a woman
verses.part2: and let them not see the sun.

verses.part1: Or ever your pots be made hot with thorns
verses.part2: so let indignation vex him, even as a thing that is raw.

verses.part1: The righteous shall rejoice when he seeth the vengeance
verses.part2: he shall wash his footsteps in the blood of the ungodly.

verses.part1: So that a man shall say, Verily there is a reward for the righteous
verses.part2: doubtless there is a God that judgeth the earth.

verses.part1: DELIVER me from mine enemies, O God
verses.part2: defend me from them that rise up against me.

verses.part1: O deliver me from the wicked doers
verses.part2: and save me from the blood-thirsty men.

verses.part1: For lo, they lie waiting for my soul
verses.part2: the mighty men are gathered against me, without any offence or fault of me, O Lord.

verses.part1: They run and prepare themselves without my fault
verses.part2: arise thou therefore to help me, and behold.

verses.part1: Stand up, O Lord God of hosts, thou God of Israel, to visit all the heathen
verses.part2: and be not merciful unto them that offend of malicious wickedness.

verses.part1: They go to and fro in the evening
verses.part2: they grin like a dog, and run about through the city.

verses.part1: Behold, they speak with their mouth, and swords are in their lips
verses.part2: for who doth hear?

verses.part1: But thou, O Lord, shalt have them in derision
verses.part2: and thou shalt laugh all the heathen to scorn.

verses.part1: My strength will I ascribe unto thee
verses.part2: for thou art the God of my refuge.

verses.part1: God sheweth me his goodness plenteously
verses.part2: and God shall let me see my desire upon mine enemies.

verses.part1: Slay them not, lest my people forget it
verses.part2: but scatter them abroad among the people, and put them down, O Lord, our defence.

verses.part1: For the sin of their mouth, and for the words of their lips, they shall be taken in their pride
verses.part2: and why? their preaching is of cursing and lies.

verses.part1: Consume them in thy wrath, consume them, that they may perish
verses.part2: and know that it is God that ruleth in Jacob, and unto the ends of the world.

verses.part1: And in the evening they will return
verses.part2: grin like a dog, and will go about the city.

verses.part1: They will run here and there for meat
verses.part2: and grudge if they be not satisfied.

verses.part1: As for me, I will sing of thy power, and will praise thy mercy betimes in the morning
verses.part2: for thou hast been my defence and refuge in the day of my trouble.

verses.part1: Unto thee, O my strength, will I sing
verses.part2: for thou, O God, art my refuge, and my merciful God.

verses.part1: O GOD, thou hast cast us out, and scattered us abroad
verses.part2: thou hast also been displeased; O turn thee unto us again.

verses.part1: Thou hast moved the land, and divided it
verses.part2: heal the sores thereof, for it shaketh.

verses.part1: Thou hast shewed thy people heavy things
verses.part2: thou hast given us a drink of deadly wine.

verses.part1: Thou hast given a token for such as fear thee
verses.part2: that they may triumph because of the truth.

verses.part1: Therefore were thy beloved delivered
verses.part2: help me with thy right hand, and hear me.

verses.part1: God hath spoken in his holiness, I will rejoice, and divide Sichem
verses.part2: and mete out the valley of Succoth.

verses.part1: Gilead is mine, and Manasses is mine
verses.part2: Ephraim also is the strength of my head; Judah is my law-giver;

verses.part1: Moab is my wash-pot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe
verses.part2: Philistia, be thou glad of me.

verses.part1: Who will lead me into the strong city
verses.part2: who will bring me into Edom?

verses.part1: Hast not thou cast us out, O God
verses.part2: wilt not thou, O God, go out with our hosts?

verses.part1: O be thou our help in trouble
verses.part2: for vain is the help of man.

verses.part1: Through God will we do great acts
verses.part2: for it is he that shall tread down our enemies.

verses.part1: HEAR my crying, O God
verses.part2: give ear unto my prayer.

verses.part1: From the ends of the earth will I call upon thee
verses.part2: when my heart is in heaviness.

verses.part1: O set me up upon the rock that is higher than I
verses.part2: for thou hast been my hope, and a strong tower for me against the enemy.

verses.part1: I will dwell in thy tabernacle for ever
verses.part2: and my trust shall be under the covering of thy wings.

verses.part1: For thou, O Lord, hast heard my desires
verses.part2: and hast given an heritage unto those that fear thy Name.

verses.part1: Thou shalt grant the King a long life
verses.part2: that his years may endure throughout all generations.

verses.part1: He shall dwell before God for ever
verses.part2: O prepare thy loving mercy and faithfulness, that they may preserve him.

verses.part1: So will I always sing praise unto thy Name
verses.part2: that I may daily perform my vows.

verses.part1: MY soul truly waiteth still upon God
verses.part2: for of him cometh my salvation.

verses.part1: He verily is my strength and my salvation
verses.part2: he is my defence, so that I shall not greatly fall.

verses.part1: How long will ye imagine mischief against every man
verses.part2: ye shall be slain all the sort of you; yea, as a tottering wall shall ye be, and like a broken hedge.

verses.part1: Their device is only how to put him out whom God will exalt
verses.part2: their delight is in lies; they give good words with their mouth, but curse with their heart.

verses.part1: Nevertheless, my soul, wait thou still upon God
verses.part2: for my hope is in him.

verses.part1: He truly is my strength and my salvation
verses.part2: he is my defence, so that I shall not fall.

verses.part1: In God is my health, and my glory
verses.part2: the rock of my might, and in God is my trust.

verses.part1: O put your trust in him alway, ye people
verses.part2: pour out your hearts before him, for God is our hope.

verses.part1: As for the children of men, they are but vanity
verses.part2: the children of men are deceitful upon the weights, they are altogether lighter than vanity itself.

verses.part1: O trust not in wrong and robbery, give not yourselves unto vanity
verses.part2: if riches increase, set not your heart upon them.

verses.part1: God spake once, and twice I have also heard the same
verses.part2: that power belongeth unto God;

verses.part1: And that thou, Lord, art merciful
verses.part2: for thou rewardest every man according to his work.

verses.part1: O GOD, thou art my God
verses.part2: early will I seek thee.

verses.part1: My soul thirsteth for thee, my flesh also longeth after thee
verses.part2: in a barren and dry land where no water is.

verses.part1: Thus have I looked for thee in holiness
verses.part2: that I might behold thy power and glory.

verses.part1: For thy loving-kindness is better than the life itself
verses.part2: my lips shall praise thee.

verses.part1: As long as I live will I magnify thee on this manner
verses.part2: and lift up my hands in thy Name.

verses.part1: My soul shall be satisfied, even as it were with marrow and fatness
verses.part2: when my mouth praiseth thee with joyful lips.

verses.part1: Have I not remembered thee in my bed
verses.part2: and thought upon thee when I was waking?

verses.part1: Because thou hast been my helper
verses.part2: therefore under the shadow of thy wings will I rejoice.

verses.part1: My soul hangeth upon thee
verses.part2: thy right hand hath upholden me.

verses.part1: These also that seek the hurt of my soul
verses.part2: they shall go under the earth.

verses.part1: Let them fall upon the edge of the sword
verses.part2: that they may be a portion for foxes.

verses.part1: But the King shall rejoice in God; all they also that swear by him shall be commended
verses.part2: for the mouth of them that speak lies shall be stopped.

verses.part1: HEAR my voice, O God, in my prayer
verses.part2: preserve my life from fear of the enemy.

verses.part1: Hide me from the gathering together of the froward
verses.part2: and from the insurrection of wicked doers;

verses.part1: Who have whet their tongue like a sword
verses.part2: and shoot out their arrows, even bitter words;

verses.part1: That they may privily shoot at him that is perfect
verses.part2: suddenly do they hit him, and fear not.

verses.part1: They encourage themselves in mischief
verses.part2: and commune among themselves how they may lay snares, and say that no man shall see them.

verses.part1: They imagine wickedness, and practise it
verses.part2: that they keep secret among themselves, every man in the deep of his heart.

verses.part1: But God shall suddenly shoot at them with a swift arrow
verses.part2: that they shall be wounded.

verses.part1: Yea, their own tongues shall make them fall
verses.part2: insomuch that whoso seeth them shall laugh them to scorn.

verses.part1: And all men that see it shall say, This hath God done
verses.part2: for they shall perceive that it is his work.

verses.part1: The righteous shall rejoice in the Lord, and put his trust in him
verses.part2: and all they that are true of heart shall be glad.

verses.part1: THOU, O God, art praised in Sion
verses.part2: and unto thee shall the vow be performed in Jerusalem.

verses.part1: Thou that hearest the prayer
verses.part2: unto thee shall all flesh come.

verses.part1: My misdeeds prevail against me
verses.part2: O be thou merciful unto our sins.

verses.part1: Blessed is the man whom thou choosest, and receivest unto thee
verses.part2: he shall dwell in thy court, and shall be satisfied with the pleasures of thy house, even of thy holy temple.

verses.part1: Thou shalt shew us wonderful things in thy righteousness, O God of our salvation
verses.part2: thou that art the hope of all the ends of the earth, and of them that remain in the broad sea.

verses.part1: Who in his strength setteth fast the mountains
verses.part2: and is girded about with power.

verses.part1: Who stilleth the raging of the sea
verses.part2: and the noise of his waves, and the madness of the people.

verses.part1: They also that dwell in the uttermost parts of the earth shall be afraid at thy tokens
verses.part2: thou that makest the outgoings of the morning and evening to praise thee.

verses.part1: Thou visitest the earth, and blessest it
verses.part2: thou makest it very plenteous.

verses.part1: The river of God is full of water
verses.part2: thou preparest their corn, for so thou providest for the earth.

verses.part1: Thou waterest her furrows, thou sendest rain into the little valleys thereof
verses.part2: thou makest it soft with the drops of rain, and blessest the increase of it.

verses.part1: Thou crownest the year with thy goodness
verses.part2: and thy clouds drop fatness.

verses.part1: They shall drop upon the dwellings of the wilderness
verses.part2: and the little hills shall rejoice on every side.

verses.part1: The folds shall be full of sheep
verses.part2: the valleys also shall stand so thick with corn, that they shall laugh and sing.

verses.part1: O BE joyful in God, all ye lands
verses.part2: sing praises unto the honour of his Name, make his praise to be glorious.

verses.part1: Say unto God, O how wonderful art thou in thy works
verses.part2: through the greatness of thy power shall thine enemies be found liars unto thee.

verses.part1: For all the world shall worship thee
verses.part2: sing of thee, and praise thy Name.

verses.part1: O come hither, and behold the works of God
verses.part2: how wonderful he is in his doing toward the children of men.

verses.part1: He turned the sea into dry land
verses.part2: so that they went through the water on foot; there did we rejoice thereof.

verses.part1: He ruleth with his power for ever; his eyes behold the people
verses.part2: and such as will not believe shall not be able to exalt themselves.

verses.part1: O praise our God, ye people
verses.part2: and make the voice of his praise to be heard;

verses.part1: Who holdeth our soul in life
verses.part2: and suffereth not our feet to slip.

verses.part1: For thou, O God, hast proved us
verses.part2: thou also hast tried us, like as silver is tried.

verses.part1: Thou broughtest us into the snare
verses.part2: and laidest trouble upon our loins.

verses.part1: Thou sufferedst men to ride over our heads
verses.part2: we went through fire and water, and thou broughtest us out into a wealthy place.

verses.part1: I will go into thine house with burnt-offerings
verses.part2: and will pay thee my vows, which I promised with my lips, and spake with my mouth, when I was in trouble.

verses.part1: I will offer unto thee fat burnt-sacrifices, with the incense of rams
verses.part2: I will offer bullocks and goats.

verses.part1: O come hither, and hearken, all ye that fear God
verses.part2: and I will tell you what he hath done for my soul.

verses.part1: I called unto him with my mouth
verses.part2: and gave him praises with my tongue.

verses.part1: If I incline unto wickedness with mine heart
verses.part2: the Lord will not hear me.

verses.part1: But God hath heard me
verses.part2: and considered the voice of my prayer.

verses.part1: Praised be God, who hath not cast out my prayer
verses.part2: nor turned his mercy from me.

verses.part1: GOD be merciful unto us, and bless us
verses.part2: and shew us the light of his countenance, and be merciful unto us :

verses.part1: That thy way may be known upon earth
verses.part2: thy saving health among all nations.

verses.part1: Let the people praise thee, O God
verses.part2: yea, let all the people praise thee.

verses.part1: O let the nations rejoice and be glad
verses.part2: for thou shalt judge the folk righteously, and govern the nations upon earth.

verses.part1: Let the people praise thee, O God
verses.part2: let all the people praise thee.

verses.part1: Then shall the earth bring forth her increase
verses.part2: and God, even our own God, shall give us his blessing.

verses.part1: God shall bless us
verses.part2: and all the ends of the world shall fear him.

verses.part1: LET God arise, and let his enemies be scattered
verses.part2: let them also that hate him flee before him.

verses.part1: Like as the smoke vanisheth, so shalt thou drive them away
verses.part2: and like as wax melteth at the fire, so let the ungodly perish at the presence of God.

verses.part1: But let the righteous be glad and rejoice before God
verses.part2: let them also be merry and joyful.

verses.part1: O sing unto God, and sing praises unto his Name
verses.part2: magnify him that rideth upon the heavens, as it were upon an horse; praise him in his Name jah, and rejoice before him.

verses.part1: He is a father of the fatherless, and defendeth the cause of the widows
verses.part2: even God in his holy habitation.

verses.part1: He is the God that maketh men to be of one mind in an house, and bringeth the prisoners out of captivity
verses.part2: but letteth the runagates continue in scarceness.

verses.part1: O God, when thou wentest forth before the people
verses.part2: when thou wentest through the wilderness;

verses.part1: The earth shook, and the heavens dropped at the presence of God
verses.part2: even as Sinai also was moved at the presence of God, who is the God of Israel.

verses.part1: Thou, O God, sentest a gracious rain upon thine inheritance
verses.part2: and refreshedst it when it was weary.

verses.part1: Thy congregation shall dwell therein
verses.part2: for thou, O God, hast of thy goodness prepared for the poor.

verses.part1: The Lord gave the word
verses.part2: great was the company of the preachers.

verses.part1: Kings with their armies did flee, and were discomfited
verses.part2: and they of the household divided the spoil.

verses.part1: Though ye have lien among the pots, yet shall ye be as the wings of a dove
verses.part2: that is covered with silver wings, and her feathers like gold.

verses.part1: When the Almighty scattered kings for their sake
verses.part2: then were they as white as snow in Salmon.

verses.part1: As the hill of Basan, so is God's hill
verses.part2: even an high hill, as the hill of Basan.

verses.part1: Why hop ye so, ye high hills? this is God's hill, in the which it pleaseth him to dwell
verses.part2: yea, the Lord will abide in it for ever.

verses.part1: The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands of angels
verses.part2: and the Lord is among them, as in the holy place of Sinai.

verses.part1: Thou art gone up on high, thou hast led captivity captive, and received gifts for men
verses.part2: yea, even for thine enemies, that the Lord God might dwell among them.

verses.part1: Praised be the Lord daily
verses.part2: even the God who helpeth us, and poureth his benefits upon us.

verses.part1: He is our God, even the God of whom cometh salvation
verses.part2: God is the Lord, by whom we escape death.

verses.part1: God shall wound the head of his enemies
verses.part2: and the hairy scalp of such a one as goeth on still in his wickedness.

verses.part1: The Lord hath said, I will bring my people again, as I did from Basan
verses.part2: mine own will I bring again, as I did sometime from the deep of the sea.

verses.part1: That thy foot may be dipped in the blood of thine enemies
verses.part2: and that the tongue of thy dogs may be red through the same.

verses.part1: It is well seen, O God, how thou goest
verses.part2: how thou, my God and King, goest in the sanctuary.

verses.part1: The singers go before, the minstrels follow after
verses.part2: in the midst are the damsels playing with the timbrels.

verses.part1: Give thanks, O Israel, unto God the Lord in the congregations
verses.part2: from the ground of the heart.

verses.part1: There is little Benjamin their ruler, and the princes of Judah their counsel
verses.part2: the princes of Zabulon, and the princes of Nephthali.

verses.part1: Thy God hath sent forth strength for thee
verses.part2: stablish the thing, O God, that thou hast wrought in us,

verses.part1: For thy temple's sake at Jerusalem
verses.part2: so shall kings bring presents unto thee.

verses.part1: When the company of the spear-men, and multitude of the mighty are scattered abroad among the beasts of the people, so that they humbly bring pieces of silver
verses.part2: and when he hath scattered the people that delight in war;

verses.part1: Then shall the princes come out of Egypt
verses.part2: the Morians' land shall soon stretch out her hands unto God.

verses.part1: Sing unto God, O ye kingdoms of the earth
verses.part2: O sing praises unto the Lord;

verses.part1: Who sitteth in the heavens over all from the beginning
verses.part2: lo, he doth send out his voice, yea, and that a mighty voice.

verses.part1: Ascribe ye the power to God over Israel
verses.part2: his worship and strength is in the clouds.

verses.part1: O God, wonderful art thou in thy holy places
verses.part2: even the God of Israel, he will give strength and power unto his people; blessed be God.

verses.part1: SAVE me, O God
verses.part2: for the waters are come in, even unto my soul.

verses.part1: I stick fast in the deep mire, where no ground is
verses.part2: I am come into deep waters, so that the floods run over me.

verses.part1: I am weary of crying; my throat is dry
verses.part2: my sight faileth me for waiting so long upon my God.

verses.part1: They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head
verses.part2: they that are mine enemies, and would destroy me guiltless, are mighty.

verses.part1: I paid them the things that I never took
verses.part2: God, thou knowest my simpleness, and my faults are not hid from thee.

verses.part1: Let not them that trust in thee, O Lord God of hosts, be ashamed for my cause
verses.part2: let not those that seek thee be confounded through me, O Lord God of Israel.

verses.part1: And why? for thy sake have I suffered reproof
verses.part2: shame hath covered my face.

verses.part1: I am become a stranger unto my brethren
verses.part2: even an alien unto my mother's children.

verses.part1: For the zeal of thine house hath even eaten me
verses.part2: and the rebukes of them that rebuked thee are fallen upon me.

verses.part1: I wept, and chastened myself with fasting
verses.part2: and that was turned to my reproof.

verses.part1: I put on sackcloth also
verses.part2: and they jested upon me.

verses.part1: They that sit in the gate speak against me
verses.part2: and the drunkards make songs upon me.

verses.part1: But, Lord, I make my prayer unto thee
verses.part2: in an acceptable time.

verses.part1: Hear me, O God, in the multitude of thy mercy
verses.part2: even in the truth of thy salvation.

verses.part1: Take me out of the mire, that I sink not
verses.part2: O let me be delivered from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters.

verses.part1: Let not the water-flood drown me, neither let the deep swallow me up
verses.part2: and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.

verses.part1: Hear me, O Lord, for thy loving-kindness is comfortable
verses.part2: turn thee unto me according to the multitude of thy mercies.

verses.part1: And hide not thy face from thy servant, for I am in trouble
verses.part2: O haste thee, and hear me.

verses.part1: Draw nigh unto my soul, and save it
verses.part2: O deliver me, because of mine enemies.

verses.part1: Thou hast known my reproof, my shame, and my dishonour
verses.part2: mine adversaries are all in thy sight.

verses.part1: Thy rebuke hath broken my heart; I am full of heaviness
verses.part2: I looked for some to have pity on me, but there was no man, neither found I any to comfort me.

verses.part1: They gave me gall to eat
verses.part2: and when I was thirsty they gave me vinegar to drink.

verses.part1: Let their table be made a snare to take themselves withal
verses.part2: and let the things that should have been for their wealth be unto them an occasion of falling.

verses.part1: Let their eyes be blinded, that they see not
verses.part2: and ever bow thou down their backs.

verses.part1: Pour out thine indignation upon them
verses.part2: and let thy wrathful displeasure take hold of them.

verses.part1: Let their habitation be void
verses.part2: and no man to dwell in their tents.

verses.part1: For they persecute him whom thou hast smitten
verses.part2: and they talk how they may vex them whom thou hast wounded.

verses.part1: Let them fall from one wickedness to an-other
verses.part2: and not come into thy righteousness.

verses.part1: Let them be wiped out of the book of the living
verses.part2: and not be written among the righteous.

verses.part1: As for me, when I am poor and in heaviness
verses.part2: thy help, O God, shall lift me up.

verses.part1: I will praise the Name of God with a song
verses.part2: and magnify it with thanksgiving.

verses.part1: This also shall please the Lord
verses.part2: better than a bullock that hath horns and hoofs.

verses.part1: The humble shall consider this, and be glad
verses.part2: seek ye after God, and your soul shall live.

verses.part1: For the Lord heareth the poor
verses.part2: and despiseth not his prisoners.

verses.part1: Let heaven and earth praise him
verses.part2: the sea, and all that moveth therein.

verses.part1: For God will save Sion, and build the cities of Judah
verses.part2: that men may dwell there, and have it in possession.

verses.part1: The posterity also of his servants shall inherit it
verses.part2: and they that love his Name shall dwell therein.

verses.part1: HASTE thee, O God, to deliver me
verses.part2: make haste to help me, O Lord.

verses.part1: Let them be ashamed and confounded that seek after my soul
verses.part2: let them be turned backward and put to confusion that wish me evil.

verses.part1: Let them for their reward be soon brought to shame
verses.part2: that cry over me, There, there.

verses.part1: But let all those that seek thee be joyful and glad in thee
verses.part2: and let all such as delight in thy salvation say alway, The Lord be praised.

verses.part1: As for me, I am poor and in misery
verses.part2: haste thee unto me, O God.

verses.part1: Thou art my helper and my redeemer
verses.part2: O Lord, make no long tarrying.

verses.part1: IN thee, O Lord, have I put my trust, let me never be put to confusion
verses.part2: but rid me and deliver me in thy righteousness, incline thine ear unto me, and save me.

verses.part1: Be thou my strong hold, whereunto I may alway resort
verses.part2: thou hast promised to help me, for thou art my house of defence and my castle.

verses.part1: Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the ungodly
verses.part2: out of the hand of the unrighteous and cruel man.

verses.part1: For thou, O Lord God, art the thing that I long for
verses.part2: thou art my hope, even from my youth.

verses.part1: Through thee have I been holden up ever since I was born
verses.part2: thou art he that took me out of my mother's womb; my praise shall be always of thee.

verses.part1: I am become as it were a monster unto many
verses.part2: but my sure trust is in thee.

verses.part1: O let my mouth be filled with thy praise
verses.part2: that I may sing of thy glory and honour all the day long.

verses.part1: Cast me not away in the time of age
verses.part2: forsake me not when my strength faileth me.

verses.part1: For mine enemies speak against me, and they that lay wait for my soul take their counsel together, saying
verses.part2: God hath forsaken him; persecute him, and take him, for there is none to deliver him.

verses.part1: Go not far from me, O God
verses.part2: my God, haste thee to help me.

verses.part1: Let them be confounded and perish that are against my soul
verses.part2: let them be covered with shame and dishonour that seek to do me evil.

verses.part1: As for me, I will patiently abide alway
verses.part2: and will praise thee more and more.

verses.part1: My mouth shall daily speak of thy righteousness and salvation
verses.part2: for I know no end thereof.

verses.part1: I will go forth in the strength of the Lord God
verses.part2: and will make mention of thy righteousness only.

verses.part1: Thou, O God, hast taught me from my youth up until now
verses.part2: therefore will I tell of thy wondrous works.

verses.part1: Forsake me not, O God, in mine old age, when I am gray-headed
verses.part2: until I have shewed thy strength unto this generation, and thy power to all them that are yet for to come.

verses.part1: Thy righteousness, O God, is very high
verses.part2: and great things are they that thou hast done; O God, who is like unto thee?

verses.part1: O what great troubles and adversities hast thou shewed me, and yet didst thou turn and refresh me
verses.part2: yea, and broughtest me from the deep of the earth again.

verses.part1: Thou hast brought me to great honour
verses.part2: and comforted me on every side.

verses.part1: Therefore will I praise thee and thy faithfulness, O God, playing upon an instrument of musick
verses.part2: unto thee will I sing upon the harp, O thou Holy One of Israel.

verses.part1: My lips will be fain when I sing unto thee
verses.part2: and so will my soul whom thou hast delivered.

verses.part1: My tongue also shall talk of thy righteousness all the day long
verses.part2: for they are confounded and brought unto shame that seek to do me evil.

verses.part1: GIVE the King thy judgements, O God
verses.part2: and thy righteousness unto the King's son.

verses.part1: Then shall he judge thy people according unto right
verses.part2: and defend the poor.

verses.part1: The mountains also shall bring peace
verses.part2: and the little hills righteousness unto the people.

verses.part1: He shall keep the simple folk by their right
verses.part2: defend the children of the poor, and punish the wrong-doer.

verses.part1: They shall fear thee, as long as the sun and moon endureth
verses.part2: from one generation to another.

verses.part1: He shall come down like the rain into a fleece of wool
verses.part2: even as the drops that water the earth.

verses.part1: In his time shall the righteous flourish
verses.part2: yea, and abundance of peace, so long as the moon endureth.

verses.part1: His dominion shall be also from the one sea to the other
verses.part2: and from the flood unto the world's end.

verses.part1: They that dwell in the wilderness shall kneel before him
verses.part2: his enemies shall lick the dust.

verses.part1: The kings of Tharsis and of the isles shall give presents
verses.part2: the kings of Arabia and Saba shall bring gifts.

verses.part1: All kings shall fall down before him
verses.part2: all nations shall do him service.

verses.part1: For he shall deliver the poor when he crieth
verses.part2: the needy also, and him that hath no helper.

verses.part1: He shall be favourable to the simple and needy
verses.part2: and shall preserve the souls of the poor.

verses.part1: He shall deliver their souls from falsehood and wrong
verses.part2: and dear shall their blood be in his sight.

verses.part1: He shall live, and unto him shall be given of the gold of Arabia
verses.part2: prayer shall be made ever unto him, and daily shall he be praised.

verses.part1: There shall be an heap of corn in the earth, high upon the hills
verses.part2: his fruit shall shake like Libanus, and shall be green in the city like grass upon the earth.

verses.part1: His Name shall endure for ever; his Name shall remain under the sun among the posterities
verses.part2: which shall be blessed through him; and all the heathen shall praise him.

verses.part1: Blessed be the Lord God, even the God of Israel
verses.part2: which only doeth wondrous things;

verses.part1: And blessed be the Name of his majesty for ever
verses.part2: and all the earth shall be filled with his majesty. Amen, Amen.

verses.part1: TRULY God is loving unto Israel
verses.part2: even unto such as are of a clean heart.

verses.part1: Nevertheless, my feet were almost gone
verses.part2: my treadings had well-nigh slipt.

verses.part1: And why? I was grieved at the wicked
verses.part2: I do also see the ungodly in such prosperity.

verses.part1: For they are in no peril of death
verses.part2: but are lusty and strong.

verses.part1: They come in no misfortune like other folk
verses.part2: neither are they plagued like other men.

verses.part1: And this is the cause that they are so holden with pride
verses.part2: and overwhelmed with cruelty.

verses.part1: Their eyes swell with fatness
verses.part2: and they do even what they lust.

verses.part1: They corrupt other, and speak of wicked blasphemy
verses.part2: their talking is against the most High.

verses.part1: For they stretch forth their mouth unto the heaven
verses.part2: and their tongue goeth through the world.

verses.part1: Therefore fall the people unto them
verses.part2: and thereout suck they no small advantage.

verses.part1: Tush, say they, how should God perceive it
verses.part2: is there knowledge in the most High?

verses.part1: Lo, these are the ungodly, these prosper in the world, and these have riches in possession
verses.part2: and I said, Then have I cleansed my heart in vain, and washed mine hands in innocency.

verses.part1: All the day long have I been punished
verses.part2: and chastened every morning.

verses.part1: Yea, and I had almost said even as they
verses.part2: but lo, then I should have condemned the generation of thy children.

verses.part1: Then thought I to understand this
verses.part2: but it was too hard for me,

verses.part1: Until I went into the sanctuary of God
verses.part2: then understood I the end of these men;

verses.part1: Namely, how thou dost set them in slippery places
verses.part2: and castest them down, and destroyest them.

verses.part1: O how suddenly do they consume
verses.part2: perish, and come to a fearful end!

verses.part1: Yea, even like as a dream when one awaketh
verses.part2: so shalt thou make their image to vanish out of the city.

verses.part1: Thus my heart was grieved
verses.part2: and it went even through my reins.

verses.part1: So foolish was I, and ignorant
verses.part2: even as it were a beast before thee.

verses.part1: Nevertheless, I am alway by thee
verses.part2: for thou hast holden me by my right hand.

verses.part1: Thou shalt guide me with thy counsel
verses.part2: and after that receive me with glory.

verses.part1: Whom have I in heaven but thee
verses.part2: and there is none upon earth that I desire in comparison of thee.

verses.part1: My flesh and my heart faileth
verses.part2: but God is the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.

verses.part1: For lo, they that forsake thee shall perish
verses.part2: thou hast destroyed all them that commit fornication against thee.

verses.part1: But it is good for me to hold me fast by God, to put my trust in the Lord God
verses.part2: and to speak of all thy works in the gates of the daughter of Sion.

verses.part1: O GOD, wherefore art thou absent from us so long
verses.part2: why is thy wrath so hot against the sheep of thy pasture?

verses.part1: O think upon thy congregation
verses.part2: whom thou hast purchased and redeemed of old.

verses.part1: Think upon the tribe of thine inheritance
verses.part2: and mount Sion, wherein thou hast dwelt.

verses.part1: Lift up thy feet, that thou mayest utterly destroy every enemy
verses.part2: which hath done evil in thy sanctuary.

verses.part1: Thine adversaries roar in the midst of thy congregations
verses.part2: and set up their banners for tokens.

verses.part1: He that hewed timber afore out of the thick trees
verses.part2: was known to bring it to an excellent work.

verses.part1: But now they break down all the carved work thereof
verses.part2: with axes and hammers.

verses.part1: They have set fire upon thy holy places
verses.part2: and have defiled the dwelling-place of thy Name, even unto the ground.

verses.part1: Yea, they said in their hearts, Let us make havock of them altogether
verses.part2: thus have they burnt up all the houses of God in the land.

verses.part1: We see not our tokens, there is not one prophet more
verses.part2: no, not one is there among us, that understandeth any more.

verses.part1: O God, how long shall the adversary do this dishonour
verses.part2: how long shall the enemy blaspheme thy Name, for ever?

verses.part1: Why withdrawest thou thy hand
verses.part2: why pluckest thou not thy right hand out of thy bosom to consume the enemy?

verses.part1: For God is my King of old
verses.part2: the help that is done upon earth he doeth it himself.

verses.part1: Thou didst divide the sea through thy power
verses.part2: thou brakest the heads of the dragons in the waters.

verses.part1: Thou smotest the heads of Leviathan in pieces
verses.part2: and gavest him to be meat for the people in the wilderness.

verses.part1: Thou broughtest out fountains and waters out of the hard rocks
verses.part2: thou driedst up mighty waters.

verses.part1: The day is thine, and the night is thine
verses.part2: thou hast prepared the light and the sun.

verses.part1: Thou hast set all the borders of the earth
verses.part2: thou hast made summer and winter.

verses.part1: Remember this, O Lord, how the enemy hath rebuked
verses.part2: and how the foolish people hath blasphemed thy Name.

verses.part1: O deliver not the soul of thy turtle-dove unto the multitude of the enemies
verses.part2: and forget not the congregation of the poor for ever.

verses.part1: Look upon the covenant
verses.part2: for all the earth is full of darkness and cruel habitations.

verses.part1: O let not the simple go away ashamed
verses.part2: but let the poor and needy give praise unto thy Name.

verses.part1: Arise, O God, maintain thine own cause
verses.part2: remember how the foolish man blasphemeth thee daily.

verses.part1: Forget not the voice of thine enemies
verses.part2: the presumption of them that hate thee increaseth ever more and more.

verses.part1: UNTO thee, O God, do we give thanks
verses.part2: yea, unto thee do we give thanks.

verses.part1: Thy Name also is so nigh
verses.part2: and that do thy wondrous works declare.

verses.part1: When I receive the congregation
verses.part2: I shall judge according unto right.

verses.part1: The earth is weak, and all the inhabiters thereof
verses.part2: I bear up the pillars of it.

verses.part1: I said unto the fools, Deal not so madly
verses.part2: and to the ungodly, Set not up your horn.

verses.part1: Set not up your horn on high
verses.part2: and speak not with a stiff neck.

verses.part1: For promotion cometh neither from the east, nor from the west
verses.part2: nor yet from the south.

verses.part1: And why? God is the Judge
verses.part2: he putteth down one, and setteth up another.

verses.part1: For in the hand of the Lord there is a cup, and the wine is red
verses.part2: it is full mixed, and he poureth out of the same.

verses.part1: As for the dregs thereof
verses.part2: all the ungodly of the earth shall drink them, and suck them out.

verses.part1: But I will talk of the God of Jacob
verses.part2: and praise him for ever.

verses.part1: All the horns of the ungodly also will I break
verses.part2: and the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.

verses.part1: IN Jewry is God known
verses.part2: his Name is great in Israel.

verses.part1: At Salem is his tabernacle
verses.part2: and his dwelling in Sion.

verses.part1: There brake he the arrows of the bow
verses.part2: the shield, the sword, and the battle.

verses.part1: Thou art of more honour and might
verses.part2: than the hills of the robbers.

verses.part1: The proud are robbed, they have slept their sleep
verses.part2: and all the men whose hands were mighty have found nothing.

verses.part1: At thy rebuke, O God of Jacob
verses.part2: both the chariot and horse are fallen.

verses.part1: Thou, even thou art to be feared
verses.part2: and who may stand in thy sight when thou art angry?

verses.part1: Thou didst cause thy judgement to be heard from heaven
verses.part2: the earth trembled, and was still;

verses.part1: When God arose to judgement
verses.part2: and to help all the meek upon earth.

verses.part1: The fierceness of man shall turn to thy praise
verses.part2: and the fierceness of them shalt thou refrain.

verses.part1: Promise unto the Lord your God, and keep it, all ye that are round about him
verses.part2: bring presents unto him that ought to be feared.

verses.part1: He shall refrain the spirit of princes
verses.part2: and is wonderful among the kings of the earth.

verses.part1: I WILL cry unto God with my voice
verses.part2: even unto God will I cry with my voice, and he shall hearken unto me.

verses.part1: In the time of my trouble I sought the Lord
verses.part2: my sore ran and ceased not in the night-season; my soul refused comfort.

verses.part1: When I am in heaviness, I will think upon God
verses.part2: when my heart is vexed, I will complain.

verses.part1: Thou holdest mine eyes waking
verses.part2: I am so feeble, that I cannot speak.

verses.part1: I have considered the days of old
verses.part2: and the years that are past.

verses.part1: I call to remembrance my song
verses.part2: and in the night I commune with mine own heart, and search out my spirits.

verses.part1: Will the Lord absent himself for ever
verses.part2: and will he be no more intreated?

verses.part1: Is his mercy clean gone for ever
verses.part2: and is his promise come utterly to an end for evermore?

verses.part1: Hath God forgotten to be gracious
verses.part2: and will he shut up his loving-kindness in displeasure?

verses.part1: And I said, It is mine own infirmity
verses.part2: but I will remember the years of the right hand of the most Highest.

verses.part1: I will remember the works of the Lord
verses.part2: and call to mind thy wonders of old time.

verses.part1: I will think also of all thy works
verses.part2: and my talking shall be of thy doings.

verses.part1: Thy way, O God, is holy
verses.part2: who is so great a God as our God?

verses.part1: Thou art the God that doeth wonders
verses.part2: and hast declared thy power among the people.

verses.part1: Thou hast mightily delivered thy people
verses.part2: even the sons of Jacob and Joseph.

verses.part1: The waters saw thee, O God, the waters saw thee, and were afraid
verses.part2: the depths also were troubled.

verses.part1: The clouds poured out water, the air thundered
verses.part2: and thine arrows went abroad.

verses.part1: The voice of thy thunder was heard round about
verses.part2: the lightnings shone upon the ground; the earth was moved, and shook withal.

verses.part1: Thy way is in the sea, and thy paths in the great waters
verses.part2: and thy footsteps are not known.

verses.part1: Thou leddest thy people like sheep
verses.part2: by the hand of Moses and Aaron.

verses.part1: HEAR my law, O my people
verses.part2: incline your ears unto the words of my mouth.

verses.part1: I will open my mouth in a parable
verses.part2: I will declare hard sentences of old;

verses.part1: Which we have heard and known
verses.part2: and such as our fathers have told us;

verses.part1: That we should not hide them from the children of the generations to come
verses.part2: but to shew the honour of the Lord, his mighty and wonderful works that he hath done.

verses.part1: He made a covenant with Jacob, and gave Israel a law
verses.part2: which he commanded our forefathers to teach their children;

verses.part1: That their posterity might know it
verses.part2: and the children which were yet unborn;

verses.part1: To the intent that when they came up
verses.part2: they might shew their children the same;

verses.part1: That they might put their trust in God
verses.part2: and not to forget the works of God, but to keep his commandments;

verses.part1: And not to be as their forefathers, a faithless and stubborn generation
verses.part2: a generation that set not their heart aright, and whose spirit cleaveth not stedfastly unto God;

verses.part1: Like as the children of Ephraim
verses.part2: who being harnessed, and carrying bows, turned themselves back in the day of battle.

verses.part1: They kept not the covenant of God
verses.part2: and would not walk in his law;

verses.part1: But forgat what he had done
verses.part2: and the wonderful works that he had shewed for them.

verses.part1: Marvellous things did he in the sight of our forefathers, in the land of Egypt
verses.part2: even in the field of Zoan.

verses.part1: He divided the sea, and let them go through
verses.part2: he made the waters to stand on an heap.

verses.part1: In the day-time also he led them with a cloud
verses.part2: and all the night through with a light of fire.

verses.part1: He clave the hard rocks in the wilderness
verses.part2: and gave them drink thereof, as it had been out of the great depth.

verses.part1: He brought waters out of the stony rock
verses.part2: so that it gushed out like the rivers.

verses.part1: Yet for all this they sinned more against him
verses.part2: and provoked the most Highest in the wilderness.

verses.part1: They tempted God in their hearts
verses.part2: and required meat for their lust.

verses.part1: They spake against God also, saying
verses.part2: Shall God prepare a table in the wilderness?

verses.part1: He smote the stony rock indeed, that the waters gushed out, and the streams flowed withal
verses.part2: but can he give bread also, or provide flesh for his people?

verses.part1: When the Lord heard this, he was wroth
verses.part2: so the fire was kindled in Jacob, and there came up heavy displeasure against Israel;

verses.part1: Because they believed not in God
verses.part2: and put not their trust in his help.

verses.part1: So he commanded the clouds above
verses.part2: and opened the doors of heaven.

verses.part1: He rained down manna also upon them for to eat
verses.part2: and gave them food from heaven.

verses.part1: So man did eat angels' food
verses.part2: for he sent them meat enough.

verses.part1: He caused the east-wind to blow under heaven
verses.part2: and through his power he brought in the south-west-wind.

verses.part1: He rained flesh upon them as thick as dust
verses.part2: and feathered fowls like as the sand of the sea.

verses.part1: He let it fall among their tents
verses.part2: even round about their habitation.

verses.part1: So they did eat and were well filled, for he gave them their own desire
verses.part2: they were not disappointed of their lust.

verses.part1: But while the meat was yet in their mouths, the heavy wrath of God came upon them, and slew the wealthiest of them
verses.part2: yea, and smote down the chosen men that were in Israel.

verses.part1: But for all this they sinned yet more
verses.part2: and believed not his wondrous works.

verses.part1: Therefore their days did he consume in vanity
verses.part2: and their years in trouble.

verses.part1: When he slew them, they sought him
verses.part2: and turned them early, and inquired after God.

verses.part1: And they remembered that God was their strength
verses.part2: and that the high God was their redeemer.

verses.part1: Nevertheless, they did but flatter him with their mouth
verses.part2: and dissembled with him in their tongue.

verses.part1: For their heart was not whole with him
verses.part2: neither continued they stedfast in his covenant.

verses.part1: But he was so merciful, that he forgave their misdeeds
verses.part2: and destroyed them not.

verses.part1: Yea, many a time turned he his wrath away
verses.part2: and would not suffer his whole displeasure to arise.

verses.part1: For he considered that they were but flesh
verses.part2: and that they were even a wind that passeth away, and cometh not again.

verses.part1: Many a time did they provoke him in the wilderness
verses.part2: and grieved him in the desert.

verses.part1: They turned back, and tempted God
verses.part2: and moved the Holy One in Israel.

verses.part1: They thought not of his hand
verses.part2: and of the day when he delivered them from the hand of the enemy;

verses.part1: How he had wrought his miracles in Egypt
verses.part2: and his wonders in the field of Zoan.

verses.part1: He turned their waters into blood
verses.part2: so that they might not drink of the rivers.

verses.part1: He sent lice among them, and devoured them up
verses.part2: and frogs to destroy them.

verses.part1: He gave their fruit unto the caterpillar
verses.part2: and their labour unto the grasshopper.

verses.part1: He destroyed their vines with hail-stones
verses.part2: and their mulberry trees with the frost.

verses.part1: He smote their cattle also with hail-stones
verses.part2: and their flocks with hot thunderbolts.

verses.part1: He cast upon them the furiousness of his wrath, anger, displeasure, and trouble
verses.part2: and sent evil angels among them.

verses.part1: He made a way to his indignation, and spared not their soul from death
verses.part2: but gave their life over to the pestilence;

verses.part1: And smote all the first-born in Egypt
verses.part2: the most principal and mightiest in the dwellings of Ham.

verses.part1: But as for his own people, he led them forth like sheep
verses.part2: and carried them in the wilderness like a flock.

verses.part1: He brought them out safely, that they should not fear
verses.part2: and overwhelmed their enemies with the sea.

verses.part1: And brought them within the borders of his sanctuary
