verses.part2: even to his mountain which he purchased with his right hand.

verses.part1: He cast out the heathen also before them
verses.part2: caused their land to be divided among them for an heritage, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.

verses.part1: So they tempted and displeased the most high God
verses.part2: and kept not his testimonies;

verses.part1: But turned their backs, and fell away like their forefathers
verses.part2: starting aside like a broken bow.

verses.part1: For they grieved him with their hill-altars
verses.part2: and provoked him to displeasure with their images.

verses.part1: When God heard this, he was wroth
verses.part2: and took sore displeasure at Israel.

verses.part1: So that he forsook the tabernacle in Silo
verses.part2: even the tent that he had pitched among men.

verses.part1: He delivered their power into captivity
verses.part2: and their beauty into the enemy's hand.

verses.part1: He gave his people over also unto the sword
verses.part2: and was wroth with his inheritance.

verses.part1: The fire consumed their young men
verses.part2: and their maidens were not given to marriage.

verses.part1: Their priests were slain with the sword
verses.part2: and there were no widows to make lamentation.

verses.part1: So the Lord awaked as one out of sleep
verses.part2: and like a giant refreshed with wine.

verses.part1: He smote his enemies in the hinder parts
verses.part2: and put them to a perpetual shame.

verses.part1: He refused the tabernacle of Joseph
verses.part2: and chose not the tribe of Ephraim;

verses.part1: But chose the tribe of Judah
verses.part2: even the hill of Sion which he loved.

verses.part1: And there he built his temple on high
verses.part2: and laid the foundation of it like the ground which he hath made continually.

verses.part1: He chose David also his servant
verses.part2: and took him away from the sheep-folds.

verses.part1: As he was following the ewes great with young ones he took him
verses.part2: that he might feed Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.

verses.part1: So he fed them with a faithful and true heart
verses.part2: and ruled them prudently with all his power.

verses.part1: O GOD, the heathen are come into thine inheritance
verses.part2: thy holy temple have they defiled, and made Jerusalem an heap of stones.

verses.part1: The dead bodies of thy servants have they given to be meat unto the fowls of the air
verses.part2: and the flesh of thy saints unto the beasts of the land.

verses.part1: Their blood have they shed like water on every side of Jerusalem
verses.part2: and there was no man to bury them.

verses.part1: We are become an open shame to our enemies
verses.part2: a very scorn and derision unto them that are round about us.

verses.part1: Lord, how long wilt thou be angry
verses.part2: shall thy jealousy burn like fire for ever?

verses.part1: Pour out thine indignation upon the heathen that have not known thee
verses.part2: and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon thy Name.

verses.part1: For they have devoured Jacob
verses.part2: and laid waste his dwelling-place.

verses.part1: O remember not our old sins, but have mercy upon us, and that soon
verses.part2: for we are come to great misery.

verses.part1: Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of thy Name
verses.part2: O deliver us, and be merciful unto our sins, for thy Name's sake.

verses.part1: Wherefore do the heathen say
verses.part2: Where is now their God?

verses.part1: O let the vengeance of thy servants' blood that is shed
verses.part2: be openly shewed upon the heathen in our sight.

verses.part1: O let the sorrowful sighing of the prisoners come before thee
verses.part2: according to the greatness of thy power, preserve thou those that are appointed to die.

verses.part1: And for the blasphemy wherewith our neighbours have blasphemed thee
verses.part2: reward thou them, O Lord, seven-fold into their bosom.

verses.part1: So we, that are thy people, and sheep of thy pasture, shall give thee thanks for ever
verses.part2: and will alway be shewing forth thy praise from generation to generation.

verses.part1: HEAR, O thou Shepherd of Israel, thou that leadest Joseph like a sheep
verses.part2: shew thyself also, thou that sittest upon the cherubims.

verses.part1: Before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasses
verses.part2: stir up thy strength, and come, and help us.

verses.part1: Turn us again, O God
verses.part2: shew the light of thy countenance, and we shall be whole.

verses.part1: O Lord God of hosts
verses.part2: how long wilt thou be angry with thy people that prayeth?

verses.part1: Thou feedest them with the bread of tears
verses.part2: and givest them plenteousness of tears to drink.

verses.part1: Thou hast made us a very strife unto our neighbours
verses.part2: and our enemies laugh us to scorn.

verses.part1: Turn us again, thou God of hosts
verses.part2: shew the light of thy countenance, and we shall be whole.

verses.part1: Thou hast brought a vine out of Egypt
verses.part2: thou hast cast out the heathen, and planted it.

verses.part1: Thou madest room for it
verses.part2: and when it had taken root it filled the land.

verses.part1: The hills were covered with the shadow of it
verses.part2: and the boughs thereof were like the goodly cedar-trees.

verses.part1: She stretched out her branches unto the sea
verses.part2: and her boughs unto the river.

verses.part1: Why hast thou then broken down her hedge
verses.part2: that all they that go by pluck off her grapes?

verses.part1: The wild boar out of the wood doth root it up
verses.part2: and the wild beasts of the field devour it.

verses.part1: Turn thee again, thou God of hosts, look down from heaven
verses.part2: behold, and visit this vine;

verses.part1: And the place of the vineyard that thy right hand hath planted
verses.part2: and the branch that thou madest so strong for thyself.

verses.part1: It is burnt with fire, and cut down
verses.part2: and they shall perish at the rebuke of thy countenance.

verses.part1: Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand
verses.part2: and upon the son of man, whom thou madest so strong for thine own self.

verses.part1: And so will not we go back from thee
verses.part2: O let us live, and we shall call upon thy Name.

verses.part1: Turn us again, O Lord God of hosts
verses.part2: shew the light of thy countenance, and we shall be whole.

verses.part1: SING we merrily unto God our strength
verses.part2: make a cheerful noise unto the God of Jacob.

verses.part1: Take the psalm, bring hither the tabret
verses.part2: the merry harp with the lute.

verses.part1: Blow up the trumpet in the new-moon
verses.part2: even in the time appointed, and upon our solemn feast-day.

verses.part1: For this was made a statute for Israel
verses.part2: and a law of the God of Jacob.

verses.part1: This he ordained in Joseph for a testimony
verses.part2: when he came out of the land of Egypt, and had heard a strange language.

verses.part1: I eased his shoulder from the burden
verses.part2: and his hands were delivered from making the pots.

verses.part1: Thou calledst upon me in troubles, and I delivered thee
verses.part2: and heard thee what time as the storm fell upon thee.

verses.part1: I proved thee also
verses.part2: at the waters of strife.

verses.part1: Hear, O my people, and I will assure thee, O Israel
verses.part2: if thou wilt hearken unto me,

verses.part1: There shall no strange god be in thee
verses.part2: neither shalt thou worship any other god.

verses.part1: I am the Lord thy God, who brought thee out of the land of Egypt
verses.part2: open thy mouth wide, and I shall fill it.

verses.part1: But my people would not hear my voice
verses.part2: and Israel would not obey me.

verses.part1: So I gave them up unto their own hearts' lusts
verses.part2: and let them follow their own imaginations.

verses.part1: O that my people would have hearkened unto me
verses.part2: for if Israel had walked in my ways,

verses.part1: I should soon have put down their enemies
verses.part2: and turned my hand against their adversaries.

verses.part1: The haters of the Lord should have been found liars
verses.part2: but their time should have endured for ever.

verses.part1: He should have fed them also with the finest wheat-flour
verses.part2: and with honey out of the stony rock should I have satisfied thee.

verses.part1: GOD standeth in the congregation of princes
verses.part2: he is a Judge among gods.

verses.part1: How long will ye give wrong judgement
verses.part2: and accept the persons of the ungodly?

verses.part1: Defend the poor and fatherless
verses.part2: see that such as are in need and necessity have right.

verses.part1: Deliver the outcast and poor
verses.part2: save them from the hand of the ungodly.

verses.part1: They will not be learned nor understand, but walk on still in darkness
verses.part2: all the foundations of the earth are out of course.

verses.part1: I have said, Ye are gods
verses.part2: and ye are all the children of the most Highest.

verses.part1: But ye shall die like men
verses.part2: and fall like one of the princes.

verses.part1: Arise, O God, and judge thou the earth
verses.part2: for thou shalt take all heathen to thine inheritance.

verses.part1: HOLD not thy tongue, O God, keep not still silence
verses.part2: refrain not thyself, O God.

verses.part1: For lo, thine enemies make a murmuring
verses.part2: and they that hate thee have lift up their head.

verses.part1: They have imagined craftily against thy people
verses.part2: and taken counsel against thy secret ones.

verses.part1: They have said, Come, and let us root them out, that they be no more a people
verses.part2: and that the name of Israel may be no more in remembrance.

verses.part1: For they have cast their heads together with one consent
verses.part2: and are confederate against thee;

verses.part1: The tabernacles of the Edomites, and the Ismaelites
verses.part2: the Moabites and Hagarenes;

verses.part1: Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek
verses.part2: the Philistines, with them that dwell at Tyre.

verses.part1: Assur also is joined with them
verses.part2: and have holpen the children of Lot.

verses.part1: But do thou to them as unto the Madianites
verses.part2: unto Sisera, and unto Jabin at the brook of Kison;

verses.part1: Who perished at Endor
verses.part2: and became as the dung of the earth.

verses.part1: Make them and their princes like Oreb and Zeb
verses.part2: yea, make all their princes like as Zeba and Salmana;

verses.part1: Who say, Let us take to ourselves
verses.part2: the houses of God in possession.

verses.part1: O my God, make them like unto a wheel
verses.part2: and as the stubble before the wind;

verses.part1: Like as the fire that burneth up the wood
verses.part2: and as the flame that consumeth the mountains.

verses.part1: Persecute them even so with thy tempest
verses.part2: and make them afraid with thy storm.

verses.part1: Make their faces ashamed, O Lord
verses.part2: that they may seek thy Name.

verses.part1: Let them be confounded and vexed ever more and more
verses.part2: let them be put to shame, and perish.

verses.part1: And they shall know that thou, whose Name is Jehovah
verses.part2: art only the most Highest over all the earth.

verses.part1: O HOW amiable are thy dwellings
verses.part2: thou Lord of hosts!

verses.part1: My soul hath a desire and longing to enter into the courts of the Lord
verses.part2: my heart and my flesh rejoice in the living God.

verses.part1: Yea, the sparrow hath found her an house, and the swallow a nest where she may lay her young
verses.part2: even thy altars, O Lord of hosts, my King and my God.

verses.part1: Blessed are they that dwell in thy house
verses.part2: they will be alway praising thee.

verses.part1: Blessed is the man whose strength is in thee
verses.part2: in whose heart are thy ways.

verses.part1: Who going through the vale of misery use it for a well
verses.part2: and the pools are filled with water.

verses.part1: They will go from strength to strength
verses.part2: and unto the God of gods appeareth every one of them in Sion.

verses.part1: O Lord God of hosts, hear my prayer
verses.part2: hearken, O God of Jacob.

verses.part1: Behold, O God our defender
verses.part2: and look upon the face of thine Anointed.

verses.part1: For one day in thy courts
verses.part2: is better than a thousand.

verses.part1: I had rather be a door-keeper in the house of my God
verses.part2: than to dwell in the tents of ungodliness.

verses.part1: For the Lord God is a light and defence
verses.part2: the Lord will give grace and worship, and no good thing shall he withhold from them that live a godly life.

verses.part1: O Lord God of hosts
verses.part2: blessed is the man that putteth his trust in thee.

verses.part1: LORD, thou art become gracious unto thy land
verses.part2: thou hast turned away the captivity of Jacob.

verses.part1: Thou hast forgiven the offence of thy people
verses.part2: and covered all their sins.

verses.part1: Thou hast taken away all thy displeasure
verses.part2: and turned thyself from thy wrathful indignation.

verses.part1: Turn us then, O God our Saviour
verses.part2: and let thine anger cease from us.

verses.part1: Wilt thou be displeased at us for ever
verses.part2: and wilt thou stretch out thy wrath from one generation to another?

verses.part1: Wilt thou not turn again, and quicken us
verses.part2: that thy people may rejoice in thee?

verses.part1: Shew us thy mercy, O Lord
verses.part2: and grant us thy salvation.

verses.part1: I will hearken what the Lord God will say concerning me
verses.part2: for he shall speak peace unto his people, and to his saints, that they turn not again.

verses.part1: For his salvation is nigh them that fear him
verses.part2: that glory may dwell in our land.

verses.part1: Mercy and truth are met together
verses.part2: righteousness and peace have kissed each other.

verses.part1: Truth shall flourish out of the earth
verses.part2: and righteousness hath looked down from heaven.

verses.part1: Yea, the Lord shall shew loving-kindness
verses.part2: and our land shall give her increase.

verses.part1: Righteousness shall go before him
verses.part2: and he shall direct his going in the way.

verses.part1: BOW down thine ear, O Lord, and hear me
verses.part2: for I am poor, and in misery.

verses.part1: Preserve thou my soul, for I am holy
verses.part2: my God, save thy servant that putteth his trust in thee.

verses.part1: Be merciful unto me, O Lord
verses.part2: for I will call daily upon thee.

verses.part1: Comfort the soul of thy servant
verses.part2: for unto thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.

verses.part1: For thou, Lord, art good and gracious
verses.part2: and of great mercy unto all them that call upon thee.

verses.part1: Give ear, Lord, unto my prayer
verses.part2: and ponder the voice of my humble desires.

verses.part1: In the time of my trouble I will call upon thee
verses.part2: for thou hearest me.

verses.part1: Among the gods there is none like unto thee, O Lord
verses.part2: there is not one that can do as thou doest.

verses.part1: All nations whom thou hast made shall come and worship thee, O Lord
verses.part2: and shall glorify thy Name.

verses.part1: For thou art great, and doest wondrous things
verses.part2: thou art God alone.

verses.part1: Teach me thy way, O Lord, and I will walk in thy truth
verses.part2: O knit my heart unto thee, that I may fear thy Name.

verses.part1: I will thank thee, O Lord my God, with all my heart
verses.part2: and will praise thy Name for evermore.

verses.part1: For great is thy mercy toward me
verses.part2: and thou hast delivered my soul from the nethermost hell.

verses.part1: O God, the proud are risen against me
verses.part2: and the congregations of naughty men have sought after my soul, and have not set thee before their eyes.

verses.part1: But thou, O Lord God, art full of compassion and mercy
verses.part2: long-suffering, plenteous in goodness and truth.

verses.part1: O turn thee then unto me, and have mercy upon me
verses.part2: give thy strength unto thy servant, and help the son of thine handmaid.

verses.part1: Shew some token upon me for good, that they who hate me may see it and be ashamed
verses.part2: because thou, Lord, hast holpen me and comforted me.

verses.part1: HER foundations are upon the holy hills
verses.part2: the Lord loveth the gates of Sion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.

verses.part1: Very excellent things are spoken of thee
verses.part2: thou city of God.

verses.part1: I will think upon Rahab and Babylon
verses.part2: with them that know me.

verses.part1: Behold ye the Philistines also
verses.part2: and they of Tyre, with the Morians; lo, there was he born.

verses.part1: And of Sion it shall be reported that he was born in her
verses.part2: and the most High shall stablish her.

verses.part1: The Lord shall rehearse it when he writeth up the people
verses.part2: that he was born there.

verses.part1: The singers also and trumpeters shall he rehearse
verses.part2: All my fresh springs shall be in thee.

verses.part1: O LORD God of my salvation, I have cried day and night before thee
verses.part2: O let my prayer enter into thy presence, incline thine ear unto my calling.

verses.part1: For my soul is full of trouble
verses.part2: and my life draweth nigh unto hell.

verses.part1: I am counted as one of them that go down into the pit
verses.part2: and I have been even as a man that hath no strength.

verses.part1: Free among the dead, like unto them that are wounded, and lie in the grave
verses.part2: who are out of remembrance, and are cut away from thy hand.

verses.part1: Thou hast laid me in the lowest pit
verses.part2: in a place of darkness, and in the deep.

verses.part1: Thine indignation lieth hard upon me
verses.part2: and thou hast vexed me with all thy storms.

verses.part1: Thou hast put away mine acquaintance far from me
verses.part2: and made me to be abhorred of them.

verses.part1: I am so fast in prison
verses.part2: that I cannot get forth.

verses.part1: My sight faileth for very trouble
verses.part2: Lord, I have called daily upon thee, I have stretched forth my hands unto thee.

verses.part1: Dost thou shew wonders among the dead
verses.part2: or shall the dead rise up again, and praise thee?

verses.part1: Shall thy loving-kindness be shewed in the grave
verses.part2: or thy faithfulness in destruction?

verses.part1: Shall thy wondrous works be known in the dark
verses.part2: and thy righteousness in the land where all things are forgotten?

verses.part1: Unto thee have I cried, O Lord
verses.part2: and early shall my prayer come before thee.

verses.part1: Lord, why abhorrest thou my soul
verses.part2: and hidest thou thy face from me?

verses.part1: I am in misery, and like unto him that is at the point to die
verses.part2: even from my youth up thy terrors have I suffered with a troubled mind.

verses.part1: Thy wrathful displeasure goeth over me
verses.part2: and the fear of thee hath undone me.

verses.part1: They came round about me daily like water
verses.part2: and compassed me together on every side.

verses.part1: My lovers and friends hast thou put away from me
verses.part2: and hid mine acquaintance out of my sight.

verses.part1: MY song shall be alway of the loving-kindness of the Lord
verses.part2: with my mouth will I ever be shewing thy truth from one generation to another.

verses.part1: For I have said, Mercy shall be set up for ever
verses.part2: thy truth shalt thou stablish in the heavens.

verses.part1: I have made a covenant with my chosen
verses.part2: I have sworn unto David my servant;

verses.part1: Thy seed will I stablish for ever
verses.part2: and set up thy throne from one generation to another.

verses.part1: O Lord, the very heavens shall praise thy wondrous works
verses.part2: and thy truth in the congregation of the saints.

verses.part1: For who is he among the clouds
verses.part2: that shall be compared unto the Lord?

verses.part1: And what is he among the gods
verses.part2: that shall be like unto the Lord?

verses.part1: God is very greatly to be feared in the council of the saints
verses.part2: and to be had in reverence of all them that are round about him.

verses.part1: O Lord God of hosts, who is like unto thee
verses.part2: thy truth, most mighty Lord, is on every side.

verses.part1: Thou rulest the raging of the sea
verses.part2: thou stillest the waves thereof when they arise.

verses.part1: Thou hast subdued Egypt, and destroyed it
verses.part2: thou hast scattered thine enemies abroad with thy mighty arm.

verses.part1: The heavens are thine, the earth also is thine
verses.part2: thou hast laid the foundation of the round world, and all that therein is.

verses.part1: Thou hast made the north and the south
verses.part2: Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in thy Name.

verses.part1: Thou hast a mighty arm
verses.part2: strong is thy hand, and high is thy right hand.

verses.part1: Righteousness and equity are the habitation of thy seat
verses.part2: mercy and truth shall go before thy face.

verses.part1: Blessed is the people, O Lord, that can rejoice in thee
verses.part2: they shall walk in the light of thy countenance.

verses.part1: Their delight shall be daily in thy Name
verses.part2: and in thy righteousness shall they make their boast.

verses.part1: For thou art the glory of their strength
verses.part2: and in thy loving-kindness thou shalt lift up our horns.

verses.part1: For the Lord is our defence
verses.part2: the Holy One of Israel is our King.

verses.part1: Thou spakest sometime in visions unto thy saints, and saidst
verses.part2: I have laid help upon one that is mighty; I have exalted one chosen out of the people.

verses.part1: I have found David my servant
verses.part2: with my holy oil have I anointed him.

verses.part1: My hand shall hold him fast
verses.part2: and my arm shall strengthen him.

verses.part1: The enemy shall not be able to do him violence
verses.part2: the son of wickedness shall not hurt him.

verses.part1: I will smite down his foes before his face
verses.part2: and plague them that hate him.

verses.part1: My truth also and my mercy shall be with him
verses.part2: and in my Name shall his horn be exalted.

verses.part1: I will set his dominion also in the sea
verses.part2: and his right hand in the floods.

verses.part1: He shall call me, Thou art my Father
verses.part2: my God, and my strong salvation.

verses.part1: And I will make him my first-born
verses.part2: higher than the kings of the earth.

verses.part1: My mercy will I keep for him for evermore
verses.part2: and my covenant shall stand fast with him.

verses.part1: His seed also will I make to endure for ever
verses.part2: and his throne as the days of heaven.

verses.part1: But if his children forsake my law
verses.part2: and walk not in my judgements;

verses.part1: If they break my statutes, and keep not my commandments
verses.part2: I will visit their offences with the rod, and their sin with scourges.

verses.part1: Nevertheless, my loving-kindness will I not utterly take from him
verses.part2: nor suffer my truth to fail.

verses.part1: My covenant will I not break, nor alter the thing that is gone out of my lips
verses.part2: I have sworn once by my holiness, that I will not fail David.

verses.part1: His seed shall endure for ever
verses.part2: and his seat is like as the sun before me.

verses.part1: He shall stand fast for evermore as the moon
verses.part2: and as the faithful witness in heaven.

verses.part1: But thou hast abhorred and forsaken thine Anointed
verses.part2: and art displeased at him.

verses.part1: Thou hast broken the covenant of thy servant
verses.part2: and cast his crown to the ground.

verses.part1: Thou hast overthrown all his hedges
verses.part2: and broken down his strong holds.

verses.part1: All they that go by spoil him
verses.part2: and he is become a reproach to his neighbours.

verses.part1: Thou hast set up the right hand of his enemies
verses.part2: and made all his adversaries to rejoice.

verses.part1: Thou hast taken away the edge of his sword
verses.part2: and givest him not victory in the battle.

verses.part1: Thou hast put out his glory
verses.part2: and cast his throne down to the ground.

verses.part1: The days of his youth hast thou shortened
verses.part2: and covered him with dishonour.

verses.part1: Lord, how long wilt thou hide thyself, for ever
verses.part2: and shall thy wrath burn like fire?

verses.part1: O remember how short my time is
verses.part2: wherefore hast thou made all men for nought?

verses.part1: What man is he that liveth, and shall not see death
verses.part2: and shall he deliver his soul from the hand of hell?

verses.part1: Lord, where are thy old loving-kindnesses
verses.part2: which thou swarest unto David in thy truth?

verses.part1: Remember, Lord, the rebuke that thy servants have
verses.part2: and how I do bear in my bosom the rebukes of many people;

verses.part1: Wherewith thine enemies have blasphemed thee, and slandered the footsteps of thine Anointed
verses.part2: Praised be the Lord for evermore. Amen, and Amen.

verses.part1: LORD, thou hast been our refuge
verses.part2: from one generation to another.

verses.part1: Before the mountains were brought forth, or ever the earth and the world were made
verses.part2: thou art God from everlasting, and world without end.

verses.part1: Thou turnest man to destruction
verses.part2: again thou sayest, Come again, ye children of men.

verses.part1: For a thousand years in thy sight are but as yester-day
verses.part2: seeing that is past as a watch in the night.

verses.part1: As soon as thou scatterest them they are even as a sleep
verses.part2: and fade away suddenly like the grass.

verses.part1: In the morning it is green, and groweth up
verses.part2: but in the evening it is cut down, dried up, and withered.

verses.part1: For we consume away in thy displeasure
verses.part2: and are afraid at thy wrathful indignation.

verses.part1: Thou hast set our misdeeds before thee
verses.part2: and our secret sins in the light of thy countenance.

verses.part1: For when thou art angry all our days are gone
verses.part2: we bring our years to an end, as it were a tale that is told.

verses.part1: The days of our age are threescore years and ten; and though men be so strong that they come to fourscore years
verses.part2: yet is their strength then but labour and sorrow; so soon passeth it away, and we are gone.

verses.part1: But who regardeth the power of thy wrath
verses.part2: for even thereafter as a man feareth, so is thy displeasure.

verses.part1: So teach us to number our days
verses.part2: that we may apply our hearts unto wisdom.

verses.part1: Turn thee again, O Lord, at the last
verses.part2: and be gracious unto thy servants.

verses.part1: O satisfy us with thy mercy, and that soon
verses.part2: so shall we rejoice and be glad all the days of our life.

verses.part1: Comfort us again now after the time that thou hast plagued us
verses.part2: and for the years wherein we have suffered adversity.

verses.part1: Shew thy servants thy work
verses.part2: and their children thy glory.

verses.part1: And the glorious majesty of the Lord our God be upon us
verses.part2: prosper thou the work of our hands upon us, O prosper thou our handywork.

verses.part1: WHOSO dwelleth under the defence of the most High
verses.part2: shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.

verses.part1: I will say unto the Lord, Thou art my hope, and my strong hold
verses.part2: my God, in him will I trust.

verses.part1: For he shall deliver thee from the snare of the hunter
verses.part2: and from the noisome pestilence.

verses.part1: He shall defend thee under his wings, and thou shalt be safe under his feathers
verses.part2: his faithfulness and truth shall be thy shield and buckler.

verses.part1: Thou shalt not be afraid for any terror by night
verses.part2: nor for the arrow that flieth by day;

verses.part1: For the pestilence that walketh in darkness
verses.part2: nor for the sickness that destroyeth in the noon-day.

verses.part1: A thousand shall fall beside thee, and ten thousand at thy right hand
verses.part2: but it shall not come nigh thee.

verses.part1: Yea, with thine eyes shalt thou behold
verses.part2: and see the reward of the ungodly.

verses.part1: For thou, Lord, art my hope
verses.part2: thou hast set thine house of defence very high.

verses.part1: There shall no evil happen unto thee
verses.part2: neither shall any plague come nigh thy dwelling.

verses.part1: For he shall give his angels charge over thee
verses.part2: to keep thee in all thy ways.

verses.part1: They shall bear thee in their hands
verses.part2: that thou hurt not thy foot against a stone.

verses.part1: Thou shalt go upon the lion and adder
verses.part2: the young lion and the dragon shalt thou tread under thy feet.

verses.part1: Because he hath set his love upon me, therefore will I deliver him
verses.part2: I will set him up, because he hath known my Name.

verses.part1: He shall call upon me, and I will hear him
verses.part2: yea, I am with him in trouble; I will deliver him, and bring him to honour.

verses.part1: With long life will I satisfy him
verses.part2: and shew him my salvation.

verses.part1: IT is a good thing to give thanks unto the Lord
verses.part2: and to sing praises unto thy Name, O most Highest;

verses.part1: To tell of thy loving-kindness early in the morning
verses.part2: and of thy truth in the night-season;

verses.part1: Upon an instrument of ten strings, and upon the lute
verses.part2: upon a loud instrument, and upon the harp.

verses.part1: For thou, Lord, hast made me glad through thy works
verses.part2: and I will rejoice in giving praise for the operations of thy hands.

verses.part1: O Lord, how glorious are thy works
verses.part2: thy thoughts are very deep.

verses.part1: An unwise man doth not well consider this
verses.part2: and a fool doth not understand it.

verses.part1: When the ungodly are green as the grass, and when all the workers of wickedness do flourish
verses.part2: then shall they be destroyed for ever; but thou, Lord, art the most Highest for evermore.

verses.part1: For lo, thine enemies, O Lord, lo, thine enemies shall perish
verses.part2: and all the workers of wickedness shall be destroyed.

verses.part1: But mine horn shall be exalted like the horn of an unicorn
verses.part2: for I am anointed with fresh oil.

verses.part1: Mine eye also shall see his lust of mine enemies
verses.part2: and mine ear shall hear his desire of the wicked that arise up against me.

verses.part1: The righteous shall flourish like a palm-tree
verses.part2: and shall spread abroad like a cedar in Libanus.

verses.part1: Such as are planted in the house of the Lord
verses.part2: shall flourish in the courts of the house of our God.

verses.part1: They also shall bring forth more fruit in their age
verses.part2: and shall be fat and well-liking.

verses.part1: That they may shew how true the Lord my strength is
verses.part2: and that there is no unrighteousness in him.

verses.part1: THE Lord is King, and hath put on glorious apparel
verses.part2: the Lord hath put on his apparel, and girded himself with strength.

verses.part1: He hath made the round world so sure
verses.part2: that it cannot be moved.

verses.part1: Ever since the world began hath thy seat been prepared
verses.part2: thou art from everlasting.

verses.part1: The floods are risen, O Lord, the floods have lift up their voice
verses.part2: the floods lift up their waves.

verses.part1: The waves of the sea are mighty, and rage horribly
verses.part2: but yet the Lord, who dwelleth on high, is mightier.

verses.part1: Thy testimonies, O Lord, are very sure
verses.part2: holiness becometh thine house for ever.

verses.part1: O LORD God, to whom vengeance belongeth
verses.part2: thou God, to whom vengeance belongeth, shew thyself.

verses.part1: Arise, thou Judge of the world
verses.part2: and reward the proud after their deserving.

verses.part1: Lord, how long shall the ungodly
verses.part2: how long shall the ungodly triumph?

verses.part1: How long shall all wicked doers speak so disdainfully
verses.part2: and make such proud boasting?

verses.part1: They smite down thy people, O Lord
verses.part2: and trouble thine heritage.

verses.part1: They murder the widow and the stranger
verses.part2: and put the fatherless to death.

verses.part1: And yet they say, Tush, the Lord shall not see
verses.part2: neither shall the God of Jacob regard it.

verses.part1: Take heed, ye unwise among the people
verses.part2: O ye fools, when will ye understand?

verses.part1: He that planted the ear, shall he not hear
verses.part2: or he that made the eye, shall he not see?

verses.part1: Or he that nurtureth the heathen
verses.part2: it is he that teacheth man knowledge, shall not he punish?

verses.part1: The Lord knoweth the thoughts of man
verses.part2: that they are but vain.

verses.part1: Blessed is the man whom thou chastenest, O Lord
verses.part2: and teachest him in thy law;

verses.part1: That thou mayest give him patience in time of adversity
verses.part2: until the pit be digged up for the ungodly.

verses.part1: For the Lord will not fail his people
verses.part2: neither will he forsake his inheritance;

verses.part1: Until righteousness turn again unto judgement
verses.part2: all such as are true in heart shall follow it.

verses.part1: Who will rise up with me against the wicked
verses.part2: or who will take my part against the evil-doers?

verses.part1: If the Lord had not helped me
verses.part2: it had not failed but my soul had been put to silence.

verses.part1: But when I said, My foot hath slipt
verses.part2: thy mercy, O Lord, held me up.

verses.part1: In the multitude of the sorrows that I had in my heart
verses.part2: thy comforts have refreshed my soul.

verses.part1: Wilt thou have any thing to do with the stool of wickedness
verses.part2: which imagineth mischief as a law?

verses.part1: They gather them together against the soul of the righteous
verses.part2: and condemn the innocent blood.

verses.part1: But the Lord is my refuge
verses.part2: and my God is the strength of my confidence.

verses.part1: He shall recompense them their wickedness, and destroy them in their own malice
verses.part2: yea, the Lord our God shall destroy them.

verses.part1: O COME, let us sing unto the Lord
verses.part2: let us heartily rejoice in the strength of our salvation.

verses.part1: Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving
verses.part2: and shew ourselves glad in him with psalms.

verses.part1: For the Lord is a great God
verses.part2: and a great King above all gods.

verses.part1: In his hand are all the corners of the earth
verses.part2: and the strength of the hills is his also.

verses.part1: The sea is his, and he made it
verses.part2: and his hands prepared the dry land.

verses.part1: O come, let us worship and fall down
verses.part2: and kneel before the Lord our Maker.

verses.part1: For he is the Lord our God
verses.part2: and we are the people of his pasture, and the sheep of his hand.

verses.part1: To-day if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts
verses.part2: as in the provocation, and as in the day of temptation in the wilderness;

verses.part1: When your fathers tempted me
verses.part2: proved me, and saw my works.

verses.part1: Forty years long was I grieved with this generation, and said
verses.part2: It is a people that do err in their hearts, for they have not known my ways;

verses.part1: Unto whom I sware in my wrath
verses.part2: that they should not enter into my rest.

verses.part1: O SING unto the Lord a new song
verses.part2: sing unto the Lord, all the whole earth.

verses.part1: Sing unto the Lord, and praise his Name
verses.part2: be telling of his salvation from day to day.

verses.part1: Declare his honour unto the heathen
verses.part2: and his wonders unto all people.

verses.part1: For the Lord is great, and cannot worthily be praised
verses.part2: he is more to be feared than all gods.

verses.part1: As for all the gods of the heathen, they are but idols
verses.part2: but it is the Lord that made the heavens.

verses.part1: Glory and worship are before him
verses.part2: power and honour are in his sanctuary.

verses.part1: Ascribe unto the Lord, O ye kindreds of the people
verses.part2: ascribe unto the Lord worship and power.

verses.part1: Ascribe unto the Lord the honour due unto his Name
verses.part2: bring presents, and come into his courts.

verses.part1: O worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness
verses.part2: let the whole earth stand in awe of him.

verses.part1: Tell it out among the heathen that the Lord is King
verses.part2: and that it is he who hath made the round world so fast that it cannot be moved; and how that he shall judge the people righteously.

verses.part1: Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad
verses.part2: let the sea make a noise, and all that therein is.

verses.part1: Let the field be joyful, and all that is in it
verses.part2: then shall all the trees of the wood rejoice before the Lord.

verses.part1: For he cometh, for he cometh to judge the earth
verses.part2: and with righteousness to judge the world, and the people with his truth.

verses.part1: THE Lord is King, the earth may be glad thereof
verses.part2: yea, the multitude of the isles may be glad thereof.

verses.part1: Clouds and darkness are round about him
verses.part2: righteousness and judgement are the habitation of his seat.

verses.part1: There shall go a fire before him
verses.part2: and burn up his enemies on every side.

verses.part1: His lightnings gave shine unto the world
verses.part2: the earth saw it, and was afraid.

verses.part1: The hills melted like wax at the presence of the Lord
verses.part2: at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.

verses.part1: The heavens have declared his righteousness
verses.part2: and all the people have seen his glory.

verses.part1: Confounded be all they that worship carved images, and that delight in vain gods
verses.part2: worship him, all ye gods.

verses.part1: Sion heard of it, and rejoiced
verses.part2: and the daughters of Judah were glad, because of thy judgements, O Lord.

verses.part1: For thou, Lord, art higher than all that are in the earth
verses.part2: thou art exalted far above all gods.

verses.part1: O ye that love the Lord, see that ye hate the thing which is evil
verses.part2: the Lord preserveth the souls of his saints; he shall deliver them from the hand of the ungodly.

verses.part1: There is sprung up a light for the righteous
verses.part2: and joyful gladness for such as are true-hearted.

verses.part1: Rejoice in the Lord, ye righteous
verses.part2: and give thanks for a remembrance of his holiness.

verses.part1: O SING unto the Lord a new song
verses.part2: for he hath done marvellous things.

verses.part1: With his own right hand, and with his holy arm
verses.part2: hath he gotten himself the victory.

verses.part1: The Lord declared his salvation
verses.part2: his righteousness hath he openly shewed in the sight of the heathen.

verses.part1: He hath remembered his mercy and truth toward the house of Israel
verses.part2: and all the ends of the world have seen the salvation of our God.

verses.part1: Shew yourselves joyful unto the Lord, all ye lands
verses.part2: sing, rejoice, and give thanks.

verses.part1: Praise the Lord upon the harp
verses.part2: sing to the harp with a psalm of thanksgiving.

verses.part1: With trumpets also and shawms
verses.part2: O shew yourselves joyful before the Lord the King.

verses.part1: Let the sea make a noise, and all that therein is
verses.part2: the round world, and they that dwell therein.

verses.part1: Let the floods clap their hands, and let the hills be joyful together before the Lord
verses.part2: for he is come to judge the earth.

verses.part1: With righteousness shall he judge the world
verses.part2: and the people with equity.

verses.part1: THE Lord is King, be the people never so unpatient
verses.part2: he sitteth between the cherubims, be the earth never so unquiet.

verses.part1: The Lord is great in Sion
verses.part2: and high above all people.

verses.part1: They shall give thanks unto thy Name
verses.part2: which is great, wonderful, and holy.

verses.part1: The King's power loveth judgement; thou hast prepared equity
verses.part2: thou hast executed judgement and righteousness in Jacob.

verses.part1: O magnify the Lord our God
verses.part2: and fall down before his footstool, for he is holy.

verses.part1: Moses and Aaron among his priests, and Samuel among such as call upon his Name
verses.part2: these called upon the Lord, and he heard them.

verses.part1: He spake unto them out of the cloudy pillar
verses.part2: for they kept his testimonies, and the law that he gave them.

verses.part1: Thou heardest them, O Lord our God
verses.part2: thou forgavest them, O God, and punishedst their own inventions.

verses.part1: O magnify the Lord our God, and worship him upon his holy hill
verses.part2: for the Lord our God is holy.

verses.part1: O BE joyful in the Lord, all ye lands
verses.part2: serve the Lord with gladness, and come before his presence with a song.

verses.part1: Be ye sure that the Lord he is God
verses.part2: it is he that hath made us, and not we ourselves; we are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.

verses.part1: O go your way into his gates with thanksgiving, and into his courts with praise
verses.part2: be thankful unto him, and speak good of his Name.

verses.part1: For the Lord is gracious, his mercy is everlasting
verses.part2: and his truth endureth from generation to generation.

verses.part1: MY song shall be of mercy and judgement
verses.part2: unto thee, O Lord, will I sing.

verses.part1: O let me have understanding
verses.part2: in the way of godliness.

verses.part1: When wilt thou come unto me
verses.part2: I will walk in my house with a perfect heart.

verses.part1: I will take no wicked thing in hand; I hate the sins of unfaithfulness
verses.part2: there shall no such cleave unto me.

verses.part1: A froward heart shall depart from me
verses.part2: I will not know a wicked person.

verses.part1: Whoso privily slandereth his neighbour
verses.part2: him will I destroy.

verses.part1: Whoso hath also a proud look and high stomach
verses.part2: I will not suffer him.

verses.part1: Mine eyes look upon such as are faithful in the land
verses.part2: that they may dwell with me.

verses.part1: Whoso leadeth a godly life
verses.part2: he shall be my servant.

verses.part1: There shall no deceitful person dwell in my house
verses.part2: he that telleth lies shall not tarry in my sight.

verses.part1: I shall soon destroy all the ungodly that are in the land
verses.part2: that I may root out all wicked doers from the city of the Lord.

verses.part1: HEAR my prayer, O Lord
verses.part2: and let my crying come unto thee.

verses.part1: Hide not thy face from me in the time of my trouble
verses.part2: incline thine ear unto me when I call; O hear me, and that right soon.

verses.part1: For my days are consumed away like smoke
verses.part2: and my bones are burnt up as it were a fire-brand.

verses.part1: My heart is smitten down, and withered like grass
verses.part2: so that I forget to eat my bread.

verses.part1: For the voice of my groaning
verses.part2: my bones will scarce cleave to my flesh.

verses.part1: I am become like a pelican in the wilderness
verses.part2: and like an owl that is in the desert.

verses.part1: I have watched, and am even as it were a sparrow
verses.part2: that sitteth alone upon the house-top.

verses.part1: Mine enemies revile me all the day long
verses.part2: and they that are mad upon me are sworn together against me.

verses.part1: For I have eaten ashes as it were bread
verses.part2: and mingled my drink with weeping;

verses.part1: And that because of thine indignation and wrath
verses.part2: for thou hast taken me up, and cast me down.

verses.part1: My days are gone like a shadow
verses.part2: and I am withered like grass.

verses.part1: But thou, O Lord, shalt endure for ever
verses.part2: and thy remembrance throughout all generations.

verses.part1: Thou shalt arise, and have mercy upon Sion
verses.part2: for it is time that thou have mercy upon her, yea, the time is come.

verses.part1: And why? thy servants think upon her stones
verses.part2: and it pitieth them to see her in the dust.

verses.part1: The heathen shall fear thy Name, O Lord
verses.part2: and all the kings of the earth thy majesty;

verses.part1: When the Lord shall build up Sion
verses.part2: and when his glory shall appear;

verses.part1: When he turneth him unto the prayer of the poor destitute
verses.part2: and despiseth not their desire.

verses.part1: This shall be written for those that come after
verses.part2: and the people which shall be born shall praise the Lord.

verses.part1: For he hath looked down from his sanctuary
verses.part2: out of the heaven did the Lord behold the earth;

verses.part1: That he might hear the mournings of such as are in captivity
verses.part2: and deliver the children appointed unto death;

verses.part1: That they may declare the Name of the Lord in Sion
verses.part2: and his worship at Jerusalem;

verses.part1: When the people are gathered together
verses.part2: and the kingdoms also, to serve the Lord.

verses.part1: He brought down my strength in my journey
verses.part2: and shortened my days.

verses.part1: But I said, O my God, take me not away in the midst of mine age
verses.part2: as for thy years, they endure throughout all generations.

verses.part1: Thou, Lord, in the beginning hast laid the foundation of the earth
verses.part2: and the heavens are the work of thy hands.

verses.part1: They shall perish, but thou shalt endure
verses.part2: they all shall wax old as doth a garment;

verses.part1: And as a vesture shalt thou change them, and they shall be changed
verses.part2: but thou art the same, and thy years shall not fail.

verses.part1: The children of thy servants shall continue
verses.part2: and their seed shall stand fast in thy sight.

verses.part1: PRAISE the Lord, O my soul
verses.part2: and all that is within me praise his holy Name.

verses.part1: Praise the Lord, O my soul
verses.part2: and forget not all his benefits;

verses.part1: Who forgiveth all thy sin
verses.part2: and healeth all thine infirmities;

verses.part1: Who saveth thy life from destruction
verses.part2: and crowneth thee with mercy and loving-kindness;

verses.part1: Who satisfieth thy mouth with good things
verses.part2: making thee young and lusty as an eagle.

verses.part1: The Lord executeth righteousness and judgement
verses.part2: for all them that are oppressed with wrong.

verses.part1: He shewed his ways unto Moses
verses.part2: his works unto the children of Israel.

verses.part1: The Lord is full of compassion and mercy
verses.part2: long-suffering, and of great goodness.

verses.part1: He will not alway be chiding
verses.part2: neither keepeth he his anger for ever.

verses.part1: He hath not dealt with us after our sins
verses.part2: nor rewarded us according to our wickednesses.

verses.part1: For look how high the heaven is in comparison of the earth
verses.part2: so great is his mercy also toward them that fear him.

verses.part1: Look how wide also the east is from the west
verses.part2: so far hath he set our sins from us.

verses.part1: Yea, like as a father pitieth his own children
verses.part2: even so is the Lord merciful unto them that fear him.

verses.part1: For he knoweth whereof we are made
verses.part2: he remembereth that we are but dust.

verses.part1: The days of man are but as grass
verses.part2: for he flourisheth as a flower of the field.

verses.part1: For as soon as the wind goeth over it, it is gone
verses.part2: and the place thereof shall know it no more.

verses.part1: But the merciful goodness of the Lord endureth for ever and ever upon them that fear him
verses.part2: and his righteousness upon children's children;

verses.part1: Even upon such as keep his covenant
verses.part2: and think upon his commandments to do them.

verses.part1: The Lord hath prepared his seat in heaven
verses.part2: and his kingdom ruleth over all.

verses.part1: O praise the Lord, ye angels of his, ye that excel in strength
verses.part2: ye that fulfil his commandment, and hearken unto the voice of his words.

verses.part1: O praise the Lord, all ye his hosts
verses.part2: ye servants of his that do his pleasure.

verses.part1: O speak good of the Lord, all ye works of his, in all places of his dominion
verses.part2: praise thou the Lord, O my soul.

verses.part1: PRAISE the Lord, O my soul
verses.part2: O Lord my God, thou art become exceeding glorious; thou art clothed with majesty and honour.

verses.part1: Thou deckest thyself with light as it were with a garment
verses.part2: and spreadest out the heavens like a curtain.

verses.part1: Who layeth the beams of his chambers in the waters
verses.part2: and maketh the clouds his chariot, and walketh upon the wings of the wind.

verses.part1: He maketh his angels spirits
verses.part2: and his ministers a flaming fire.

verses.part1: He laid the foundations of the earth
verses.part2: that it never should move at any time.

verses.part1: Thou coveredst it with the deep like as with a garment
verses.part2: the waters stand in the hills.

verses.part1: At thy rebuke they flee
verses.part2: at the voice of thy thunder they are afraid.

verses.part1: They go up as high as the hills, and down to the valleys beneath
verses.part2: even unto the place which thou hast appointed for them.

verses.part1: Thou hast set them their bounds which they shall not pass
verses.part2: neither turn again to cover the earth.

verses.part1: He sendeth the springs into the rivers
verses.part2: which run among the hills.

verses.part1: All beasts of the field drink thereof
verses.part2: and the wild asses quench their thirst.

verses.part1: Beside them shall the fowls of the air have their habitation
verses.part2: and sing among the branches.

verses.part1: He watereth the hills from above
verses.part2: the earth is filled with the fruit of thy works.

verses.part1: He bringeth forth grass for the cattle
verses.part2: and green herb for the service of men;

verses.part1: That he may bring food out of the earth, and wine that maketh glad the heart of man
verses.part2: and oil to make him a cheerful countenance, and bread to strengthen man's heart.

verses.part1: The trees of the Lord also are full of sap
verses.part2: even the cedars of Libanus which he hath planted;

verses.part1: Wherein the birds make their nests
verses.part2: and the fir-trees are a dwelling for the stork.

verses.part1: The high hills are a refuge for the wild goats
verses.part2: and so are the stony rocks for the conies.

verses.part1: He appointed the moon for certain seasons
verses.part2: and the sun knoweth his going down.

verses.part1: Thou makest darkness that it may be night
verses.part2: wherein all the beasts of the forest do move.

verses.part1: The lions roaring after their prey
verses.part2: do seek their meat from God.

verses.part1: The sun ariseth, and they get them away together
verses.part2: and lay them down in their dens.

verses.part1: Man goeth forth to his work, and to his labour
verses.part2: until the evening.

verses.part1: O Lord, how manifold are thy works
verses.part2: in wisdom hast thou made them all; the earth is full of thy riches.

verses.part1: So is the great and wide sea also
verses.part2: wherein are things creeping innumerable, both small and great beasts.

verses.part1: There go the ships, and there is that Leviathan
verses.part2: whom thou hast made to take his pastime therein.

verses.part1: These wait all upon thee
verses.part2: that thou mayest give them meat in due season.

verses.part1: When thou givest it them they gather it
verses.part2: and when thou openest thy hand they are filled with good.

verses.part1: When thou hidest thy face they are troubled
verses.part2: when thou takest away their breath they die, and are turned again to their dust.

verses.part1: When thou lettest thy breath go forth they shall be made
verses.part2: and thou shalt renew the face of the earth.

verses.part1: The glorious majesty of the Lord shall endure for ever
verses.part2: the Lord shall rejoice in his works.

verses.part1: The earth shall tremble at the look of him
verses.part2: if he do but touch the hills, they shall smoke.

verses.part1: I will sing unto the Lord as long as I live
verses.part2: I will praise my God while I have my being.

verses.part1: And so shall my words please him
verses.part2: my joy shall be in the Lord.

verses.part1: As for sinners, they shall be consumed out of the earth, and the ungodly shall come to an end
verses.part2: praise thou the Lord, O my soul, praise the Lord.

verses.part1: O GIVE thanks unto the Lord, and call upon his Name
verses.part2: tell the people what things he hath done.

verses.part1: O let your songs be of him, and praise him
verses.part2: and let your talking be of all his wondrous works.

verses.part1: Rejoice in his holy Name
verses.part2: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the Lord.

verses.part1: Seek the Lord and his strength
verses.part2: seek his face evermore.

verses.part1: Remember the marvellous works that he hath done
verses.part2: his wonders, and the judgements of his mouth,

verses.part1: O ye seed of Abraham his servant
verses.part2: ye children of Jacob his chosen.

verses.part1: He is the Lord our God
verses.part2: his judgements are in all the world.

verses.part1: He hath been alway mindful of his covenant and promise
verses.part2: that he made to a thousand generations;

verses.part1: Even the covenant that he made with Abraham
verses.part2: and the oath that he sware unto Isaac;

verses.part1: And appointed the same unto Jacob for a law
verses.part2: and to Israel for an everlasting testament;

verses.part1: Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan
verses.part2: the lot of your inheritance;

verses.part1: When there were yet but a few of them
verses.part2: and they strangers in the land;

verses.part1: What time as they went from one nation to another
verses.part2: from one kingdom to another people;

verses.part1: He suffered no man to do them wrong
verses.part2: but reproved even kings for their sakes;

verses.part1: Touch not mine Anointed
verses.part2: and do my prophets no harm.

verses.part1: Moreover, he called for a dearth upon the land
verses.part2: and destroyed all the provision of bread.

verses.part1: But he had sent a man before them
verses.part2: even Joseph, who was sold to be a bond-servant;

verses.part1: Whose feet they hurt in the stocks
verses.part2: the iron entered into his soul;

verses.part1: Until the time came that his cause was known
verses.part2: the word of the Lord tried him.

verses.part1: The king sent, and delivered him
verses.part2: the prince of the people let him go free.

verses.part1: He made him lord also of his house
verses.part2: and ruler of all his substance;

verses.part1: That he might inform his princes after his will
verses.part2: and teach his senators wisdom.

verses.part1: Israel also came into Egypt
verses.part2: and Jacob was a stranger in the land of Ham.

verses.part1: And he increased his people exceedingly
verses.part2: and made them stronger than their enemies;

verses.part1: Whose heart turned, so that they hated his people
verses.part2: and dealt untruly with his servants.

verses.part1: Then sent he Moses his servant
verses.part2: and Aaron whom he had chosen.

verses.part1: And these shewed his tokens among them
verses.part2: and wonders in the land of Ham.

verses.part1: He sent darkness, and it was dark
verses.part2: and they were not obedient unto his word.

verses.part1: He turned their waters into blood
verses.part2: and slew their fish.

verses.part1: Their land brought forth frogs
verses.part2: yea, even in their kings' chambers.

verses.part1: He spake the word, and there came all manner of flies
verses.part2: and lice in all their quarters.

verses.part1: He gave them hail-stones for rain
verses.part2: and flames of fire in their land.

verses.part1: He smote their vines also and fig-trees
verses.part2: and destroyed the trees that were in their coasts.

verses.part1: He spake the word, and the grasshoppers came, and caterpillars innumerable
verses.part2: and did eat up all the grass in their land, and devoured the fruit of their ground.

verses.part1: He smote all the first-born in their land
verses.part2: even the chief of all their strength.

verses.part1: He brought them forth also with silver and gold
verses.part2: there was not one feeble person among their tribes.

verses.part1: Egypt was glad at their departing
verses.part2: for they were afraid of them.

verses.part1: He spread out a cloud to be a covering
verses.part2: and fire to give light in the night-season.

verses.part1: At their desire he brought quails
verses.part2: and he filled them with the bread of heaven.

verses.part1: He opened the rock of stone, and the waters flowed out
verses.part2: so that rivers ran in the dry places.

verses.part1: For why? he remembered his holy promise
verses.part2: and Abraham his servant.

verses.part1: And he brought forth his people with joy
verses.part2: and his chosen with gladness;

verses.part1: And gave them the lands of the heathen
verses.part2: and they took the labours of the people in possession;

verses.part1: That they might keep his statutes
verses.part2: and observe his laws.

verses.part1: O GIVE thanks unto the Lord, for he is gracious
verses.part2: and his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.part1: Who can express the noble acts of the Lord
verses.part2: or shew forth all his praise?

verses.part1: Blessed are they that alway keep judgement
verses.part2: and do righteousness.

verses.part1: Remember me, O Lord, according to the favour that thou bearest unto thy people
verses.part2: O visit me with thy salvation;

verses.part1: That I may see the felicity of thy chosen
verses.part2: and rejoice in the gladness of thy people, and give thanks with thine inheritance.

verses.part1: We have sinned with our fathers
verses.part2: we have done amiss, and dealt wickedly.

verses.part1: Our fathers regarded not thy wonders in Egypt, neither kept they thy great goodness in remembrance
verses.part2: but were disobedient at the sea, even at the Red sea.

verses.part1: Nevertheless, he helped them for his Name's sake
verses.part2: that he might make his power to be known.

verses.part1: He rebuked the Red sea also, and it was dried up
verses.part2: so he led them through the deep, as through a wilderness.

verses.part1: And he saved them from the adversaries' hand
verses.part2: and delivered them from the hand of the enemy.

verses.part1: As for those that troubled them, the waters overwhelmed them
verses.part2: there was not one of them left.

verses.part1: Then believed they his words
verses.part2: and sang praise unto him.

verses.part1: But within a while they forgat his works
verses.part2: and would not abide his counsel.

verses.part1: But lust came upon them in the wilderness
verses.part2: and they tempted God in the desert.

verses.part1: And he gave them their desire
verses.part2: and sent leanness withal into their soul.

verses.part1: They angered Moses also in the tents
verses.part2: and Aaron the saint of the Lord.

verses.part1: So the earth opened, and swallowed up Dathan
verses.part2: and covered the congregation of Abiram.

verses.part1: And the fire was kindled in their company
verses.part2: the flame burnt up the ungodly.

verses.part1: They made a calf in Horeb
verses.part2: and worshipped the molten image.

verses.part1: Thus they turned their glory
verses.part2: into the similitude of a calf that eateth hay.

verses.part1: And they forgat God their Saviour
verses.part2: who had done so great things in Egypt;

verses.part1: Wondrous works in the land of Ham
verses.part2: and fearful things by the Red sea.

verses.part1: So he said, he would have destroyed them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the gap
verses.part2: to turn away his wrathful indignation, lest he should destroy them.

verses.part1: Yea, they thought scorn of that pleasant land
verses.part2: and gave no credence unto his word;

verses.part1: But murmured in their tents
verses.part2: and hearkened not unto the voice of the Lord.

verses.part1: Then lift he up his hand against them
verses.part2: to overthrow them in the wilderness;

verses.part1: To cast out their seed among the nations
verses.part2: and to scatter them in the lands.

verses.part1: They joined themselves unto Baal-peor
verses.part2: and ate the offerings of the dead.

verses.part1: Thus they provoked him to anger with their own inventions
verses.part2: and the plague was great among them.

verses.part1: Then stood up Phinees and prayed
verses.part2: and so the plague ceased.

verses.part1: And that was counted unto him for righteousness
verses.part2: among all posterities for evermore.

verses.part1: They angered him also at the waters of strife
verses.part2: so that he punished Moses for their sakes;

verses.part1: Because they provoked his spirit
verses.part2: so that he spake unadvisedly with his lips.

verses.part1: Neither destroyed they the heathen
verses.part2: as the Lord commanded them;

verses.part1: But were mingled among the heathen
verses.part2: and learned their works.

verses.part1: Insomuch that they worshipped their idols, which turned to their own decay
verses.part2: yea, they offered their sons and their daughters unto devils;

verses.part1: And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters
verses.part2: whom they offered unto the idols of Canaan; and the land was defiled with blood.

verses.part1: Thus were they stained with their own works
verses.part2: and went a whoring with their own inventions.

verses.part1: Therefore was the wrath of the Lord kindled against his people
verses.part2: insomuch that he abhorred his own inheritance.

verses.part1: And he gave them over into the hands of the heathen
verses.part2: and they that hated them were lords over them.

verses.part1: Their enemies oppressed them
verses.part2: and had them in subjection.

verses.part1: Many a time did he deliver them
verses.part2: but they rebelled against him with their own inventions, and were brought down in their wickedness.

verses.part1: Nevertheless, when he saw their adversity
verses.part2: he heard their complaint.

verses.part1: He thought upon his covenant, and pitied them according unto the multitude of his mercies
verses.part2: yea, he made all those that led them away captive to pity them.

verses.part1: Deliver us, O Lord our God, and gather us from among the heathen
verses.part2: that we may give thanks unto thy holy Name, and make our boast of thy praise.

verses.part1: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel from everlasting and world without end
verses.part2: and let all the people say, Amen.

verses.part1: O GIVE thanks unto the Lord, for he is gracious
verses.part2: and his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.part1: Let them give thanks whom the Lord hath redeemed
verses.part2: and delivered from the hand of the enemy;

verses.part1: And gathered them out of the lands, from the east and from the west
verses.part2: from the north and from the south.

verses.part1: They went astray in the wilderness out of the way
verses.part2: and found no city to dwell in;

verses.part1: Hungry and thirsty
verses.part2: their soul fainted in them.

verses.part1: So they cried unto the Lord in their trouble
verses.part2: and he delivered them from their distress.

verses.part1: He led them forth by the right way
verses.part2: that they might go to the city where they dwelt.

verses.part1: O that men would therefore praise the Lord for his goodness
verses.part2: and declare the wonders that he doeth for the children of men!

verses.part1: For he satisfieth the empty soul
verses.part2: and filleth the hungry soul with goodness.

verses.part1: Such as sit in darkness, and in the shadow of death
verses.part2: being fast bound in misery and iron;

verses.part1: Because they rebelled against the words of the Lord
verses.part2: and lightly regarded the counsel of the most Highest;

verses.part1: He also brought down their heart through heaviness
verses.part2: they fell down, and there was none to help them.

verses.part1: So when they cried unto the Lord in their trouble
verses.part2: he delivered them out of their distress.

verses.part1: For he brought them out of darkness, and out of the shadow of death
verses.part2: and brake their bonds in sunder.

verses.part1: O that men would therefore praise the Lord for his goodness
verses.part2: and declare the wonders that he doeth for the children of men!

verses.part1: For he hath broken the gates of brass
verses.part2: and smitten the bars of iron in sunder.

verses.part1: Foolish men are plagued for their offence
verses.part2: and because of their wickedness.

verses.part1: Their soul abhorred all manner of meat
verses.part2: and they were even hard at death's door.

verses.part1: So when they cried unto the Lord in their trouble
verses.part2: he delivered them out of their distress.

verses.part1: He sent his word, and healed them
verses.part2: and they were saved from their destruction.

verses.part1: O that men would therefore praise the Lord for his goodness
verses.part2: and declare the wonders that he doeth for the children of men!

verses.part1: That they would offer unto him the sacrifice of thanksgiving
verses.part2: and tell out his works with gladness!

verses.part1: They that go down to the sea in ships
verses.part2: and occupy their business in great waters;

verses.part1: These men see the works of the Lord
verses.part2: and his wonders in the deep.

verses.part1: For at his word the stormy wind ariseth
verses.part2: which lifteth up the waves thereof.

verses.part1: They are carried up to the heaven, and down again to the deep
verses.part2: their soul melteth away because of the trouble.

verses.part1: They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man
verses.part2: and are at their wits' end.

verses.part1: So when they cry unto the Lord in their trouble
verses.part2: he delivereth them out of their distress.

verses.part1: For he maketh the storm to cease
verses.part2: so that the waves thereof are still.

verses.part1: Then are they glad, because they are at rest
verses.part2: and so he bringeth them unto the haven where they would be.

verses.part1: O that men would therefore praise the Lord for his goodness
verses.part2: and declare the wonders that he doeth for the children of men!

verses.part1: That they would exalt him also in the congregation of the people
verses.part2: and praise him in the seat of the elders!

verses.part1: Who turneth the floods into a wilderness
verses.part2: and drieth up the water-springs.

verses.part1: A fruitful land maketh he barren
verses.part2: for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.

verses.part1: Again, he maketh the wilderness a standing water
verses.part2: and water-springs of a dry ground.

verses.part1: And there he setteth the hungry
verses.part2: that they may build them a city to dwell in;

verses.part1: That they may sow their land, and plant vineyards
verses.part2: to yield them fruits of increase.

verses.part1: He blesseth them so that they multiply exceedingly
verses.part2: and suffereth not their cattle to decrease.

verses.part1: And again, when they are minished and brought low
verses.part2: through oppression, through any plague or trouble;

verses.part1: Though he suffer them to be evil intreated through tyrants
verses.part2: and let them wander out of the way in the wilderness;

verses.part1: Yet helpeth he the poor out of misery
verses.part2: and maketh him households like a flock of sheep.

verses.part1: The righteous will consider this, and rejoice
verses.part2: and the mouth of all wickedness shall be stopped.

verses.part1: Whoso is wise will ponder these things
verses.part2: and they shall understand the loving-kindness of the Lord.

verses.part1: O GOD, my heart is ready, my heart is ready
verses.part2: I will sing and give praise with the best member that I have.

verses.part1: Awake, thou lute, and harp
verses.part2: I myself will awake right early.

verses.part1: I will give thanks unto thee, O Lord, among the people
verses.part2: I will sing praises unto thee among the nations.

verses.part1: For thy mercy is greater than the heavens
verses.part2: and thy truth reacheth unto the clouds.

verses.part1: Set up thyself, O God, above the heavens
verses.part2: and thy glory above all the earth.

verses.part1: That thy beloved may be delivered
verses.part2: let thy right hand save them, and hear thou me.

verses.part1: God hath spoken in his holiness
verses.part2: I will rejoice therefore, and divide Sichem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.

verses.part1: Gilead is mine, and Manasses is mine
verses.part2: Ephraim also is the strength of my head.

verses.part1: Judah is my law-giver, Moab is my wash-pot
verses.part2: over Edom will I cast out my shoe, upon Philistia will I triumph.

verses.part1: Who will lead me into the strong city
verses.part2: and who will bring me into Edom?

verses.part1: Hast not thou forsaken us, O God
verses.part2: and wilt not thou, O God, go forth with our hosts?

verses.part1: O help us against the enemy
verses.part2: for vain is the help of man.

verses.part1: Through God we shall do great acts
verses.part2: and it is he that shall tread down our enemies.

verses.part1: HOLD not thy tongue, O God of my praise
verses.part2: for the mouth of the ungodly, yea, the mouth of the deceitful is opened upon me.

verses.part1: And they have spoken against me with false tongues
verses.part2: they compassed me about also with words of hatred, and fought against me without a cause.

verses.part1: For the love that I had unto them, lo, they take now my contrary part
verses.part2: but I give myself unto prayer.

verses.part1: Thus have they rewarded me evil for good
verses.part2: and hatred for my good will.

verses.part1: Set thou an ungodly man to be ruler over him
verses.part2: and let Satan stand at his right hand.

verses.part1: When sentence is given upon him, let him be condemned
verses.part2: and let his prayer be turned into sin.

verses.part1: Let his days be few
verses.part2: and let another take his office.

verses.part1: Let his children be fatherless
verses.part2: and his wife a widow.

verses.part1: Let his children be vagabonds, and beg their bread
verses.part2: let them seek it also out of desolate places.

verses.part1: Let the extortioner consume all that he hath
verses.part2: and let the stranger spoil his labour.

verses.part1: Let there be no man to pity him
verses.part2: nor to have compassion upon his fatherless children.

verses.part1: Let his posterity be destroyed
verses.part2: and in the next generation let his name be clean put out.

verses.part1: Let the wickedness of his fathers be had in remembrance in the sight of the Lord
verses.part2: and let not the sin of his mother be done away.

verses.part1: Let them alway be before the Lord
verses.part2: that he may root out the memorial of them from off the earth.

verses.part1: And that, because his mind was not to do good
verses.part2: but persecuted the poor helpless man, that he might slay him that was vexed at the heart.

verses.part1: His delight was in cursing, and it shall happen unto him
verses.part2: he loved not blessing, therefore shall it be far from him.

verses.part1: He clothed himself with cursing, like as with a raiment
verses.part2: and it shall come into his bowels like water, and like oil into his bones.

verses.part1: Let it be unto him as the cloke that he hath upon him
verses.part2: and as the girdle that he is alway girded withal.

verses.part1: Let it thus happen from the Lord unto mine enemies
verses.part2: and to those that speak evil against my soul.

verses.part1: But deal thou with me, O Lord God, according unto thy Name
verses.part2: for sweet is thy mercy.

verses.part1: O deliver me, for I am helpless and poor
verses.part2: and my heart is wounded within me.

verses.part1: I go hence like the shadow that departeth
verses.part2: and am driven away as the grasshopper.

verses.part1: My knees are weak through fasting
verses.part2: my flesh is dried up for want of fatness.

verses.part1: I became also a reproach unto them
verses.part2: they that looked upon me shaked their heads.

verses.part1: Help me, O Lord my God
verses.part2: O save me according to thy mercy.

verses.part1: And they shall know, how that this is thy hand
verses.part2: and that thou, Lord, hast done it.

verses.part1: Though they curse, yet bless thou
verses.part2: and let them be confounded that rise up against me; but let thy servant rejoice.

verses.part1: Let mine adversaries be clothed with shame
verses.part2: and let them cover themselves with their own confusion, as with a cloke.

verses.part1: As for me, I will give great thanks unto the Lord with my mouth
verses.part2: and praise him among the multitude.

verses.part1: For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor
verses.part2: to save his soul from unrighteous judges.

verses.part1: THE Lord said unto my Lord
verses.part2: Sit thou on my right hand, until I make thine enemies thy footstool.

verses.part1: The Lord shall send the rod of thy power out of Sion
verses.part2: be thou ruler, even in the midst among thine enemies.

verses.part1: In the day of thy power shall the people offer thee free-will offerings with an holy worship
verses.part2: the dew of thy birth is of the womb of the morning.

verses.part1: The Lord sware, and will not repent
verses.part2: Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedech.

verses.part1: The Lord upon thy right hand
verses.part2: shall wound even kings in the day of his wrath.

verses.part1: He shall judge among the heathen; he shall fill the places with the dead bodies
verses.part2: and smite in sunder the heads over divers countries.

verses.part1: He shall drink of the brook in the way
verses.part2: therefore shall he lift up his head.

verses.part1: I WILL give thanks unto the Lord with my whole heart
verses.part2: secretly among the faithful, and in the congregation.

verses.part1: The works of the Lord are great
verses.part2: sought out of all them that have pleasure therein.

verses.part1: His work is worthy to be praised and had in honour
verses.part2: and his righteousness endureth for ever.

verses.part1: The merciful and gracious Lord hath so done his marvellous works
verses.part2: that they ought to be had in remembrance.

verses.part1: He hath given meat unto them that fear him
verses.part2: he shall ever be mindful of his covenant.

verses.part1: He hath shewed his people the power of his works
verses.part2: that he may give them the heritage of the heathen.

verses.part1: The works of his hands are verity and judgement
verses.part2: all his commandments are true.

verses.part1: They stand fast for ever and ever
verses.part2: and are done in truth and equity.

verses.part1: He sent redemption unto his people
verses.part2: he hath commanded his covenant for ever; holy and reverend is his Name.

verses.part1: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom
verses.part2: a good understanding have all they that do thereafter; the praise of it endureth for ever.

verses.part1: BLESSED is the man that feareth the Lord
verses.part2: he hath great delight in his commandments.

verses.part1: His seed shall be mighty upon earth
verses.part2: the generation of the faithful shall be blessed.

verses.part1: Riches and plenteousness shall be in his house
verses.part2: and his righteousness endureth for ever.

verses.part1: Unto the godly there ariseth up light in the darkness
verses.part2: he is merciful, loving, and righteous.

verses.part1: A good man is merciful, and lendeth
verses.part2: and will guide his words with discretion.

verses.part1: For he shall never be moved
verses.part2: and the righteous shall be had in everlasting remembrance.

verses.part1: He will not be afraid of any evil tidings
verses.part2: for his heart standeth fast, and believeth in the Lord.

verses.part1: His heart is established, and will not shrink
verses.part2: until he see his desire upon his enemies.

verses.part1: He hath dispersed abroad, and given to the poor
verses.part2: and his righteousness remaineth for ever; his horn shall be exalted with honour.

verses.part1: The ungodly shall see it, and it shall grieve him
verses.part2: he shall gnash with his teeth, and consume away; the desire of the ungodly shall perish.

verses.part1: PRAISE the Lord, ye servants
verses.part2: O praise the Name of the Lord.

verses.part1: Blessed be the Name of the Lord
verses.part2: from this time forth for evermore.

verses.part1: The Lord's Name is praised
verses.part2: from the rising up of the sun unto the going down of the same.

verses.part1: The Lord is high above all heathen
verses.part2: and his glory above the heavens.

verses.part1: Who is like unto the Lord our God, that hath his dwelling so high
verses.part2: and yet humbleth himself to behold the things that are in heaven and earth?

verses.part1: He taketh up the simple out of the dust
verses.part2: and lifteth the poor out of the mire;

verses.part1: That he may set him with the princes
verses.part2: even with the princes of his people.

verses.part1: He maketh the barren woman to keep house
verses.part2: and to be a joyful mother of children.

verses.part1: WHEN Israel came out of Egypt
verses.part2: and the house of Jacob from among the strange people,

verses.part1: Judah was his sanctuary
verses.part2: and Israel his dominion.

verses.part1: The sea saw that, and fled
verses.part2: Jordan was driven back.

verses.part1: The mountains skipped like rams
verses.part2: and the little hills like young sheep.

verses.part1: What aileth thee, O thou sea, that thou fleddest
verses.part2: and thou Jordan, that thou wast driven back?

verses.part1: Ye mountains, that ye skipped like rams
verses.part2: and ye little hills, like young sheep?

verses.part1: Tremble, thou earth, at the presence of the Lord
verses.part2: at the presence of the God of Jacob;

verses.part1: NOT unto us, O Lord, not unto us, but unto thy Name give the praise
verses.part2: for thy loving mercy and for thy truth's sake.

verses.part1: Wherefore shall the heathen say
verses.part2: Where is now their God?

verses.part1: As for our God, he is in heaven
verses.part2: he hath done whatsoever pleased him.

verses.part1: Their idols are silver and gold
verses.part2: even the work of men's hands.

verses.part1: They have mouths, and speak not
verses.part2: eyes have they, and see not.

verses.part1: They have ears, and hear not
verses.part2: noses have they, and smell not.

verses.part1: They have hands, and handle not; feet have they, and walk not
verses.part2: neither speak they through their throat.

verses.part1: They that make them are like unto them
verses.part2: and so are all such as put their trust in them.

verses.part1: But thou, house of Israel, trust thou in the Lord
