verses.part2: he is their succour and defence.

verses.part1: Ye house of Aaron, put your trust in the Lord
verses.part2: he is their helper and defender.

verses.part1: Ye that fear the Lord, put your trust in the Lord
verses.part2: he is their helper and defender.

verses.part1: The Lord hath been mindful of us, and he shall bless us
verses.part2: even he shall bless the house of Israel, he shall bless the house of Aaron.

verses.part1: He shall bless them that fear the Lord
verses.part2: both small and great.

verses.part1: The Lord shall increase you more and more
verses.part2: you and your children.

verses.part1: Ye are the blessed of the Lord
verses.part2: who made heaven and earth.

verses.part1: All the whole heavens are the Lord's
verses.part2: the earth hath he given to the children of men.

verses.part1: The dead praise not thee, O Lord
verses.part2: neither all they that go down into silence.

verses.part1: But we will praise the Lord
verses.part2: from this time forth for evermore. Praise the Lord.

verses.part1: I AM well pleased
verses.part2: that the Lord hath heard the voice of my prayer;

verses.part1: That he hath inclined his ear unto me
verses.part2: therefore will I call upon him as long as I live.

verses.part1: The snares of death compassed me round about
verses.part2: and the pains of hell gat hold upon me.

verses.part1: I shall find trouble and heaviness, and I will call upon the Name of the Lord
verses.part2: O Lord, I beseech thee, deliver my soul.

verses.part1: Gracious is the Lord, and righteous
verses.part2: yea, our God is merciful.

verses.part1: The Lord preserveth the simple
verses.part2: I was in misery, and he helped me.

verses.part1: Turn again then unto thy rest, O my soul
verses.part2: for the Lord hath rewarded thee.

verses.part1: And why? thou hast delivered my soul from death
verses.part2: mine eyes from tears, and my feet from falling.

verses.part1: I will walk before the Lord
verses.part2: in the land of the living.

verses.part1: I believed, and therefore will I speak; but I was sore troubled
verses.part2: I said in my haste, All men are liars.

verses.part1: What reward shall I give unto the Lord
verses.part2: for all the benefits that he hath done unto me?

verses.part1: I will receive the cup of salvation
verses.part2: and call upon the Name of the Lord.

verses.part1: I will pay my vows now in the presence of all his people
verses.part2: right dear in the sight of the Lord is the death of his saints.

verses.part1: Behold, O Lord, how that I am thy servant
verses.part2: I am thy servant, and the son of thine handmaid; thou hast broken my bonds in sunder.

verses.part1: I will offer to thee the sacrifice of thanksgiving
verses.part2: and will call upon the Name of the Lord.

verses.part1: I will pay my vows unto the Lord, in the sight of all his people
verses.part2: in the courts of the Lord's house, even in the midst of thee, O Jerusalem. Praise the Lord.

verses.part1: O PRAISE the Lord, all ye heathen
verses.part2: praise him, all ye nations.

verses.part1: For his merciful kindness is ever more and more towards us
verses.part2: and the truth of the Lord endureth for ever. Praise the Lord.

verses.part1: O GIVE thanks unto the Lord, for he is gracious
verses.part2: because his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.part1: Let Israel now confess that he is gracious
verses.part2: and that his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.part1: Let the house of Aaron now confess
verses.part2: that his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.part1: Yea, let them now that fear the Lord confess
verses.part2: that his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.part1: I called upon the Lord in trouble
verses.part2: and the Lord heard me at large.

verses.part1: The Lord is on my side
verses.part2: I will not fear what man doeth unto me.

verses.part1: The Lord taketh my part with them that help me
verses.part2: therefore shall I see my desire upon mine enemies.

verses.part1: It is better to trust in the Lord
verses.part2: than to put any confidence in man.

verses.part1: It is better to trust in the Lord
verses.part2: than to put any confidence in princes.

verses.part1: All nations compassed me round about
verses.part2: but in the Name of the Lord will I destroy them.

verses.part1: They kept me in on every side, they kept me in, I say, on every side
verses.part2: but in the Name of the Lord will I destroy them.

verses.part1: They came about me like bees, and are extinct even as the fire among the thorns
verses.part2: for in the Name of the Lord I will destroy them.

verses.part1: Thou hast thrust sore at me, that I might fall
verses.part2: but the Lord was my help.

verses.part1: The Lord is my strength, and my song
verses.part2: and is become my salvation.

verses.part1: The voice of joy and health is in the dwellings of the righteous
verses.part2: the right hand of the Lord bringeth mighty things to pass.

verses.part1: The right hand of the Lord hath the pre-eminence
verses.part2: the right hand of the Lord bringeth mighty things to pass.

verses.part1: I shall not die, but live
verses.part2: and declare the works of the Lord.

verses.part1: The Lord hath chastened and corrected me
verses.part2: but he hath not given me over unto death.

verses.part1: Open me the gates of righteousness
verses.part2: that I may go into them, and give thanks unto the Lord.

verses.part1: This is the gate of the Lord
verses.part2: the righteous shall enter into it.

verses.part1: I will thank thee, for thou hast heard me
verses.part2: and art become my salvation.

verses.part1: The same stone which the builders refused
verses.part2: is become the head-stone in the corner.

verses.part1: This is the Lord's doing
verses.part2: and it is marvellous in our eyes.

verses.part1: This is the day which the Lord hath made
verses.part2: we will rejoice and be glad in it.

verses.part1: Help me now, O Lord
verses.part2: O Lord, send us now prosperity.

verses.part1: Blessed be he that cometh in the Name of the Lord
verses.part2: we have wished you good luck, ye that are of the house of the Lord.

verses.part1: God is the Lord who hath shewed us light
verses.part2: bind the sacrifice with cords, yea, even unto the horns of the altar.

verses.part1: Thou art my God, and I will thank thee
verses.part2: thou art my God, and I will praise thee.

verses.part1: O give thanks unto the Lord, for he is gracious
verses.part2: and his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.part1: BLESSED are those that are undefiled in the way
verses.part2: and walk in the law of the Lord.

verses.part1: Blessed are they that keep his testimonies
verses.part2: and seek him with their whole heart.

verses.part1: For they who do no wickedness
verses.part2: walk in his ways.

verses.part1: Thou hast charged
verses.part2: that we shall diligently keep thy commandments.

verses.part1: O that my ways were made so direct
verses.part2: that I might keep thy statutes!

verses.part1: So shall I not be confounded
verses.part2: while I have respect unto all thy commandments.

verses.part1: I will thank thee with an unfeigned heart
verses.part2: when I shall have learned the judgements of thy righteousness.

verses.part1: I will keep thy ceremonies
verses.part2: O forsake me not utterly.

verses.part1: WHEREWITHAL shall a young man cleanse his way
verses.part2: even by ruling himself after thy word.

verses.part1: With my whole heart have I sought thee
verses.part2: O let me not go wrong out of thy commandments.

verses.part1: Thy words have I hid within my heart
verses.part2: that I should not sin against thee.

verses.part1: Blessed art thou, O Lord
verses.part2: O teach me thy statutes.

verses.part1: With my lips have I been telling
verses.part2: of all the judgements of thy mouth.

verses.part1: I have had as great delight in the way of thy testimonies
verses.part2: as in all manner of riches.

verses.part1: I will talk of thy commandments
verses.part2: and have respect unto thy ways.

verses.part1: My delight shall be in thy statutes
verses.part2: and I will not forget thy word.

verses.part1: O DO well unto thy servant
verses.part2: that I may live, and keep thy word.

verses.part1: Open thou mine eyes
verses.part2: that I may see the wondrous things of thy law.

verses.part1: I am a stranger upon earth
verses.part2: O hide not thy commandments from me.

verses.part1: My soul breaketh out for the very fervent desire
verses.part2: that it hath alway unto thy judgements.

verses.part1: Thou hast rebuked the proud
verses.part2: and cursed are they that do err from thy commandments.

verses.part1: O turn from me shame and rebuke
verses.part2: for I have kept thy testimonies.

verses.part1: Princes also did sit and speak against me
verses.part2: but thy servant is occupied in thy statutes.

verses.part1: For thy testimonies are my delight
verses.part2: and my counsellors.

verses.part1: MY soul cleaveth to the dust
verses.part2: O quicken thou me, according to thy word.

verses.part1: I have acknowledged my ways, and thou heardest me
verses.part2: O teach me thy statutes.

verses.part1: Make me to understand the way of thy commandments
verses.part2: and so shall I talk of thy wondrous works.

verses.part1: My soul melteth away for very heaviness
verses.part2: comfort thou me according unto thy word.

verses.part1: Take from me the way of lying
verses.part2: and cause thou me to make much of thy law.

verses.part1: I have chosen the way of truth
verses.part2: and thy judgements have I laid before me.

verses.part1: I have stuck unto thy testimonies
verses.part2: O Lord, confound me not.

verses.part1: I will run the way of thy commandments
verses.part2: when thou hast set my heart at liberty.

verses.part1: TEACH me, O Lord, the way of thy statutes
verses.part2: and I shall keep it unto the end.

verses.part1: Give me understanding, and I shall keep thy law
verses.part2: yea, I shall keep it with my whole heart.

verses.part1: Make me to go in the path of thy commandments
verses.part2: for therein is my desire.

verses.part1: Incline my heart unto thy testimonies
verses.part2: and not to covetousness.

verses.part1: O turn away mine eyes, lest they behold vanity
verses.part2: and quicken thou me in thy way.

verses.part1: O stablish thy word in thy servant
verses.part2: that I may fear thee.

verses.part1: Take away the rebuke that I am afraid of
verses.part2: for thy judgements are good.

verses.part1: Behold, my delight is in thy commandments
verses.part2: O quicken me in thy righteousness.

verses.part1: LET thy loving mercy come also unto me, O  Lord
verses.part2: even thy salvation, according unto thy word.

verses.part1: So shall I make answer unto my blasphemers
verses.part2: for my trust is in thy word.

verses.part1: O take not the word of thy truth utterly out of my mouth
verses.part2: for my hope is in thy judgements.

verses.part1: So shall I alway keep thy law
verses.part2: yea, for ever and ever.

verses.part1: And I will walk at liberty
verses.part2: for I seek thy commandments.

verses.part1: I will speak of thy testimonies also, even before kings
verses.part2: and will not be ashamed.

verses.part1: And my delight shall be in thy commandments
verses.part2: which I have loved.

verses.part1: My hands also will I lift up unto thy commandments, which I have loved
verses.part2: and my study shall be in thy statutes.

verses.part1: O THINK upon thy servant, as concerning thy word
verses.part2: wherein thou hast caused me to put my trust.

verses.part1: The same is my comfort in my trouble
verses.part2: for thy word hath quickened me.

verses.part1: The proud have had me exceedingly in derision
verses.part2: yet have I not shrinked from thy law.

verses.part1: For I remembered thine everlasting judgements, O Lord
verses.part2: and received comfort.

verses.part1: I am horribly afraid
verses.part2: for the ungodly that forsake thy law.

verses.part1: Thy statutes have been my songs
verses.part2: in the house of my pilgrimage.

verses.part1: I have thought upon thy Name, O Lord, in the night-season
verses.part2: and have kept thy law.

verses.part1: This I had
verses.part2: because I kept thy commandments.

verses.part1: THOU art my portion, O Lord
verses.part2: I have promised to keep thy law.

verses.part1: I made my humble petition in thy presence with my whole heart
verses.part2: O be merciful unto me, according to thy word.

verses.part1: I called mine own ways to remembrance
verses.part2: and turned my feet unto thy testimonies.

verses.part1: I made haste, and prolonged not the time
verses.part2: to keep thy commandments.

verses.part1: The congregations of the ungodly have robbed me
verses.part2: but I have not forgotten thy law.

verses.part1: At midnight I will rise to give thanks unto thee
verses.part2: because of thy righteous judgements.

verses.part1: I am a companion of all them that fear thee
verses.part2: and keep thy commandments.

verses.part1: The earth, O Lord, is full of thy mercy
verses.part2: O teach me thy statutes.

verses.part1: O LORD thou hast dealt graciously with thy servant
verses.part2: according unto thy word.

verses.part1: O learn me true understanding and knowledge
verses.part2: for I have believed thy commandments.

verses.part1: Before I was troubled, I went wrong
verses.part2: but now have I kept thy word.

verses.part1: Thou art good and gracious
verses.part2: O teach me thy statutes.

verses.part1: The proud have imagined a lie against me
verses.part2: but I will keep thy commandments with my whole heart.

verses.part1: Their heart is as fat as brawn
verses.part2: but my delight hath been in thy law.

verses.part1: It is good for me that I have been in trouble
verses.part2: that I may learn thy statutes.

verses.part1: The law of thy mouth is dearer unto me
verses.part2: than thousands of gold and silver.

verses.part1: THY hands have made me and fashioned me
verses.part2: O give me understanding, that I may learn thy commandments.

verses.part1: They that fear thee will be glad when they see me
verses.part2: because I have put my trust in thy word.

verses.part1: I know, O Lord, that thy judgements are right
verses.part2: and that thou of very faithfulness hast caused me to be troubled.

verses.part1: O let thy merciful kindness be my comfort
verses.part2: according to thy word unto thy servant.

verses.part1: O let thy loving mercies come unto me, that I may live
verses.part2: for thy law is my delight.

verses.part1: Let the proud be confounded, for they go wickedly about to destroy me
verses.part2: but I will be occupied in thy commandments.

verses.part1: Let such as fear thee, and have known thy testimonies
verses.part2: be turned unto me.

verses.part1: O let my heart be sound in thy statutes
verses.part2: that I be not ashamed.

verses.part1: MY soul hath longed for thy salvation
verses.part2: and I have a good hope because of thy word.

verses.part1: Mine eyes long sore for thy word
verses.part2: saying, O when wilt thou comfort me?

verses.part1: For I am become like a bottle in the smoke
verses.part2: yet do I not forget thy statutes.

verses.part1: How many are the days of thy servant
verses.part2: when wilt thou be avenged of them that persecute me?

verses.part1: The proud have digged pits for me
verses.part2: which are not after thy law.

verses.part1: All thy commandments are true
verses.part2: they persecute me falsely; O be thou my help.

verses.part1: They had almost made an end of me upon earth
verses.part2: but I forsook not thy commandments.

verses.part1: O quicken me after thy loving-kindness
verses.part2: and so shall I keep the testimonies of thy mouth.

verses.part1: O LORD, thy word
verses.part2: endureth for ever in heaven.

verses.part1: Thy truth also remaineth from one generation to another
verses.part2: thou hast laid the foundation of the earth, and it abideth.

verses.part1: They continue this day according to thine ordinance
verses.part2: for all things serve thee.

verses.part1: If my delight had not been in thy law
verses.part2: I should have perished in my trouble.

verses.part1: I will never forget thy commandments
verses.part2: for with them thou hast quickened me.

verses.part1: I am thine, O save me
verses.part2: for I have sought thy commandments.

verses.part1: The ungodly laid wait for me to destroy me
verses.part2: but I will consider thy testimonies.

verses.part1: I see that all things come to an end
verses.part2: but thy commandment is exceeding broad.

verses.part1: LORD, what love have I unto thy law
verses.part2: all the day long is my study in it.

verses.part1: Thou through thy commandments hast made me wiser than mine enemies
verses.part2: for they are ever with me.

verses.part1: I have more understanding than my teachers
verses.part2: for thy testimonies are my study.

verses.part1: I am wiser than the aged
verses.part2: because I keep thy commandments.

verses.part1: I have refrained my feet from every evil way
verses.part2: that I may keep thy word.

verses.part1: I have not shrunk from thy judgements
verses.part2: for thou teachest me.

verses.part1: O how sweet are thy words unto my throat
verses.part2: yea, sweeter than honey unto my mouth.

verses.part1: Through thy commandments I get understanding
verses.part2: therefore I hate all evil ways.

verses.part1: THY word is a lantern unto my feet
verses.part2: and a light unto my paths.

verses.part1: I have sworn, and am stedfastly purposed
verses.part2: to keep thy righteous judgements.

verses.part1: I am troubled above measure
verses.part2: quicken me, O Lord, according to thy word.

verses.part1: Let the free-will offerings of my mouth please thee, O Lord
verses.part2: and teach me thy judgements.

verses.part1: My soul is alway in my hand
verses.part2: yet do I not forget thy law.

verses.part1: The ungodly have laid a snare for me
verses.part2: but yet I swerved not from thy commandments.

verses.part1: Thy testimonies have I claimed as mine heritage for ever
verses.part2: and why? they are the very joy of my heart.

verses.part1: I have applied my heart to fulfil thy statutes alway
verses.part2: even unto the end.

verses.part1: I HATE them that imagine evil things
verses.part2: but thy law do I love.

verses.part1: Thou art my defence and shield
verses.part2: and my trust is in thy word.

verses.part1: Away from me, ye wicked
verses.part2: I will keep the commandments of my God.

verses.part1: O stablish me according to thy word, that I may live
verses.part2: and let me not be disappointed of my hope.

verses.part1: Hold thou me up, and I shall be safe
verses.part2: yea, my delight shall be ever in thy statutes.

verses.part1: Thou hast trodden down all them that depart from thy statutes
verses.part2: for they imagine but deceit.

verses.part1: Thou puttest away all the ungodly of the earth like dross
verses.part2: therefore I love thy testimonies.

verses.part1: My flesh trembleth for fear of thee
verses.part2: and I am afraid of thy judgements.

verses.part1: I DEAL with the thing that is lawful and right
verses.part2: O give me not over unto mine oppressors.

verses.part1: Make thou thy servant to delight in that which is good
verses.part2: that the proud do me no wrong.

verses.part1: Mine eyes are wasted away with looking for thy health
verses.part2: and for the word of thy righteousness.

verses.part1: O deal with thy servant according unto thy loving mercy
verses.part2: and teach me thy statutes.

verses.part1: I am thy servant, O grant me understanding
verses.part2: that I may know thy testimonies.

verses.part1: It is time for thee, Lord, to lay to thine hand
verses.part2: for they have destroyed thy law.

verses.part1: For I love thy commandments
verses.part2: above gold and precious stone.

verses.part1: Therefore hold I straight all thy commandments
verses.part2: and all false ways I utterly abhor.

verses.part1: THY testimonies are wonderful
verses.part2: therefore doth my soul keep them.

verses.part1: When thy word goeth forth
verses.part2: it giveth light and understanding unto the simple.

verses.part1: I opened my mouth, and drew in my breath
verses.part2: for my delight was in thy commandments.

verses.part1: O look thou upon me, and be merciful unto me
verses.part2: as thou usest to do unto those that love thy Name.

verses.part1: Order my steps in thy word
verses.part2: and so shall no wickedness have dominion over me.

verses.part1: O deliver me from the wrongful dealings of men
verses.part2: and so shall I keep thy commandments.

verses.part1: Shew the light of thy countenance upon thy servant
verses.part2: and teach me thy statutes.

verses.part1: Mine eyes gush out with water
verses.part2: because men keep not thy law.

verses.part1: RIGHTEOUS art thou, O Lord
verses.part2: and true is thy judgement.

verses.part1: The testimonies that thou hast commanded
verses.part2: are exceeding righteous and true.

verses.part1: My zeal hath even consumed me
verses.part2: because mine enemies have forgotten thy words.

verses.part1: Thy word is tried to the uttermost
verses.part2: and thy servant loveth it.

verses.part1: I am small, and of no reputation
verses.part2: yet do I not forget thy commandments.

verses.part1: Thy righteousness is an everlasting righteousness
verses.part2: and thy law is the truth.

verses.part1: Trouble and heaviness have taken hold upon me
verses.part2: yet is my delight in thy commandments.

verses.part1: The righteousness of thy testimonies is everlasting
verses.part2: O grant me understanding, and I shall live.

verses.part1: I CALL with my whole heart
verses.part2: hear me, O Lord, I will keep thy statutes.

verses.part1: Yea, even unto thee do I call
verses.part2: help me, and I shall keep thy testimonies.

verses.part1: Early in the morning do I cry unto thee
verses.part2: for in thy word is my trust.

verses.part1: Mine eyes prevent the night-watches
verses.part2: that I might be occupied in thy words.

verses.part1: Hear my voice, O Lord, according unto thy loving-kindness
verses.part2: quicken me, according as thou art wont.

verses.part1: They draw nigh that of malice persecute me
verses.part2: and are far from thy law.

verses.part1: Be thou nigh at hand, O Lord
verses.part2: for all thy commandments are true.

verses.part1: As concerning thy testimonies, I have known long since
verses.part2: that thou hast grounded them for ever.

verses.part1: O CONSIDER mine adversity, and deliver me
verses.part2: for I do not forget thy law.

verses.part1: Avenge thou my cause, and deliver me
verses.part2: quicken me, according to thy word.

verses.part1: Health is far from the ungodly
verses.part2: for they regard not thy statutes.

verses.part1: Great is thy mercy, O Lord
verses.part2: quicken me, as thou art wont.

verses.part1: Many there are that trouble me, and persecute me
verses.part2: yet do I not swerve from thy testimonies.

verses.part1: It grieveth me when I see the transgressors
verses.part2: because they keep not thy law.

verses.part1: Consider, O Lord, how I love thy commandments
verses.part2: O quicken me, according to thy loving-kindness.

verses.part1: Thy word is true from everlasting
verses.part2: all the judgements of thy righteousness endure for evermore.

verses.part1: PRINCES have persecuted me without a cause
verses.part2: but my heart standeth in awe of thy word.

verses.part1: I am as glad of thy word
verses.part2: as one that findeth great spoils.

verses.part1: As for lies, I hate and abhor them
verses.part2: but thy law do I love.

verses.part1: Seven times a day do I praise thee
verses.part2: because of thy righteous judgements.

verses.part1: Great is the peace that they have who love thy law
verses.part2: and they are not offended at it.

verses.part1: Lord, I have looked for thy saving health
verses.part2: and done after thy commandments.

verses.part1: My soul hath kept thy testimonies
verses.part2: and loved them exceedingly.

verses.part1: I have kept thy commandments and testimonies
verses.part2: for all my ways are before thee.

verses.part1: LET my complaint come before thee, O Lord
verses.part2: give me understanding, according to thy word.

verses.part1: Let my supplication come before thee
verses.part2: deliver me, according to thy word.

verses.part1: My lips shall speak of thy praise
verses.part2: when thou hast taught me thy statutes.

verses.part1: Yea, my tongue shall sing of thy word
verses.part2: for all thy commandments are righteous.

verses.part1: Let thine hand help me
verses.part2: for I have chosen thy commandments.

verses.part1: I have longed for thy saving health, O Lord
verses.part2: and in thy law is my delight.

verses.part1: O let my soul live, and it shall praise thee
verses.part2: and thy judgements shall help me.

verses.part1: I have gone astray like a sheep that is lost
verses.part2: O seek thy servant, for I do not forget thy commandments.

verses.part1: WHEN I was in trouble I called upon the Lord
verses.part2: and he heard me.

verses.part1: Deliver my soul, O Lord, from lying lips
verses.part2: and from a deceitful tongue.

verses.part1: What reward shall be given or done unto thee, thou false tongue
verses.part2: even mighty and sharp arrows, with hot burning coals.

verses.part1: Woe is me, that I am constrained to dwell with Mesech
verses.part2: and to have my habitation among the tents of Kedar.

verses.part1: My soul hath long dwelt among them
verses.part2: that are enemies unto peace.

verses.part1: I labour for peace, but when I speak unto them thereof
verses.part2: they make them ready to battle.

verses.part1: I WILL lift up mine eyes unto the hills
verses.part2: from whence cometh my help.

verses.part1: My help cometh even from the Lord
verses.part2: who hath made heaven and earth.

verses.part1: He will not suffer thy foot to be moved
verses.part2: and he that keepeth thee will not sleep.

verses.part1: Behold, he that keepeth Israel
verses.part2: shall neither slumber nor sleep.

verses.part1: The Lord himself is thy keeper
verses.part2: the Lord is thy defence upon thy right hand;

verses.part1: So that the sun shall not burn thee by day
verses.part2: neither the moon by night.

verses.part1: The Lord shall preserve thee from all evil
verses.part2: yea, it is even he that shall keep thy soul.

verses.part1: The Lord shall preserve thy going out, and thy coming in
verses.part2: from this time forth for evermore.

verses.part1: I WAS glad when they said unto me
verses.part2: We will go into the house of the Lord.

verses.part1: Our feet shall stand in thy gates
verses.part2: O Jerusalem.

verses.part1: Jerusalem is built as a city
verses.part2: that is at unity in itself.

verses.part1: For thither the tribes go up, even the tribes of the Lord
verses.part2: to testify unto Israel, to give thanks unto the Name of the Lord.

verses.part1: For there is the seat of judgement
verses.part2: even the seat of the house of David.

verses.part1: O pray for the peace of Jerusalem
verses.part2: they shall prosper that love thee.

verses.part1: Peace be within thy walls
verses.part2: and plenteousness within thy palaces.

verses.part1: For my brethren and companions' sakes
verses.part2: I will wish thee prosperity.

verses.part1: Yea, because of the house of the Lord our God
verses.part2: I will seek to do thee good.

verses.part1: UNTO thee lift I up mine eyes
verses.part2: O thou that dwellest in the heavens.

verses.part1: Behold, even as the eyes of servants look unto the hand of their masters, and as the eyes of a maiden unto the hand of her mistress
verses.part2: even so our eyes wait upon the Lord our God, until he have mercy upon us.

verses.part1: Have mercy upon us, O Lord, have mercy upon us
verses.part2: for we are utterly despised.

verses.part1: Our soul is filled with the scornful reproof of the wealthy
verses.part2: and with the despitefulness of the proud.

verses.part1: IF the Lord himself had not been on our side, now may Israel say
verses.part2: if the Lord himself had not been on our side, when men rose up against us;

verses.part1: They had swallowed us up quick
verses.part2: when they were so wrathfully displeased at us.

verses.part1: Yea, the waters had drowned us
verses.part2: and the stream had gone over our soul.

verses.part1: The deep waters of the proud
verses.part2: had gone even over our soul.

verses.part1: But praised be the Lord
verses.part2: who hath not given us over for a prey unto their teeth.

verses.part1: Our soul is escaped even as a bird out of the snare of the fowler
verses.part2: the snare is broken, and we are delivered.

verses.part1: Our help standeth in the Name of the Lord
verses.part2: who hath made heaven and earth.

verses.part1: THEY that put their trust in the Lord shall be even as the mount Sion
verses.part2: which may not be removed, but standeth fast for ever.

verses.part1: The hills stand about Jerusalem
verses.part2: even so standeth the Lord round about his people, from this time forth for evermore.

verses.part1: For the rod of the ungodly cometh not into the lot of the righteous
verses.part2: lest the righteous put their hand unto wickedness.

verses.part1: Do well, O Lord
verses.part2: unto those that are good and true of heart.

verses.part1: As for such as turn back unto their own wickedness
verses.part2: the Lord shall lead them forth with the evil-doers; but peace shall be upon Israel.

verses.part1: WHEN the Lord turned again the captivity of Sion
verses.part2: then were we like unto them that dream.

verses.part1: Then was our mouth filled with laughter
verses.part2: and our tongue with joy.

verses.part1: Then said they among the heathen
verses.part2: The Lord hath done great things for them.

verses.part1: Yea, the Lord hath done great things for us already
verses.part2: whereof we rejoice.

verses.part1: Turn our captivity, O Lord
verses.part2: as the rivers in the south.

verses.part1: They that sow in tears
verses.part2: shall reap in joy.

verses.part1: He that now goeth on his way weeping, and beareth forth good seed
verses.part2: shall doubtless come again with joy, and bring his sheaves with him.

verses.part1: EXCEPT the Lord build the house
verses.part2: their labour is but lost that build it.

verses.part1: Except the Lord keep the city
verses.part2: the watchman waketh but in vain.

verses.part1: It is but lost labour that ye haste to rise up early, and so late take rest, and eat the bread of carefulness
verses.part2: for so he giveth his beloved sleep.

verses.part1: Lo, children and the fruit of the womb
verses.part2: are an heritage and gift that cometh of the Lord.

verses.part1: Like as the arrows in the hand of the giant
verses.part2: even so are the young children.

verses.part1: Happy is the man that hath his quiver full of them
verses.part2: they shall not be ashamed when they speak with their enemies in the gate.

verses.part1: BLESSED are all they that fear the Lord
verses.part2: and walk in his ways.

verses.part1: For thou shalt eat the labours of thine hands
verses.part2: O well is thee, and happy shalt thou be.

verses.part1: Thy wife shall be as the fruitful vine
verses.part2: upon the walls of thine house.

verses.part1: Thy children like the olive-branches
verses.part2: round about thy table.

verses.part1: Lo, thus shall the man be blessed
verses.part2: that feareth the Lord.

verses.part1: The Lord from out of Sion shall so bless thee
verses.part2: that thou shalt see Jerusalem in prosperity all thy life long.

verses.part1: Yea, that thou shalt see thy children's children
verses.part2: and peace upon Israel.

verses.part1: MANY a time have they fought against me from my youth up
verses.part2: may Israel now say.

verses.part1: Yea, many a time have they vexed me from my youth up
verses.part2: but they have not prevailed against me.

verses.part1: The plowers plowed upon my back
verses.part2: and made long furrows.

verses.part1: But the righteous Lord
verses.part2: hath hewn the snares of the ungodly in pieces.

verses.part1: Let them be confounded and turned backward
verses.part2: as many as have evil will at Sion.

verses.part1: Let them be even as the grass growing upon the house-tops
verses.part2: which withereth afore it be plucked up;

verses.part1: Whereof the mower filleth not his hand
verses.part2: neither he that bindeth up the sheaves his bosom.

verses.part1: So that they who go by say not so much as, The Lord prosper you
verses.part2: we wish you good luck in the Name of the Lord.

verses.part1: OUT of the deep have I called unto thee, O Lord
verses.part2: Lord, hear my voice.

verses.part1: O let thine ears consider well
verses.part2: the voice of my complaint.

verses.part1: If thou, Lord, wilt be extreme to mark what is done amiss
verses.part2: O Lord, who may abide it?

verses.part1: For there is mercy with thee
verses.part2: therefore shalt thou be feared.

verses.part1: I look for the Lord; my soul doth wait for him
verses.part2: in his word is my trust.

verses.part1: My soul fleeth unto the Lord
verses.part2: before the morning watch, I say, before the morning watch.

verses.part1: O Israel, trust in the Lord, for with the Lord there is mercy
verses.part2: and with him is plenteous redemption.

verses.part1: And he shall redeem Israel
verses.part2: from all his sins.

verses.part1: LORD, I am not high-minded
verses.part2: I have no proud  looks.

verses.part1: I do not exercise myself in great matters
verses.part2: which are too high for me.

verses.part1: But I refrain my soul, and keep it low, like as a child that is weaned from his mother
verses.part2: yea, my soul is even as a weaned child.

verses.part1: O Israel, trust in the Lord
verses.part2: from this time forth for evermore.

verses.part1: LORD, remember David
verses.part2: and all his trouble;

verses.part1: How he sware unto the Lord
verses.part2: and vowed a vow unto the Almighty God of Jacob;

verses.part1: I will not come within the tabernacle of mine house
verses.part2: nor climb up into my bed;

verses.part1: I will not suffer mine eyes to sleep, nor mine eye-lids to slumber
verses.part2: neither the temples of my head to take any rest;

verses.part1: Until I find out a place for the temple of the Lord
verses.part2: an habitation for the mighty God of Jacob.

verses.part1: Lo, we heard of the same at Ephrata
verses.part2: and found it in the wood.

verses.part1: We will go into his tabernacle
verses.part2: and fall low on our knees before his footstool.

verses.part1: Arise, O Lord, into thy resting-place
verses.part2: thou, and the ark of thy strength.

verses.part1: Let thy priests be clothed with righteousness
verses.part2: and let thy saints sing with joyfulness.

verses.part1: For thy servant David's sake
verses.part2: turn not away the presence of thine Anointed.

verses.part1: The Lord hath made a faithful oath unto David
verses.part2: and he shall not shrink from it;

verses.part1: Of the fruit of thy body
verses.part2: shall I set upon thy seat.

verses.part1: If thy children will keep my covenant, and my testimonies that I shall learn them
verses.part2: their children also shall sit upon thy seat for evermore.

verses.part1: For the Lord hath chosen Sion to be an habitation for himself
verses.part2: he hath longed for her.

verses.part1: This shall be my rest for ever
verses.part2: here will I dwell, for I have a delight therein.

verses.part1: I will bless her victuals with increase
verses.part2: and will satisfy her poor with bread.

verses.part1: I will deck her priests with health
verses.part2: and her saints shall rejoice and sing.

verses.part1: There shall I make the horn of David to flourish
verses.part2: I have ordained a lantern for mine Anointed.

verses.part1: As for his enemies, I shall clothe them with shame
verses.part2: but upon himself shall his crown flourish.

verses.part1: BEHOLD, how good and joyful a thing it is
verses.part2: brethren, to dwell together in unity!

verses.part1: It is like the precious ointment upon the head, that ran down unto the beard
verses.part2: even unto Aaron's beard, and went down to the skirts of his clothing.

verses.part1: Like as the dew of Hermon
verses.part2: which fell upon the hill of Sion.

verses.part1: For there the Lord promised his blessing
verses.part2: and life for evermore.

verses.part1: BEHOLD now, praise the Lord
verses.part2: all ye servants of the Lord;

verses.part1: Ye that by night stand in the house of the Lord
verses.part2: even in the courts of the house of our God.

verses.part1: Lift up your hands in the sanctuary
verses.part2: and praise the Lord.

verses.part1: The Lord that made heaven and earth
verses.part2: give thee blessing out of Sion.

verses.part1: O PRAISE the Lord, laud ye the Name of the Lord
verses.part2: praise it, O ye servants of the Lord;

verses.part1: Ye that stand in the house of the Lord
verses.part2: in the courts of the house of our God.

verses.part1: O praise the Lord, for the Lord is gracious
verses.part2: O sing praises unto his Name, for it is lovely.

verses.part1: For why? the Lord hath chosen Jacob unto himself
verses.part2: and Israel for his own possession.

verses.part1: For I know that the Lord is great
verses.part2: and that our Lord is above all gods.

verses.part1: Whatsoever the Lord pleased, that did he in heaven and in earth
verses.part2: and in the sea, and in all deep places.

verses.part1: He bringeth forth the clouds from the ends of the world
verses.part2: and sendeth forth lightnings with the rain, bringing the winds out of his treasures.

verses.part1: He smote the first-born of Egypt
verses.part2: both of man and beast.

verses.part1: He hath sent tokens and wonders into the midst of thee, O thou land of Egypt
verses.part2: upon Pharaoh, and all his servants.

verses.part1: He smote divers nations
verses.part2: and slew mighty kings;

verses.part1: Sehon king of the Amorites, and Og the king of Basan
verses.part2: and all the kingdoms of Canaan;

verses.part1: And gave their land to be an heritage
verses.part2: even an heritage unto Israel his people.

verses.part1: Thy Name, O Lord, endureth for ever
verses.part2: so doth thy memorial, O Lord, from one generation to another.

verses.part1: For the Lord will avenge his people
verses.part2: and be gracious unto his servants.

verses.part1: As for the images of the heathen, they are but silver and gold
verses.part2: the work of men's hands.

verses.part1: They have mouths, and speak not
verses.part2: eyes have they, but they see not.

verses.part1: They have ears, and yet they hear not
verses.part2: neither is there any breath in their mouths.

verses.part1: They that make them are like unto them
verses.part2: and so are all they that put their trust in them.

verses.part1: Praise the Lord, ye house of Israel
verses.part2: praise the Lord, ye house of Aaron.

verses.part1: Praise the Lord, ye house of Levi
verses.part2: ye that fear the Lord, praise the Lord.

verses.part1: Praised be the Lord out of Sion
verses.part2: who dwelleth at Jerusalem.

verses.part1: O GIVE thanks unto the Lord, for he is gracious
verses.part2: and his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.part1: O give thanks unto the God of all gods
verses.part2: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.part1: O thank the Lord of all lords
verses.part2: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.part1: Who only doeth great wonders
verses.part2: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.part1: Who by his excellent wisdom made the heavens
verses.part2: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.part1: Who laid out the earth above the waters
verses.part2: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.part1: Who hath made great lights
verses.part2: for his mercy endureth for ever;

verses.part1: The sun to rule the day
verses.part2: for his mercy endureth for ever;

verses.part1: The moon and the stars to govern the night
verses.part2: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.part1: Who smote Egypt with their first-born
verses.part2: for his mercy endureth for ever;

verses.part1: And brought out Israel from among them
verses.part2: for his mercy endureth for ever;

verses.part1: With a mighty hand, and stretched out arm
verses.part2: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.part1: Who divided the Red sea in two parts
verses.part2: for his mercy endureth for ever;

verses.part1: And made Israel to go through the midst of it
verses.part2: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.part1: But as for Pharaoh and his host, he overthrew them in the Red sea
verses.part2: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.part1: Who led his people through the wilderness
verses.part2: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.part1: Who smote great kings
verses.part2: for his mercy endureth for ever;

verses.part1: Yea, and slew mighty kings
verses.part2: for his mercy endureth for ever;

verses.part1: Sehon king of the Amorites
verses.part2: for his mercy endureth for ever;

verses.part1: And Og the king of Basan
verses.part2: for his mercy endureth for ever;

verses.part1: And gave away their land for an heritage
verses.part2: for his mercy endureth for ever;

verses.part1: Even for an heritage unto Israel his servant
verses.part2: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.part1: Who remembered us when we were in trouble
verses.part2: for his mercy endureth for ever;

verses.part1: And hath delivered us from our enemies
verses.part2: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.part1: Who giveth food to all flesh
verses.part2: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.part1: O give thanks unto the God of heaven
verses.part2: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.part1: O give thanks unto the Lord of lords
verses.part2: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.part1: BY the waters of Babylon we sat down and wept
verses.part2: when we remembered thee, O Sion.

verses.part1: As for our harps, we hanged them up
verses.part2: upon the trees that are therein.

verses.part1: For they that led us away captive required of us then a song, and melody in our heaviness
verses.part2: Sing us one of the songs of Sion.

verses.part1: How shall we sing the Lord's song
verses.part2: in a strange land?

verses.part1: If I forget thee, O Jerusalem
verses.part2: let my right hand forget her cunning.

verses.part1: If I do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth
verses.part2: yea, if I prefer not Jerusalem in my mirth.

verses.part1: Remember the children of Edom, O Lord, in the day of Jerusalem
verses.part2: how they said, Down with it, down with it, even to the ground.

verses.part1: O daughter of Babylon, wasted with misery
verses.part2: yea, happy shall he be that rewardeth thee, as thou hast served us.

verses.part1: Blessed shall he be that taketh thy children
verses.part2: and throweth them against the stones.

verses.part1: I WILL give thanks unto thee, O Lord, with my whole heart
verses.part2: even before the gods will I sing praise unto thee.

verses.part1: I will worship toward thy holy temple, and praise thy Name, because of thy loving-kindness and truth
verses.part2: for thou hast magnified thy Name and thy word above all things.

verses.part1: When I called upon thee, thou heardest me
verses.part2: and enduedst my soul with much strength.

verses.part1: All the kings of the earth shall praise thee, O Lord
verses.part2: for they have heard the words of thy mouth.

verses.part1: Yea, they shall sing in the ways of the Lord
verses.part2: that great is the glory of the Lord.

verses.part1: For though the Lord be high, yet hath he respect unto the lowly
verses.part2: as for the proud, he beholdeth them afar off.

verses.part1: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, yet shalt thou refresh me
verses.part2: thou shalt stretch forth thy hand upon the furiousness of mine enemies, and thy right hand shall save me.

verses.part1: The Lord shall make good his loving-kindness toward me
verses.part2: yea, thy mercy, O Lord, endureth for ever; despise not then the works of thine own hands.

verses.part1: O LORD, thou hast searched me out and known me
verses.part2: thou knowest my down-sitting and mine up-rising, thou understandest my thoughts long before.

verses.part1: Thou art about my path, and about my bed
verses.part2: and spiest out all my ways.

verses.part1: For lo, there is not a word in my tongue
verses.part2: but thou, O Lord, knowest it altogether.

verses.part1: Thou hast fashioned me behind and before
verses.part2: and laid thine hand upon me.

verses.part1: Such knowledge is too wonderful and excellent for me
verses.part2: I cannot attain unto it.

verses.part1: Whither shall I go then from thy Spirit
verses.part2: or whither shall I go then from thy presence?

verses.part1: If I climb up into heaven, thou art there
verses.part2: if I go down to hell, thou art there also.

verses.part1: If I take the wings of the morning
verses.part2: and remain in the uttermost parts of the sea;

verses.part1: Even there also shall thy hand lead me
verses.part2: and thy right hand shall hold me.

verses.part1: If I say, Peradventure the darkness shall cover me
verses.part2: then shall my night be turned to day.

verses.part1: Yea, the darkness is no darkness with thee, but the night is as clear as the day
verses.part2: the darkness and light to thee are both alike.

verses.part1: For my reins are thine
verses.part2: thou hast covered me in my mother's womb.

verses.part1: I will give thanks unto thee, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made
verses.part2: marvellous are thy works, and that my soul knoweth right well.

verses.part1: My bones are not hid from thee
verses.part2: though I be made secretly, and fashioned beneath in the earth.

verses.part1: Thine eyes did see my substance, yet being unperfect
verses.part2: and in thy book were all my members written;

verses.part1: Which day by day were fashioned
verses.part2: when as yet there was none of them.

verses.part1: How dear are thy counsels unto me, O God
verses.part2: O how great is the sum of them!

verses.part1: If I tell them, they are more in number than the sand
verses.part2: when I wake up I am present with thee.

verses.part1: Wilt thou not slay the wicked, O God
verses.part2: depart from me, ye blood-thirsty men.

verses.part1: For they speak unrighteously against thee
verses.part2: and thine enemies take thy Name in vain.

verses.part1: Do not I hate them, O Lord, that hate thee
verses.part2: and am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee?

verses.part1: Yea, I hate them right sore
verses.part2: even as though they were mine enemies.

verses.part1: Try me, O God, and seek the ground of my heart
verses.part2: prove me, and examine my thoughts.

verses.part1: Look well if there be any way of wickedness in me
verses.part2: and lead me in the way everlasting.

verses.part1: DELIVER me, O Lord, from the evil man
verses.part2: and preserve me from the wicked man.

verses.part1: Who imagine mischief in their hearts
verses.part2: and stir up strife all the day long.

verses.part1: They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent
verses.part2: adders' poison is under their lips.

verses.part1: Keep me, O Lord, from the hands of the ungodly
verses.part2: preserve me from the wicked men, who are purposed to overthrow my goings.

verses.part1: The proud have laid a snare for me, and spread a net abroad with cords
verses.part2: yea, and set traps in my way.

verses.part1: I said unto the Lord, Thou art my God
verses.part2: hear the voice of my prayers, O Lord.

verses.part1: O Lord God, thou strength of my health
verses.part2: thou hast covered my head in the day of battle.

verses.part1: Let not the ungodly have his desire, O Lord
verses.part2: let not his mischievous imagination prosper, lest they be too proud.

verses.part1: Let the mischief of their own lips fall upon the head of them
verses.part2: that compass me about.

verses.part1: Let hot burning coals fall upon them
verses.part2: let them be cast into the fire and into the pit, that they never rise up again.

verses.part1: A man full of words shall not prosper upon the earth
verses.part2: evil shall hunt the wicked person to overthrow him.

verses.part1: Sure I am that the Lord will avenge the poor
verses.part2: and maintain the cause of the helpless.

verses.part1: The righteous also shall give thanks unto thy Name
verses.part2: and the just shall continue in thy sight.

verses.part1: LORD, I call upon thee, haste thee unto me
verses.part2: and consider my voice when I cry unto thee.

verses.part1: Let my prayer be set forth in thy sight as the incense
verses.part2: and let the lifting up of my hands be an evening sacrifice.

verses.part1: Set a watch, O Lord, before my mouth
verses.part2: and keep the door of my lips.

verses.part1: O let not mine heart be inclined to any evil thing
verses.part2: let me not be occupied in ungodly works with the men that work wickedness, lest I eat of such things as please them.

verses.part1: Let the righteous rather smite me friendly
verses.part2: and reprove me.

verses.part1: But let not their precious balms break my head
verses.part2: yea, I will pray yet against their wickedness.

verses.part1: Let their judges be overthrown in stony places
verses.part2: that they may hear my words, for they are sweet.

verses.part1: Our bones lie scattered before the pit
verses.part2: like as when one breaketh and heweth wood upon the earth.

verses.part1: But mine eyes look unto thee, O Lord God
verses.part2: in thee is my trust, O cast not out my soul.

verses.part1: Keep me from the snare that they have laid for me
verses.part2: and from the traps of the wicked doers.

verses.part1: Let the ungodly fall into their own nets together
verses.part2: and let me ever escape them.

verses.part1: I CRIED unto the Lord with my voice
verses.part2: yea, even unto the Lord did I make my supplication.

verses.part1: I poured out my complaints before him
verses.part2: and shewed him of my trouble.

verses.part1: When my spirit was in heaviness thou knewest my path
verses.part2: in the way wherein I walked have they privily laid a snare for me.

verses.part1: I looked also upon my right hand
verses.part2: and saw there was no man that would know me.

verses.part1: I had no place to flee unto
verses.part2: and no man cared for my soul.

verses.part1: I cried unto thee, O Lord, and said
verses.part2: Thou art my hope, and my portion in the land of the living.

verses.part1: Consider my complaint
verses.part2: for I am brought very low.

verses.part1: O deliver me from my persecutors
verses.part2: for they are too strong for me.

verses.part1: Bring my soul out of prison, that I may give thanks unto thy Name
verses.part2: which thing if thou wilt grant me, then shall the righteous resort unto my company.

verses.part1: HEAR my prayer, O Lord, and consider my desire
verses.part2: hearken unto me for thy truth and righteousness' sake.

verses.part1: And enter not into judgement with thy servant
verses.part2: for in thy sight shall no man living be justified.

verses.part1: For the enemy hath persecuted my soul; he hath smitten my life down to the ground
verses.part2: he hath laid me in the darkness, as the men that have been long dead.

verses.part1: Therefore is my spirit vexed within me
verses.part2: and my heart within me is desolate.

verses.part1: Yet do I remember the time past; I muse upon all thy works
verses.part2: yea, I exercise myself in the works of thy hands.

verses.part1: I stretch forth my hands unto thee
verses.part2: my soul gaspeth unto thee as a thirsty land.

verses.part1: Hear me, O Lord, and that soon, for my spirit waxeth faint
verses.part2: hide not thy face from me, lest I be like unto them that go down into the pit.

verses.part1: O let me hear thy loving-kindness betimes in the morning, for in thee is my trust
verses.part2: shew thou me the way that I should walk in, for I lift up my soul unto thee.

verses.part1: Deliver me, O Lord, from mine enemies
verses.part2: for I flee unto thee to hide me.

verses.part1: Teach me to do the thing that pleaseth thee, for thou art my God
verses.part2: let thy loving Spirit lead me forth into the land of righteousness.

verses.part1: Quicken me, O Lord, for thy Name's sake
verses.part2: and for thy righteousness' sake bring my soul out of trouble.

verses.part1: And of thy goodness slay mine enemies
verses.part2: and destroy all them that vex my soul; for I am thy servant.

verses.part1: BLESSED be the Lord my strength
verses.part2: who teacheth my hands to war, and my fingers to fight;

verses.part1: My hope and my fortress, my castle and deliverer, my defender in whom I trust
verses.part2: who subdueth my people that is under me.

verses.part1: Lord, what is man, that thou hast such respect unto him
verses.part2: or the son of man, that thou so regardest him?

verses.part1: Man is like a thing of nought
verses.part2: his time passeth away like a shadow.

verses.part1: Bow thy heavens, O Lord, and come down
verses.part2: touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.

verses.part1: Cast forth thy lightning, and tear them
verses.part2: shoot out thine arrows, and consume them.

verses.part1: Send down thine hand from above
verses.part2: deliver me, and take me out of the great waters, from the hand of strange children;

verses.part1: Whose mouth talketh of vanity
verses.part2: and their right hand is a right hand of wickedness.

verses.part1: I will sing a new song unto thee, O God
verses.part2: and sing praises unto thee upon a ten-stringed lute.

verses.part1: Thou hast given victory unto kings
verses.part2: and hast delivered David thy servant from the peril of the sword.

verses.part1: Save me, and deliver me from the hand of strange children
verses.part2: whose mouth talketh of vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of iniquity.

verses.part1: That our sons may grow up as the young plants
verses.part2: and that our daughters may be as the polished corners of the temple.

verses.part1: That our garners may be full and plenteous with all manner of store
verses.part2: that our sheep may bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our streets.

verses.part1: That our oxen may be strong to labour, that there be no decay
verses.part2: no leading into captivity, and no complaining in our streets.

verses.part1: Happy are the people that are in such a case
verses.part2: yea, blessed are the people who have the Lord for their God.

verses.part1: I WILL magnify thee, O God, my King
verses.part2: and I will praise thy Name for ever and ever.

verses.part1: Every day will I give thanks unto thee
verses.part2: and praise thy Name for ever and ever.

verses.part1: Great is the Lord, and marvellous worthy to be praised
verses.part2: there is no end of his greatness.

verses.part1: One generation shall praise thy works unto another
verses.part2: and declare thy power.

verses.part1: As for me, I will be talking of thy worship
verses.part2: thy glory, thy praise, and wondrous works;

verses.part1: So that men shall speak of the might of thy marvellous acts
verses.part2: and I will also tell of thy greatness.

verses.part1: The memorial of thine abundant kindness shall be shewed
verses.part2: and men shall sing of thy righteousness.

verses.part1: The Lord is gracious and merciful
verses.part2: long-suffering and of great goodness.

verses.part1: The Lord is loving unto every man
verses.part2: and his mercy is over all his works.

verses.part1: All thy works praise thee, O Lord
verses.part2: and thy saints give thanks unto thee.

verses.part1: They shew the glory of thy kingdom
verses.part2: and talk of thy power;

verses.part1: That thy power, thy glory, and mightiness of thy kingdom
verses.part2: might be known unto men.

verses.part1: Thy kingdom is an everlasting kingdom
verses.part2: and thy dominion endureth throughout all ages.

verses.part1: The Lord upholdeth all such as fall
verses.part2: and lifteth up all those that are down.

verses.part1: The eyes of all wait upon thee, O Lord
verses.part2: and thou givest them their meat in due season.

verses.part1: Thou openest thine hand
verses.part2: and fillest all things living with plenteousness.

verses.part1: The Lord is righteous in all his ways
verses.part2: and holy in all his works.

verses.part1: The Lord is nigh unto all them that call upon him
verses.part2: yea, all such as call upon him faithfully.

verses.part1: He will fulfil the desire of them that fear him
verses.part2: he also will hear their cry, and will help them.

verses.part1: The Lord preserveth all them that love him
verses.part2: but scattereth abroad all the ungodly.

verses.part1: My mouth shall speak the praise of the Lord
verses.part2: and let all flesh give thanks unto his holy Name for ever and ever.

verses.part1: PRAISE the Lord, O my soul; while I live will I praise the Lord
verses.part2: yea, as long as I have any being, I will sing praises unto my God.

verses.part1: O put not your trust in princes, nor in any child of man
verses.part2: for there is no help in them.

verses.part1: For when the breath of man goeth forth he shall turn again to his earth
verses.part2: and then all his thoughts perish.

verses.part1: Blessed is he that hath the God of Jacob for his help
verses.part2: and whose hope is in the Lord his God;

verses.part1: Who made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that therein is
verses.part2: who keepeth his promise for ever;

verses.part1: Who helpeth them to right that suffer wrong
verses.part2: who feedeth the hungry.

verses.part1: The Lord looseth men out of prison
verses.part2: the Lord giveth sight to the blind.

verses.part1: The Lord helpeth them that are fallen
verses.part2: the Lord careth for the righteous.

verses.part1: The Lord careth for the strangers, he defendeth the fatherless and widow
verses.part2: as for the way of the ungodly, he turneth it upside down.

verses.part1: The Lord thy God, O Sion, shall be King for evermore
verses.part2: and throughout all generations.

verses.part1: O PRAISE the Lord, for it is a good thing to sing praises unto our God
verses.part2: yea, a joyful and pleasant thing it is to be thankful.

verses.part1: The Lord doth build up Jerusalem
verses.part2: and gather together the out-casts of Israel.

verses.part1: He healeth those that are broken in heart
verses.part2: and giveth medicine to heal their sickness.

verses.part1: He telleth the number of the stars
verses.part2: and calleth them all by their names.

verses.part1: Great is our Lord, and great is his power
verses.part2: yea, and his wisdom is infinite.

verses.part1: The Lord setteth up the meek
verses.part2: and bringeth the ungodly down to the ground.

verses.part1: O sing unto the Lord with thanksgiving
verses.part2: sing praises upon the harp unto our God;

verses.part1: Who covereth the heaven with clouds, and prepareth rain for the earth
verses.part2: and maketh the grass to grow upon the mountains, and herb for the use of men;

verses.part1: Who giveth fodder unto the cattle
verses.part2: and feedeth the young ravens that call upon him.

verses.part1: He hath no pleasure in the strength of an horse
verses.part2: neither delighteth he in any man's legs.

verses.part1: But the Lord's delight is in them that fear him
verses.part2: and put their trust in his mercy.

verses.part1: Praise the Lord, O Jerusalem
verses.part2: praise thy God, O Sion.

verses.part1: For he hath made fast the bars of thy gates
verses.part2: and hath blessed thy children within thee.

verses.part1: He maketh peace in thy borders
verses.part2: and filleth thee with the flour of wheat.

verses.part1: He sendeth forth his commandment upon earth
verses.part2: and his word runneth very swiftly.

verses.part1: He giveth snow like wool
verses.part2: and scattereth the hoar-frost like ashes.

verses.part1: He casteth forth his ice like morsels
verses.part2: who is able to abide his frost?

verses.part1: He sendeth out his word, and melteth them
verses.part2: he bloweth with his wind, and the waters flow.

verses.part1: He sheweth his word unto Jacob
verses.part2: his statutes and ordinances unto Israel.

verses.part1: He hath not dealt so with any nation
verses.part2: neither have the heathen knowledge of his laws.

verses.part1: O PRAISE the Lord of heaven
verses.part2: praise him in the height.

verses.part1: Praise him, all ye angels of his
verses.part2: praise him, all his host.

verses.part1: Praise him, sun and moon
verses.part2: praise him, all ye stars and light.

verses.part1: Praise him, all ye heavens
verses.part2: and ye waters that are above the heavens.

verses.part1: Let them praise the Name of the Lord
verses.part2: for he spake the word, and they were made; he commanded, and they were created.

verses.part1: He hath made them fast for ever and ever
verses.part2: he hath given them a law which shall not be broken.

verses.part1: Praise the Lord upon earth
verses.part2: ye dragons, and all deeps;

verses.part1: Fire and hail, snow and vapours
verses.part2: wind and storm, fulfilling his word;

verses.part1: Mountains and all hills
verses.part2: fruitful trees and all cedars;

verses.part1: Beasts and all cattle
verses.part2: worms and feathered fowls;

verses.part1: Kings of the earth and all people
verses.part2: princes and all judges of the world;

verses.part1: Young men and maidens, old men and children, praise the Name of the Lord
verses.part2: for his Name only is excellent, and his praise above heaven and earth.

verses.part1: He shall exalt the horn of his people; all his saints shall praise him
verses.part2: even the children of Israel, even the people that serveth him.

verses.part1: O SING unto the Lord a new song
verses.part2: let the congregation of saints praise him.

verses.part1: Let Israel rejoice in him that made him
verses.part2: and let the children of Sion be joyful in their King.

verses.part1: Let them praise his Name in the dance
verses.part2: let them sing praises unto him with tabret and harp.

verses.part1: For the Lord hath pleasure in his people
verses.part2: and helpeth the meek-hearted.

verses.part1: Let the saints be joyful with glory
verses.part2: let them rejoice in their beds.

verses.part1: Let the praises of God be in their mouth
verses.part2: and a two-edged sword in their hands;

verses.part1: To be avenged of the heathen
verses.part2: and to rebuke the people;

verses.part1: To bind their kings in chains
verses.part2: and their nobles with links of iron.

verses.part1: That they may be avenged of them, as it is written
verses.part2: Such honour have all his saints.

verses.part1: O PRAISE God in his holiness
verses.part2: praise him in the firmament of his power.

verses.part1: Praise him in his noble acts
verses.part2: praise him according to his excellent greatness.

verses.part1: Praise him in the sound of the trumpet
verses.part2: praise him upon the lute and harp.

verses.part1: Praise him in the cymbals and dances
verses.part2: praise him upon the strings and pipe.

verses.part1: Praise him upon the well-tuned cymbals
verses.part2: praise him upon the loud cymbals.

verses.part1: Let every thing that hath breath
verses.part2: praise the Lord.
